analyzed: āyurveda ādi śāstrāṇi divya śāstrāṇi sarvaśas
translated: The scriptures of Ayurveda and all divine scriptures

analyzed: upatasthuḥ mahā rājam dhyāna mātreṇa tam tadā
translated: appeared before the great king merely by his thought.

original: dhanurājagavaṃ nāma śarāśśṛṅgodbhavāś ca ye /🔽abhedyaṃ kavacaṃ caiva sadyastam upatasthire // / //
analyzed: dhanuḥ ājagavam nāma śarāḥ śṛṅga udbhavāḥ ca ye  abhedyam kavacam ca eva sadyas tam upatasthire
translated: The bow named Ajagava and the arrows born from the tips of horns,🔽and the impenetrable armor immediately appeared before him.

original: so 'bhiṣikto maghavatā devaiḥ sārddhaṃ ca bhārata /
analyzed: saḥ abhiṣiktaḥ maghavatā devaiḥ sārddham ca bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, he was consecrated by Shakra along with the gods.

original: dharmeṇa cākramal lokān sarvān viṣṇur iva kramaiḥ // / //
analyzed: dharmeṇa ca akramat lokān sarvān viṣṇuḥ iva kramaiḥ
translated: And by righteousness he conquered all the worlds, like Vishnu with his steps.

analyzed: pratihatam cakram pracacāra mahātmanaḥ
translated: The wheel of that great soul rolled unobstructed.

analyzed: śatāni ca eva rājānaḥ svayam eva upatasthire
translated: And a hundred kings themselves attended upon him.

analyzed: tasya evam abhavat pūrvam vasudhā vasudhā pate
translated: Such was his former state, O lord of the earth.

analyzed: tena iṣṭam vividhaiḥ yajñaiḥ bahubhiḥ ca āpta dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: He performed various sacrifices with abundant gifts.

analyzed: hṛṣṭa manāḥ mahā tejāḥ svadharmam prāpya puṣkalam
translated: With a delighted mind, the greatly energetic one, having attained abundant righteousness,

original: śakrasyārdhāsanaṃ dhīmān labdhavān amitadyutiḥ // / //🔽āpālitā ca pṛthivī tena dharmeṇa dhīmatā /
analyzed: śakrasya ardhāsanam dhīmān labdhavān amita dyutiḥ  āpālitā ca pṛthivī tena dharmeṇa dhīmatā
translated: the wise one of immeasurable splendor obtained half of Shakra's throne.🔽And the earth was protected by that wise one through righteousness.

analyzed: nirjitā śāsanāt eva sa ratna ākara pattanā
translated: Conquered by his command alone, with its cities and oceans,

analyzed: tad kṛtānām mahā rāja kratūnām dakṣiṇāvatām
translated: O great king, of the sacrifices performed by him with abundant gifts,

original: caturantā mahī vyāptā nāsīt kiṃcid anāvṛtam // / //
analyzed: catur antā mahī vyāptā na āsīt kiṃcid anāvṛtam
translated: the earth was covered in the four directions, nothing was left uncovered.

analyzed: daśa lakṣa sahasrāṇi rājyam tasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: The kingdom of that great soul was ten thousand leagues.

analyzed: tena dvādaśa vārṣikyām anāvṛṣṭyām mahātmanā
translated: By that great soul, during a twelve-year drought,

analyzed: vṛṣṭim ca sasya vṛddhi artham miṣatā vajrapāṇinā
translated: rain was caused for the growth of crops, while the wielder of the thunderbolt looked on.

analyzed: tena soma kula utpannaḥ gandharva adhipatiḥ mahān
translated: By him, the great lord of the Gandharvas, born in the lunar dynasty,

analyzed: gatvā samānayat megham pramathya abhihitaḥ śaraiḥ
translated: having gone and brought the cloud, was struck with arrows.

original: prajāś caturvidhās tena dhṛtās tatra mahātmanā // / //
analyzed: prajāḥ caturvidhāḥ tena dhṛtāḥ tatra mahātmanā
translated: By him, the great soul, the four types of beings were sustained there.

original: tenāptās tapasā lokāḥ sthāpitāḥ svena tejasā /
analyzed: tena āptāḥ tapasā lokāḥ sthāpitāḥ svena tejasā
translated: By him, the worlds were attained through austerities, established by his own brilliance.

analyzed: tasya eva deva vasati sthānam āditya tejasaḥ
translated: The abode of that very god, having the radiance of the sun,

analyzed: yasya puṇyatame deśe dṛśyate marakaṇṭakaḥ
translated: in the most sacred place of which, Amarakantaka is seen.

analyzed: iṣṭvā tatra kratu śatam oṅkārasya eva ca agratas
translated: Having performed a hundred sacrifices there, in front of Om,

original: rājñā ca parvate tasmin stotram etad udāhṛtam /🔽namaste kālameghāya kālātmaka namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: rājñā ca parvate tasmin stotram etat udāhṛtam  namaḥ te kāla meghāya kāla ātmaka namaḥ stu te
translated: and by the king, this hymn was uttered on that mountain.🔽Salutations to you, the dark cloud, salutations to you, the soul of time.

analyzed: kāla adhipam namaḥ te stu kāla rūpaḥ pravartase
translated: Salutations to you, the lord of time, you proceed in the form of time.

analyzed: kāla ātmā kāla rūpeṇa viśva ātmā viśva rūpa dhṛk
translated: The soul of time, in the form of time, the soul of the universe, the bearer of the form of the universe.

analyzed: viśveśvara namaḥ te stu kāla tyāge pravartakaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the lord of the universe, the instigator in the renunciation of time.

analyzed: bhavāya bhava nāśāya bhavodbhava namaḥ stu te
translated: For existence, for the destruction of existence, salutations to you, the origin of existence.

original: oṃ namo mahādevāya śambhavāya bhavāya ca /
analyzed: om namaḥ mahādevāya śambhavāya bhavāya ca
translated: Om, salutations to Mahadeva, to Shambhu, and to Bhava.

analyzed: ajapāya a jātāya
translated: To the unborn, to the unborn, to the unborn, to the abode of the unborn, to the one who has increased.

analyzed: prabhavāya śivatarāya akṣamāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the one who is the cause, to the one who is more auspicious, to the one who is beyond measure, salutations again and again.

original: tryambakāya trimūrtāya trilokeśāya te namaḥ // / //🔽akālāya ajarāya amarāya namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tryambakāya trimūrtāya triloka īśāya te namaḥ  akālāya ajarāya amarāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the three-eyed one, to the one with three forms, to the lord of the three worlds, salutations to you.🔽To the one who is beyond time, to the one who is ageless, to the one who is immortal, salutations again and again.

original: oṃkāramādidevaṃ ca ye vai dhyāyanti nityaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: oṃkāram ādidevam ca ye vai dhyāyanti nityaśas
translated: To those who always meditate on the syllable Om, the primordial god.

analyzed: na teṣām punarāvṛttiḥ ghore saṃsāra sāgare
translated: They do not return again to the terrible ocean of worldly existence.

original: śrutvā stotram idaṃ devaḥ oṃkāraḥ kālarūpadhṛk // / //
analyzed: śrutvā stotram idam devaḥ oṃkāraḥ kāla rūpadhṛk
translated: Having heard this hymn, the god Om, who assumes the form of time.

analyzed: pratyuvāca mahīpālam devadevaḥ umāpatiḥ
translated: Replied to the king, the god of gods, the lord of Uma.

original: varaṃ vṛṇīṣva bhadraṃ te stotreṇānena suvrata // / //
analyzed: varam vṛṇīṣva bhadram te stotreṇa anena suvrata
translated: Choose a boon, may you be fortunate, by this hymn, O one of good vows.

original: tuṣṭo 'smīti na sandeho yatheṣṭaṃ tad dadāmyaham /
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ smi iti na sandehaḥ yathā iṣṭam tat dadāmi aham
translated: I am pleased, there is no doubt, I will give you whatever you desire.

analyzed: māndhātā uvāca
translated: Mandhata said:

original: yadi tuṣṭo 'si deveśa varaṃ dātuṃ tvamicchasi // / //
analyzed: yadi tuṣṭaḥ si deveśa varam dātum tvam icchasi
translated: If you are pleased, O lord of gods, and wish to grant a boon.

analyzed: vaidūryaḥ nāma śaila indraḥ māndhātā ākhyānam arhati
translated: The lord of mountains named Vaidurya deserves to be called Mandhata.

original: devasthānam idaṃ deva tvat prasādād bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: deva sthānam idam deva tvat prasādāt bhaviṣyati
translated: O god, by your grace, this will become a divine abode.

original: atra dānaṃ tapaḥ pūjā tathā prāṇavisarjanam /
analyzed: atra dānam tapaḥ pūjā tathā prāṇa visarjanam
translated: Here, giving, austerity, worship, and the renunciation of life,

original: ye kurvanti narās teṣāṃ śivaloke nivāsitā // / //
analyzed: ye kurvanti narāḥ teṣām śiva loke nivāsi tā
translated: Those men who perform them are residents of Shiva's world.

analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā māndhātuḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: Having heard those words of Mandhata, the Supreme Lord,

analyzed: uvāca vacanam devaḥ māndhātāram mahīpatim
translated: The god spoke these words to King Mandhata:

analyzed: sarvam etat nṛpa śreṣṭha mad prasādāt bhaviṣyati
translated: All this, O best of kings, will happen by my grace.

original: evam astv iti taṃ coktvā varaṃ labdhvā mahīpati // / //
analyzed: evam astu iti tam ca uktvā varam labdhvā mahīpati
translated: Saying So be it to him and obtaining the boon, the king,

original: jagāma svāṃ purīṃ śīghraṃ yathā śakro 'marāvatīm /
analyzed: jagāma svām purīm śīghram yathā śakraḥ marāvatīm
translated: Quickly went to his own city, just as Shakra to Amaravati.

original: etat te sarvamākhyātaṃ māndhātuś caritaṃ mahat // / //
analyzed: etat te sarvam ākhyātam māndhātuḥ caritam mahat
translated: This is the great story of Mandhata that I have told you all.

original: yo mamāgre mahīpāla dṛṣṭo 'drir vai tvayānagha /
analyzed: yaḥ mama agre mahīpāla dṛṣṭaḥ driḥ vai tvayā anagha
translated: O sinless king, the mountain that you saw in front of me,

original: tadā prabhṛti māndhātā vaidūryo gīyate giriḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā prabhṛti māndhātā vaidūryaḥ gīyate giriḥ
translated: From that time onwards, the mountain Vaidurya is sung about as Mandhata.

analyzed: asya tīrthasya māhātmyāt māndhātṛ pramukhāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: By the greatness of this tirtha, kings headed by Mandhata,

analyzed: sarva kāma samudyuktāḥ loke krīḍanti vaiṣṇave
translated: Engaged in fulfilling all desires, play in the Vaishnava world.

analyzed: śravaṇāt kīrtanāt vā hayamedha phalam labhet
translated: By listening to or chanting about it, one attains the fruits of a horse sacrifice.

analyzed: iti śrī skandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe māndhātuḥ upākhyāne ṣṭāviṃśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the twenty-eighth chapter in the Skanda Purana, in the Revakhanda, in the story of Mandhata.

analyzed: rks adhyāya
translated: Chapter of Markandeya Purana

analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: kṛte yuge 'tha samprāpte balir nāma mahāsuraḥ /
analyzed: kṛte yuge tha samprāpte baliḥ nāma mahā asuraḥ
translated: In the Kṛta age, when it arrived, there was a great demon named Bali.

analyzed: tasya putraḥ mahā vīryaḥ sahasra bhuja viśrutaḥ
translated: His son was of great valor, known as Sahasrabhuja (Thousand-armed).

original: divyaṃ varṣasahasraṃ tu tena cārādhito haraḥ /
analyzed: divyam varṣa sahasram tu tena ca ārādhitaḥ haraḥ
translated: For one thousand divine years, Hara was propitiated by him.

original: tuṣṭena tena samproktaḥ prārthayasva varaṃ vara // / //
analyzed: tuṣṭena tena samproktaḥ prārthayasva varam vara
translated: Being pleased, he said, Choose a boon, O best one.

original: yatkiṃcid vai varaṃ proktaṃ tad dāsyāmi na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: yat kiṃcid vai varam proktam tat dāsyāmi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Whatever boon is mentioned, I will undoubtedly grant it.

original: bāṇāsuro vadaty evaṃ yadi tuṣṭo 'si me prabho // / //
analyzed: bāṇa asuraḥ vadati evam yadi tuṣṭaḥ si me prabho
translated: If you are pleased with me, O Lord, Vānasura speaks thus:

analyzed: puram bhavatu me divyam ajeyam sarva daivataiḥ
translated: Let there be a divine city for me, unconquerable by all the gods,

original: tvām eva varjayitvā tu duṣprāpyaṃ sarvadaivataiḥ // / //
analyzed: tvām eva varjayitvā tu duṣprāpyam sarva daivataiḥ
translated: excepting you alone, difficult to be attained by all the gods.

original: mayi tiṣṭhati yat tiṣṭhet mayi gacchati gacchatu /
analyzed: mayi tiṣṭhati yat tiṣṭhet mayi gacchati gacchatu
translated: Whatever stands when I stand, let it go when I go.

original: kāmikaṃ bhavanaṃ deva pura bhavatu me tadā // / //
analyzed: kāmikam bhavanam deva pura bhavatu me tadā
translated: O God, let that be my city, which is desirable.

analyzed: uktaḥ bāṇa asuraḥ tena bali putraḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Thus spoken to, Vāna, the son of Bali, of great fame,

original: viṣṇunābhihitaś cāsau kiṃ tvayā prārthito haraḥ // / //
analyzed: viṣṇunā abhihitaḥ ca asau kim tvayā prārthitaḥ haraḥ
translated: was addressed by Viṣṇu: What have you requested from Hara?

analyzed: bāṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Vāna said:

analyzed: mahyam dattam maheśena puram puravara uttamam
translated: The best of cities, an excellent city, has been given to me by Maheśa,

analyzed: ajeyam sarva devānām asurāṇām ca durlabham
translated: unconquerable by all the gods, difficult to be obtained by the demons.

original: yadi dattaṃ maheśena puraṃ tubhyaṃ yathepsitam /
analyzed: yadi dattam maheśena puram tubhyam yathā īpsitam
translated: If Mahesha has given you a city as desired,

original: mayā 'pi te pradattaṃ ca dvitīyaṃ tādṛśaṃ puram // / //
analyzed: mayā pi te pradattam ca dvitīyam tādṛśam puram
translated: I too have given you a second such city.

original: viṣṇunā 'pi puraṃ dattaṃ dvitīyaṃ ca manoramam /
analyzed: viṣṇunā pi puram dattam dvitīyam ca manoramam
translated: Vishnu also gave him a second delightful city.

original: ekībhūtau tu tau devāyūcatus tau baleḥ sutam // / //
analyzed: ekībhūtau tu tau devāyūcatuḥ tau baleḥ sutam
translated: The two gods, becoming one, spoke to the son of Bali:

analyzed: gaccha bāṇa asura kṣipram yatra āste kamalāsanaḥ
translated: Go quickly, O demon Bana, to where the lotus-seated one is.

original: gatas tatra baleḥ putro yatrātiṣṭhat pitāmahaḥ // / //
analyzed: gataḥ tatra baleḥ putraḥ yatra atiṣṭhat pitāmahaḥ
translated: The son of Bali went there, to where the grandfather was.

analyzed: pariṣvajya sva hastena pṛṣṭaḥ ca eva svayambhuvā
translated: He was embraced with his own hand and questioned by the self-existent one:

original: bahuvarṣasahasraṃ tu tapo ghoraṃ tvayā kṛtam // / //
analyzed: bahu varṣa sahasram tu tapaḥ ghoram tvayā kṛtam
translated: For many thousands of years, you have performed terrible austerities.

original: varas tu kastvayā prāptas tapasārādhya śaṅkaram /
analyzed: varaḥ tu kaḥ tvayā prāptaḥ tapasā ārādhya śaṅkaram
translated: But what boon have you obtained by propitiating Shankara with austerities?

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ vacanam śrutvā pratyuvāca mahā asuraḥ
translated: Having heard the words of Brahma, the great demon replied:

original: mayā tu prārthito rudro dattas tena prasādataḥ /
analyzed: mayā tu prārthitaḥ rudraḥ dattaḥ tena prasādataḥ
translated: Rudra was requested by me and given by him through grace.

analyzed: kāmarūpam puram prāptam manaḥ ramyam manoramam
translated: A city of Kamarupa, delightful and charming, was obtained.

original: tādṛśaṃ tu puraṃ dattaṃ dvitīyaṃ viṣṇunā punaḥ /
analyzed: tādṛśam tu puram dattam dvitīyam viṣṇunā punar
translated: A second such city was again given by Vishnu.

analyzed: bāṇa asura vacaḥ śrutvā pratyuvāca mahā asuram
translated: Having heard the words of demon Bana, he replied to the great demon:🔽O demon, I have given you a city like that, which is difficult to obtain.

original: tvayā tu prārthito rudro dattaṃ tena mahātmanā /
analyzed: tvayā tu prārthitaḥ rudraḥ dattam tena mahātmanā
translated: But Rudra was requested by you and granted by that great soul.

original: mayā 'pi te puraṃ dattaṃ tenāsau tripuraḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: mayā te puram dattam tena asau tripuraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: And by me also your city was given, therefore it is remembered as Tripura.

analyzed: evam prāpta varaḥ rājan mahā bala parākramaḥ
translated: Thus having obtained a boon, O king, of great strength and valor,

analyzed: sahasra bhuja vistīrṇaḥ tu avadhyaḥ sarva daivataiḥ
translated: with a thousand arms extended, you are invincible to all gods.

original: purāṇi dānavānāṃ tu amarāṇāṃ tu yāni ca // / //
analyzed: purāṇi dānavānām tu amarāṇām tu yāni ca
translated: The cities of the demons and the immortals,

analyzed: yakṣa vidyādharāṇām tu gandharvāṇām ca rakṣasām
translated: of the Yakshas, Vidyadharas, Gandharvas and Rakshasas,

original: bhagnāni tāni sarvāṇi sthaṇḍilāni hṛtāni ca // / //
analyzed: bhagnāni tāni sarvāṇi sthaṇḍilāni hṛtāni ca
translated: all of them were shattered, and the altars were taken away.

analyzed: bhagnā amarāvatī tena purā śakrasya bhārata
translated: By him, O Bharata, Amaravati, the city of Shakra, was shattered.

original: tripuraṃ hyabhavat sarvaṃ kailāsaḥ kevalaṃ pṛthak // / //
analyzed: tripuram hi abhavat sarvam kailāsaḥ kevalam pṛthak
translated: The entire Tripura became Kailash, separate and distinct.

analyzed: udvigna mānasāḥ devāḥ hara pārśvam upāyayuḥ
translated: With anxious minds, the gods went to Shiva's side.

original: varo dattas tvayā tasmai brahmaṇā viṣṇunāpi ca // / //
analyzed: varaḥ dattaḥ tvayā tasmai brahmaṇā viṣṇunā api ca
translated: A boon was granted to him by you, by Brahma and by Vishnu.

original: tena sārdhaṃ tu saṃgrāme śaktir nāstīti kasyacit /
analyzed: tena sārdham tu saṃgrāme śaktiḥ na asti iti kasyacid
translated: And to none of them is there any power in battle with him.

original: yas tasya puratas tiṣṭhet tam asau bhasmatāṃ nayet // / //
analyzed: yaḥ tasya puratas tiṣṭhet tam asau bhasma tām nayet
translated: He who would stand before him, he would reduce him to ashes.

original: evaṃ śrutvā śivo vākyaṃ paraṃ kautūhalaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: evam śrutvā śivaḥ vākyam param kautūhalam tatas
translated: Having heard these words, Shiva was filled with great curiosity.

analyzed: saṃpreṣitāḥ tadā devāḥ brahma viṣṇu purogamāḥ
translated: The gods, with Brahma and Vishnu at the forefront, were then sent.

analyzed: sametya gamyatām devāḥ triṃśat koṭyaḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: Having assembled, let the gods go, thirty crores of them, immensely powerful.

analyzed: vināśayata yatnena tripuram pura saṃsthitam
translated: Strive to destroy the three cities situated in the city.

original: tato gatāḥ surāḥ sarve baddhavairāḥ sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: tatas gatāḥ surāḥ sarve baddha vairāḥ sahasraśas
translated: Then all the gods went, with thousands of enemies,

analyzed: vāṇa asura puram yatra su tīkṣṇa niśita āyudhāḥ
translated: to the city of the demon Vāna, where the weapons were very sharp and keen.

analyzed: su yuddha bala sampannāḥ sarve te bala śālinaḥ
translated: All of them were endowed with the strength of good fighting, all of them were powerful,

original: mārgaṃ puraṃ ca deśaṃ ca chādayanto ghanā iva // / //
analyzed: mārgam puram ca deśam ca chādayantaḥ ghanāḥ iva
translated: covering the path, the city and the country like clouds.

analyzed: saṃkṣiptena eva kālena manasā cintitena ca
translated: In a very short time, just by thinking in the mind,

original: sarve te tripuraṃ prāptā dhanuḥ kṣiptāḥ śarā iva // / //
analyzed: sarve te tripuram prāptāḥ dhanuḥ kṣiptāḥ śarāḥ iva
translated: all of them reached the three cities, like arrows shot from a bow.

original: draṣṭuṃ daśa diśas tena preṣitā ye ca kiṅkarāḥ /
analyzed: draṣṭum daśa diśaḥ tena preṣitāḥ ye ca kiṅkarāḥ
translated: Those messengers who were sent by him to see the ten directions,

original: ūcur bāṇāsuraṃ te tu niścintas tvaṃ kathaṃ prabho // / //
analyzed: ūcuḥ bāṇa asuram te tu niścintaḥ tvam katham prabho
translated: they said to demon Vāna, O Lord, how can you be carefree?

analyzed: uktam bāṇa asureṇa varaḥ saphalaḥ mama
translated: Demon Vāna also said, Today my boon has become fruitful.

original: samīhitaphalaṃ prāptaṃ kuto gacchanti te surāḥ // / //
analyzed: samīhita phalam prāptam kutas gacchanti te surāḥ
translated: The desired fruit has been obtained. Where are those gods going?

original: tena te kṣaṇamātreṇa sarve devā jitās tadā /
analyzed: tena te kṣaṇa mātreṇa sarve devāḥ jitāḥ tadā
translated: By him, in just a moment, all those gods were conquered then.

original: hṛtāni ca tato 'strāṇi pātra bhojanaṃ yathā // / //
analyzed: hṛtāni ca tatas strāṇi pātra bhojanam yathā
translated: And then his weapons were taken away, like a vessel and food.

original: indrasyāpi hṛtaṃ vajraṃ cakraṃ vai keśavasya tu /
analyzed: indrasya api hṛtam vajram cakram vai keśavasya tu
translated: Indra's thunderbolt was taken away, as well as Keshava's discus.

original: jalaṃ pitāmahasyāpi pāśaṃ ca varuṇasya ca // / //
analyzed: jalam pitāmahasya api pāśam ca varuṇasya ca
translated: The Grandfather's water, and Varuna's noose,

analyzed: gadām ca eva marutaḥ ca aṅkuśam tathā
translated: Kubera's mace, and the Maruts' goad,

analyzed: yamasya apahṛtaḥ daṇḍaḥ śaktiḥ vaiśvānarasya ca
translated: Yama's staff, and Agni's spear,

analyzed: kāmarūpam puram tasya hara dattam prasādataḥ
translated: His city of Kamarupa was given to Hara by his grace.

analyzed: na śakyate suraiḥ sarvaiḥ brahma viṣṇu purogamaiḥ
translated: It cannot be assailed by all the gods, led by Brahma and Vishnu,

original: bādhituṃ daityarājasya samantān militair api /🔽surā bāṇāsureṇaiva tato yuddhe parājitāḥ // / //
analyzed: bādhitum daitya rājasya samantāt militaiḥ api  surāḥ bāṇa asureṇa eva tatas yuddhe parājitāḥ
translated: Even if they unite together from all sides, of the king of demons.🔽The gods were then defeated in battle by Bana Asura,

analyzed: bhagnāḥ tu utsāha rahitāḥ hara pārśvam upāgatāḥ
translated: Broken and devoid of enthusiasm, they approached Shiva's side.

original: śivenoktās tu te sarve tatra gatvā tu kiṃ kṛtam // / //
analyzed: śivena uktāḥ tu te sarve tatra gatvā tu kim kṛtam
translated: And all of them were told by Shiva, Having gone there, what was done?

original: saṃgrāmaḥ kīdṛśas tena bhavadbhiḥ saha nirmitaḥ /
analyzed: saṃgrāmaḥ kīdṛśaḥ tena bhavadbhiḥ saha nirmitaḥ
translated: What kind of battle was fought by you with him?

original: tataḥ kiṃ kathyate deva na śaktās tasya karmaṇi // / //
analyzed: tatas kim kathyate deva na śaktāḥ tasya karmaṇi
translated: Then what is to be said, O God? We were not able to do anything to him.

original: na tena saha saṃgrāme sammukhaṃ kenacit kṛtam /
analyzed: na tena saha saṃgrāme sammukham kenacid kṛtam
translated: No one faced him in battle.

analyzed: devatā vacanam śrutvā kruddhaḥ provāca śaṅkaraḥ
translated: Hearing the words of the gods, Shankara became angry and said:

analyzed: tripuram ca mahā duṣṭām imam vyāpādayāmi aham
translated: I will destroy this great and wicked Tripura.

original: athavā cāpam ākṛṣya hy asuraṃ pradahāmy aham // / //
analyzed: athavā cāpam ākṛṣya hi asuram pradahāmi aham
translated: Or, drawing my bow, I will burn up the demon.

original: yena jīvan naro yas tu surāṇāṃ kiṅkaro bhavet /
analyzed: yena jīvan naraḥ yaḥ tu surāṇām kiṅkaraḥ bhavet
translated: By which a living man would become the servant of the gods.

analyzed: pativratā prasādena ā tripuram ca sura asuraiḥ
translated: By the grace of the faithful wife, Tripura cannot be violated by gods and demons.

original: na śakyaṃ dharṣituṃ tasmān nāradaṃ preṣayāmy aham /
analyzed: na śakyam dharṣitum tasmāt nāradam preṣayāmi aham
translated: Therefore, I will send Narada there.

original: nāradaḥ preṣitas tatra kṣobhaya tvaṃ pativratāḥ // / //
analyzed: nāradaḥ preṣitaḥ tatra kṣobhaya tvam pativratāḥ
translated: Narada, you go there and disturb the faithful wives.

original: evam uktas tu devarṣir bāṇāsurapuraṃ yayau /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu devarṣiḥ bāṇa asura puram yayau
translated: Thus addressed, the divine sage went to the city of the demon Bana.

original: tvaritaṃ puramadhye tu yatra bāṇāsuro nṛpaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvaritam pura madhye tu yatra bāṇa asuraḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Quickly in the middle of the city, where King Bana the demon was.

original: taṃ tu deva ṛṣiṃ dṛṣṭvā hyasuro vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: tam tu devaḥ ṛṣim dṛṣṭvā hi asuraḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Seeing the divine sage, the demon spoke these words.

original: namaskṛtya ca sāṣṭāṅgam arghapādyaiḥ prapūjya ca // / //
analyzed: namaskṛtya ca sa aṣṭāṅgam arghapādyaiḥ prapūjya ca
translated: Having bowed down with eight limbs and worshipped with offerings and water for washing the feet, he said:

original: kuto 'trāgamanaṃ te 'dya kiṃ vā kāryaṃ mahāmune /
analyzed: kutas trā āgamanam te dya kim vā kāryam mahā mune
translated: From where have you come here today? What is the task, O great sage?

original: tasya tadvacanaṃ śrutvā muniḥ provāca taṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā muniḥ provāca tam tadā
translated: Hearing his words, the sage then spoke to him:

original: kuśalaṃ te baleḥ putrasādaraṃ tu punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: kuśalam te baleḥ putra sādaram tu punar punar
translated: Are you well, O son of Bali? With respect again and again.

analyzed: bāṇa asuraḥ bravīt vākyam kuśalam tava darśanāt
translated: Bāṇāsura said, By seeing you, I am well.

analyzed: devarṣiḥ upaviṣṭaḥ tu divya āsana su śobhitaḥ
translated: The divine sage was seated, adorned with a divine seat.

original: rājñī cābhyarcayat tatra sa tasyai nāradas tadā // / //
analyzed: rājñī ca abhyarcayat tatra sa tasyai nāradaḥ tadā
translated: And the queen there worshipped him, and Nārada then to her...

analyzed: purāṇa veda bāhyāni vṛttāni ādeśayat muniḥ
translated: The sage, teaching events outside the Purāṇas and Vedas,

original: nārīṇāṃ calitaṃ cittaṃ kṛtvā devamunis tadā // / //
analyzed: nārīṇām calitam cittam kṛtvā deva muniḥ tadā
translated: having made the minds of the women waver, the divine sage then...

analyzed: āgataḥ nāradaḥ śrīmān kailāsam parvata uttamam
translated: The glorious Nārada arrived at Kailāsa, the best of mountains.

analyzed: namaskṛtya mahādevam vṛttāntam saṃnyavedayat
translated: Having bowed to Mahādeva, he reported the events...

analyzed: ghātaya tripuram deva sa puram sura kaṇṭakam
translated: O God, destroy the triple city along with the city, the thorn of the gods.

original: nirgatas tu haras tasmāt kailāsanilayāt prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: nirgataḥ tu haraḥ tasmāt kailāsa nilayāt prabhuḥ
translated: The lord Hara then departed from that abode of Kailāsa...

analyzed: svakīyena eva mārgeṇa yatra sau tripura suraḥ
translated: By his own path, where that triple city of the demons was.
The goddess, Caṇḍeśvara, Nandin, Mahākāla, Maheśvara...

original: vṛṣo bhṛṅgiriṭiś caiva vighneśaḥ skanda eva ca /
analyzed: vṛṣaḥ bhṛṅgiriṭiḥ ca eva vighneśaḥ skandaḥ eva ca
translated: Vṛṣa, Bhṛṅgiriṭi, Vighneśa, Skanda,
Puṣpadanta, Mahāvīra, Ghaṇṭākarṇa, Mahodara...

analyzed: gomukhaḥ hastikarṇaḥ ca sthūlajaṅghaḥ vṛkodaraḥ
translated: Gomukha, Hastikarṇa, Sthūlajāṅgha, Vṛkodara,

analyzed: gaṇāḥ pañcadaśa tu ete hara tulya parākramāḥ
translated: These fifteen Gaṇas are equal to Hara in prowess.

analyzed: asti siddhaḥ mahā kṣetram śrīśailaḥ nāma parvataḥ
translated: There is a great Siddha (accomplished) holy place, a mountain named Śrīśaila.

original: tatra sthitvā mahādevo hantavyas tripuraḥ priye // / //
analyzed: tatra sthitvā mahādevaḥ hantavyaḥ tripuraḥ priye
translated: Having stayed there, O beloved, Mahādeva should kill Tripura.

original: sthānaṃ māheśvaraṃ cakre vyāpī tatra pinākadhṛk /
analyzed: sthānam māheśvaram cakre vyāpī tatra pinākadhṛk
translated: The all-pervading Pināka-wielding Lord made a place for Maheśvara.

original: ekapādena brahmāṇḍaṃ pātālaṃ cāpareṇa ca // / //🔽himavantaṃ dhanuḥ kṛtvā guṇaṃ kṛtvā tu vāsukim /
analyzed: eka pādena brahmāṇḍam pātālam ca apareṇa ca  himavantam dhanuḥ kṛtvā guṇam kṛtvā tu vāsukim
translated: With one foot he held the universe, and with the other the nether world.🔽Making the Himalayas his bow, and Vāsuki his string,

original: śaraṃ vaiśvānaraṃ kṛtvā tasyā 'graṃ kālam eva tu // / //
analyzed: śaram vaiśvānaram kṛtvā tasyāḥ kālam eva tu
translated: making Vaiśvānara his arrow, and Kāla its tip,

original: rathaṃ bhūmaṇḍalaṃ kṛtvā vedān kṛtvā hayāṃs tathā /
analyzed: ratham bhū maṇḍalam kṛtvā vedān kṛtvā hayān tathā
translated: making the earth's sphere his chariot, and the Vedas his horses,

analyzed: raśmīn takṣaka karkoṭau brahmāṇam sārathim svayam
translated: making Takṣaka and Karkoṭa his reins, and Brahmā his charioteer,

analyzed: cakrarakṣam vāsudevam aghoram mantra saptakam
translated: making Vāsudeva the protector of the wheel, and the seven mantras beginning with Aghora,

original: tathā pāśupataṃ caiva mantrarājaṃ tathaiva ca // / //
analyzed: tathā pāśupatam ca eva mantrarājam tathā eva ca
translated: as well as the Pāśupata mantra and the king of mantras,

original: divyaṃ varṣasahasraṃ tu sthānaṃ kṛtvā sthito 'bhavat /
analyzed: divyam varṣa sahasram tu sthānam kṛtvā sthitaḥ bhavat
translated: he remained in that place for a thousand divine years.

original: tiṣṭhato mama tatraiva kālena mahatā priye // / //
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ mama tatra eva kālena mahatā priye
translated: O beloved, while I was staying there for a long time,

analyzed: lakṣya alakṣye tanū kṛtvā gaṇeśaḥ vighnam ācarat
translated: Gaṇeśa, having made himself invisible, created an obstacle.

analyzed: vāma pāda nakha agreṇa calitaḥ sthānakāt aham
translated: I was moved from my place by the tip of the nail of his left foot.

original: tato mayā hato nā 'sau rakṣituṃ tripuraṃ katham /
analyzed: tatas mayā hataḥ nā sau rakṣitum tripuram katham
translated: Then, he was not killed by me. How can I protect Tripura?

analyzed: pravṛttaḥ si gaṇādhīśa jagat vidhvaṃsa kārakam
translated: You have started, O chief of the Ganas, to destroy the world.

original: iti tasya vacaḥ śrutvā vighneśo vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: iti tasya vacaḥ śrutvā vighneśaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Having heard these words of his, Vighnesha spoke these words:

original: ahaṃ na vighnaye tvāṃ cet katham anye 'rcayanti mām // / //
analyzed: aham na vighnaye tvām ced katham anye rcayanti mām
translated: If I do not obstruct you, how will others worship me?

original: apūjite mayi vibho yaḥ kāryaṃ kartum icchati /
analyzed: a pūjite mayi vibho yaḥ kāryam kartum icchati
translated: O Lord, to him who desires to do his duty when I am not worshipped,

analyzed: tasmai vighnam pradāsyāmi sura asura gaṇeṣu api
translated: I will give obstruction even among the hosts of gods and demons.

original: evam astv iti taṃ prāha śaṅkaraḥ tad anantaram /
analyzed: evam astu iti tam prāha śaṅkaraḥ tat anantaram
translated: Thus it is, said Shankara to him afterwards.

original: vadhyaṃ caiva gato lakṣyaṃ saṃśaktas tripuraṃ prati // / //
analyzed: vadhyam ca eva gataḥ lakṣyam saṃśaktaḥ tripuram prati
translated: And he became ready to kill Tripura, the target.

analyzed: tāpasaḥ yam durācāraḥ daityaḥ para puram jayaḥ
translated: This ascetic, this wicked Daitya, the conqueror of enemy cities,

original: vināśāyā 'sya duṣṭasya kaṃcāhaṃ preṣaye śaram // / //🔽tripurasya vadhārthāya kṣipraṃ pāśupataṃ mahat /
analyzed: vināśāya sya duṣṭasya kaṃ ca aham preṣaye śaram  tripurasya vadha arthāya kṣipram pāśupatam mahat
translated: for the destruction of this evil one, I will send some arrow.🔽For the sake of killing Tripura, I will quickly devise another great weapon, the Pashupata.

original: astram anyad vidhāsyāmīty uktvā devo haraḥ puram // / //
analyzed: astram anyat vidhāsyāmi iti uktvā devaḥ haraḥ puram
translated: Having said this, Lord Hara went to the city.

analyzed: aghora astreṇa tat dagdham tri khaṇḍam jarjarīkṛtam
translated: That Tripura was burnt by the Aghora weapon, reduced to three pieces and shattered.

original: pātitaṃ tu jale tatra tato māṃ śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ // / //
analyzed: pātitam tu jale tatra tatas mām śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: Then they fell into the water and sought refuge in me.

original: bhavāni dānavaiḥ sārddhaṃ teṣāṃ patnyaḥ sutekṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: bhavāni dānavaiḥ sārddham teṣām patnyaḥ suta īkṣaṇāḥ
translated: O Bhavani, the wives of those Danavas, with beautiful eyes, along with the Danavas,

analyzed: āpatanti rudantyaḥ tāḥ sahasraśas
translated: Came down crying in hundreds and thousands.

original: sarvāsāṃ nirdayo vahṇiḥ sa dadāha patīṃs tathā /
analyzed: sarvāsām nirdayaḥ vahṇiḥ sa dadāha patīn tathā
translated: The merciless fire burnt all of them and their husbands.

analyzed: śrīśaile patitam ca ekam anyat cāmara kaṇṭake
translated: One fell on Shri Parvata, another on Amarakantaka,

analyzed: gaṅgāsāgara sambhede tṛtīyam ca tathā priye
translated: And the third, O beloved, at the confluence of Ganga and the ocean.

analyzed: putra pautra kalatrāṇi maṇi hema purāṇi ca
translated: Sons, grandsons, wives, cities of jewels and gold,

original: vināśaṃ yānti tān yatra liṅgamekaṃ na naśyati /
analyzed: vināśam yānti tān yatra liṅgam ekam na naśyati
translated: All of them perish, but the Linga alone is not destroyed.

analyzed: liṅgānām nava koṭīnām yadi ekam api dahyate
translated: If even one of the nine crores of Lingas is burnt,

analyzed: prāṇatyāgam kariṣyāmi hutāśe smin tadā dhruvam
translated: Then I will certainly give up my life in this fire.

original: dagdhaṃ tu tripuraṃ kṛtsnam aghorāstreṇa dāruṇam // / //
analyzed: dagdham tu tripuram kṛtsnam aghora astreṇa dāruṇam
translated: The entire Tripura was completely burnt by the terrible Aghora weapon,

analyzed: pātitam narmadā madhye jvalat kāla anala prabham
translated: And fell in the middle of the Narmada, shining like the fire of destruction.

analyzed: tat bhittvā sapta pātālam rasātala talam yayau
translated: Having pierced the seven nether worlds, it went to the bottom of Rasatala.

original: tena jāleśvaraṃ tīrthaṃ triṣu lokeṣu viśrutam /
analyzed: tena jāleśvaram tīrtham triṣu lokeṣu viśrutam
translated: Therefore, the Jaleshvara tirtha is famous in the three worlds.

analyzed: arcanāt tasya devasya mucyate brahma hatyayā
translated: By worshipping that deity, one is freed from the sin of killing a brahmin.
For thousands of crores of kalpas, one dwells happily in Shiva's abode.

original: tatra snātvā divaṃ yānti ye mṛtā na punarbhavāḥ // / //🔽tilodakapradānena piṇḍapātena bhārata /
analyzed: tatra snātvā divam yānti ye mṛtāḥ na punarbhavāḥ  tila udaka pradānena piṇḍapātena bhārata
translated: Those who die after bathing there go to heaven and are not reborn.🔽By offering water mixed with sesamum seeds and food, O descendant of Bharata,

original: pitaras tasya tṛpyanti śivo yāvac ca kalpagā // / //🔽sārddhakoṭiś ca liṅgānāṃ gaṅgāsāgarasaṅgame /
analyzed: pitaraḥ tasya tṛpyanti śivaḥ yāvat ca kalpa gā  sārddha koṭiḥ ca liṅgānām gaṅgāsāgara saṅgame
translated: his ancestors are satisfied as long as the river Kalpaga flows.🔽There are five crore and half a crore of lingas at the confluence of Ganga and the ocean.

original: sārddhakoṭiś ca patitā liṅgānāṃ puravardhane // / //🔽daśārdhakoṭiḥ patitā śrīśaile tripurāntike /
analyzed: sārddha koṭiḥ ca patitā liṅgānām pura vardhane  daśārdha koṭiḥ patitā śrīśaile tripura antike
translated: Five crore and half a crore of lingas have fallen in the city of Vardhana.🔽Fifteen crore have fallen at Shrishaila near Tripura.

analyzed: tisraḥ koṭyā ardha koṭī ca patitā amarakaṇṭake
translated: Three crore and half a crore have fallen at Amarakantaka.

analyzed: etāni bāṇaliṅgāni bhukti mukti pradāni tu
translated: These are the lingas of Bana, which bestow enjoyment and emancipation.

original: tripuraghnam aghorāstraṃ jvalatkālāgnirudravat // / //🔽kalpagāṃ varjayitvā tu kānyā dhārayituṃ kṣamā /
analyzed: tripura ghnam aghora astram jvalat kālāgni rudra vat  kalpagām varjayitvā tu kā anyā dhārayitum kṣamā
translated: The weapon of Aghora, the destroyer of Tripura, blazes like the fire of destruction.🔽Except for the river Kalpaga, which other can bear it?

analyzed: etādṛśam tu patitam tat astram kalpagā jale
translated: Such is the weapon that has fallen into the waters of Kalpaga.

original: jāleśvaraṃ tu kathitaṃ tripuraghnam idaṃ tava /
analyzed: jāleśvaram tu kathitam tripura ghnam idam tava
translated: This is said to be Jaleshvara, the destroyer of Tripura, for you.

original: etat tīrthaṃ na jānanti lokāśca sacarācarāḥ // / //
analyzed: etat tīrtham na jānanti lokāḥ ca sa carācarāḥ
translated: The moving and unmoving beings in the world do not know this holy place.

analyzed: dahantam tripuram dṛṣṭvā devāḥ vismayam āgatāḥ
translated: Seeing Tripura being burned, the gods were amazed.

original: brahmādyā devatā yena saṃgrāmeṣu parājitāḥ // / //🔽śareṇaikena tadvīryaṃ kṛtaṃ bhasmaikapuñjavat /
analyzed: brahma ādyāḥ devatāḥ yena saṃgrāmeṣu parājitāḥ  śareṇa ekena tat vīryam kṛtam bhasma eka puñja vat
translated: By whom Brahma and other gods were defeated in battles.🔽With a single arrow, that valor was reduced to a single heap of ashes.

original: bāṇāsuraḥ pure dagdhe bhītaḥ stotramidaṃ jagau // / //
analyzed: bāṇa asuraḥ pure dagdhe bhītaḥ stotram idam jagau
translated: When the city was burned, the demon Bana, frightened, sang this hymn.

analyzed: om namaḥ nādideva īśa vighneśvara maheśvara
translated: Om, salutations to the primordial lord of gods, the lord of obstacles, the great lord.

analyzed: sarvajña ajñāna hṛt jñāna pradāna eka namaḥ stu te
translated: To the omniscient one, the one who takes away knowledge, the one who bestows knowledge alone, salutations to you.

analyzed: ananta guṇa ratnāya pareśāya namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to the one with infinite qualities and jewels, to the supreme lord.

analyzed: parātpara para atīta utpatti sthāna kāraka
translated: Beyond the supreme, transcending the supreme, the cause of the place of origination.

analyzed: sarva artha sādhana upāya viśveśvara namaḥ stu te
translated: The means of accomplishing all goals, the lord of the universe, salutations to you.

analyzed: nirañjana nirādhāra svabhāva nirupadrava
translated: The stainless one, the unsupported one, the one of natural form, the one without calamity.

analyzed: prasanna parameśāna yogeśvara namaḥ stu te
translated: The delighted supreme lord, the lord of yoga, salutations to you.

analyzed: asura ghna piśāca ghna bhūta vetāla nāśana
translated: The destroyer of demons, the destroyer of ghosts, the destroyer of spirits and vampires.

analyzed: bhūtanātha jagannātha sarva ādhāra namaḥ stu te
translated: The lord of spirits, the lord of the world, the support of all, salutations to you.

analyzed: sṛṣṭi saṃhāra nirvāṇa sapta pātāla saṃśraya
translated: The support of creation, dissolution, nirvana, and the seven netherworlds.

analyzed: śrīkaṇṭha nīlakaṇṭha īśa mahākaṇṭha namaḥ stu te
translated: O Shankara, Nilakantha, Maheshvara, salutations to you.

original: tryambakāya triśūlāya trilokāya ca te namaḥ // / //
analyzed: tryambakāya triśūlāya trilokāya ca te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the three-eyed one, the trident-bearer, the three worlds.

analyzed: kapāline kapālaiḥ ca baddha aṅga śaśiśekhara
translated: O skull-bearer, bound with skulls, moon-crested,

analyzed: umā kānta ardha dehāya sura asura namaskṛta
translated: O consort of Uma, half-bodied, worshipped by gods and demons.

original: yatra tvaṃ rūpasaṃsthaṃ calamacalatanuṃ vyāpakaṃ lakṣyahīnaṃ tejo 'bhyantar marālaṃ ghanam aghanam ajaṃ sphāṭikaṃ sphāṭikābham /
analyzed: yatra tvam rūpa saṃstham calam acala tanum vyāpakam lakṣya hīnam tejaḥ bhyantar marālam ghanam aghanam ajam sphāṭikam sphāṭika ābham
translated: Where you are, the moving form, the immovable body, the all-pervading, the aimless, the inner swan, the dense, the non-dense, the unborn, the crystal, the crystal-like,

original: raktaṃ nīlaṃ ca pītaṃ sitam asitamanekālparūpaṃ prayuktaṃ madhyāntādivyapetaṃ sphuṭatanur ahitaṃ liṅgarūpaṃ namāmi // / //
analyzed: raktam nīlam ca pītam sitam asitam aneka alpa rūpam prayuktam madhya anta ādi vyapetam sphuṭa tanuḥ ahitam liṅga rūpam namāmi

original: imaṃ varam ahaṃ manye yadi tuṣṭo 'si me prabho // / //
analyzed: imam varam aham manye yadi tuṣṭaḥ si me prabho
translated: I consider this to be the boon, if you are pleased with me, O lord.

original: prāṇatyāge kṛte tatra brahmalokaṃ prayātu vai /
analyzed: prāṇatyāge kṛte tatra brahma lokam prayātu vai
translated: When life is given up there, let it go to Brahma's world.

original: evaṃ bhavatu rājendra brahmā provāca satvaram // / //
analyzed: evam bhavatu rāja indra brahmā provāca satvaram
translated: So be it, said Brahma to the king.

original: evamuktvā yayau brahmā rudralokaṃ suraiḥ saha /
analyzed: evam uktvā yayau brahmā rudra lokam suraiḥ saha
translated: Having said this, Brahma went to Rudra's world with the gods.

original: viṣṇuṃ caiva tato rājā sāṣṭāṅgaṃ ca yudhiṣṭhira // / //
analyzed: viṣṇum ca eva tatas rājā sa aṣṭāṅgam ca yudhiṣṭhira
translated: Then the king, O Yudhishthira, with eight limbs, to Vishnu,

analyzed: keśavam mādhavam viṣṇum govindam madhusūdanam
translated: to Keshava, Madhava, Vishnu, Govinda, Madhusudana,🔽Padmanabha, Hrishikesha, Sridhara, and Trivikrama,

analyzed: padmanābham hṛṣīkeśam śrīdharam ca trivikramam
translated: O king.

original: dāmodaraṃ vāsudevaṃ hariṃ ca praṇamāmy aham /
analyzed: dāmodaram vāsudevam harim ca praṇamāmi aham
translated: I bow to Dāmodara, Vāsudeva, and Hari.

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā śārṅga vanamālā vibhūṣaṇam
translated: Adorned with conch, discus, mace, Śārṅga bow, and forest garland,
The lord of the world, the lord of the universe, the lord of Śrī, the most knowledgeable of all,

analyzed: śrīkāntam śrīdharam śrīśam śrīnivāsam namāmi aham
translated: I bow to Śrīkānta, Śrīdhara, Śrīśa, Śrīnivāsa.

original: acyutānantayajñeśa yajñādhipa namo 'stu te /🔽ṛksāmātharvarūpāya yajñarūpāya te namaḥ // / //
analyzed: acyuta ananta yajñeśa yajñādhipa namaḥ stu te  ṛk sāma atharva rūpāya yajña rūpāya te namaḥ
translated: To Acyuta, Ananta, Yajñeśa, lord of sacrifices, salutations to you.🔽Salutations to you, the form of Ṛk, Sāman, and Atharva Vedas, the form of sacrifice.

analyzed: nṛsiṃha matsya vārāha kūrma rūpāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, in the forms of Nṛsiṃha, Matsya, Vārāha, and Kūrma.

analyzed: tīrtha yāna samārūḍha garuḍadhvaja te namaḥ
translated: I bow to you, mounted on the vehicle of pilgrimage, with the banner of Garuḍa.

analyzed: sahasra śirasam devam sakalam niṣkalam param
translated: To the thousand-headed god, the complete, the formless supreme,

analyzed: vedyam puruṣam adhyakṣam ādyam nārāyaṇam prabhum
translated: The knowable, the embodied being, the primordial lord Nārāyaṇa,

analyzed: praṇataḥ smi sadā devam daitya anta karaṇam harim
translated: I am always bowing to Hari, the god who destroys the demons.

analyzed: hiraṇya garbham bhū garbham yajña garbha amṛta udbhavam
translated: To Hiraṇyagarbha, the embryo of the earth, the embryo of sacrifice, the source of nectar,

analyzed: śrīgarbha jñāna garbhāya vāsudeva namaḥ stu te
translated: To the embryo of Śrī, the embryo of knowledge, salutations to you, Vāsudeva.

original: tvayā sṛṣṭaṃ jagatsarvaṃ carācaram idaṃ prabho // / //
analyzed: tvayā sṛṣṭam jagat sarvam carācaram idam prabho
translated: O lord, this entire moving and unmoving world is created by you,

original: sraṣṭā pālayitā tvaṃ vai hartā tvaṃ ca yuge yuge /
analyzed: sraṣṭā pālayitā tvam vai hartā tvam ca yuge yuge
translated: You are the creator, the protector, and the destroyer in every age.

analyzed: viśvatas cakṣuḥ avyaktaḥ vijñeyaḥ viśvatas mukhaḥ
translated: You are the all-seeing, unmanifest one, to be known as having faces in all directions.

original: viśvātmā viśvato devo vāsudevo namo 'stu te /
analyzed: viśvātmā viśvatas devaḥ vāsudevaḥ namaḥ stu te
translated: You are the soul of the universe, the all-pervading god, Vasudeva. Salutations to you.

original: tvamādityaś ca vāyuś ca tvamagnis tvaṃ ca candramāḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam ādityaḥ ca vāyuḥ ca tvam agniḥ tvam ca candramāḥ
translated: You are the sun, the wind, the fire, and the moon.

original: tvaṃ dhātā devadeveśa tvam indras tvaṃ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: tvam dhātā devadeva īśa tvam indraḥ tvam prajāpatiḥ
translated: You are the creator, the lord of the gods, Indra, and Prajapati.

analyzed: tvad prasādāt suraśreṣṭha yajña siddhiḥ mama abhavat
translated: By your grace, O best of gods, I have achieved success in my sacrifice.

analyzed: śrutvā stotram idam devaḥ śaṅkha cakra gadā dharaḥ
translated: Having heard this hymn, the god holding the conch, discus, and mace.

original: uvāca vacanaṃ satyaṃ varaṃ vṛṇu viśāmpate /
analyzed: uvāca vacanam satyam varam vṛṇu viśām pate
translated: Spoke these true words: Choose a boon, O lord of the people.

original: dadāmi te na saṃdeho yajñasiddhim avāpsyasi // / //
analyzed: dadāmi te na saṃdehaḥ yajña siddhim avāpsyasi
translated: I will grant it to you, there is no doubt. You will achieve success in your sacrifice.

analyzed: rājā uvāca  oṃkāra saumya bhāge tu liṅga rūpī janārdanaḥ
translated: The king said:🔽On the auspicious part of the syllable Om, Janardana in the form of a linga,

analyzed: vaidūrya śikharasya agre bhava tvam loka pāvanaḥ
translated: On the top of the peak of lapis lazuli, be the purifier of the world.

original: imaṃ varam ahaṃ manye yadi dātum ihecchasi /
analyzed: imam varam aham manye yadi dātum iha icchasi
translated: I consider this boon, if you wish to grant it here.

analyzed: yāsyanti vaiṣṇavam sthānam iha abhyarcya vidhānataḥ
translated: Having worshipped here according to the rules, they will go to the abode of Vishnu.

original: tiryagyoniṃ na gacchanti yamalokaṃ tathā narāḥ /
analyzed: tiryagyonim na gacchanti yama lokam tathā narāḥ
translated: They do not go to the animal realm, nor do men to the world of Yama.

original: prāṇatyāge kṛte tatra narā gacchanti te padam // / //
analyzed: prāṇatyāge kṛte tatra narāḥ gacchanti te padam
translated: When life is given up there, men go to that place.

analyzed: pitṝṇām anna dānena pitaraḥ vaiṣṇavam padam
translated: By the gift of food to the ancestors, the ancestors attain Vishnu's abode.

original: prasādātte ca gacchantu satyaṃ satyaṃ vadāmy aham // / //
analyzed: prasādāt te ca gacchantu satyam satyam vadāmi aham
translated: By their grace, may they go. I speak the truth, the truth.

analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā rājñaḥ ca amita tejasaḥ
translated: Having heard those words of the king of immeasurable splendor,

analyzed: uvāca vacanam viṣṇuḥ indradyumnam viśām pate
translated: Vishnu spoke these words to Indradhyumna, O lord of the people.

analyzed: avatāram kariṣyāmi iha eva nṛpa sattama
translated: I will incarnate right here, O best of kings.

analyzed: sarvam eva nṛpa śreṣṭha mad prasādāt bhaviṣyati
translated: By my grace, everything will happen, O best of kings.

analyzed: evam uktvā yayau devaḥ śaṅkha cakra gadā dharaḥ
translated: Having said this, the god who holds the conch, discus, and mace,

analyzed: sura asuraiḥ stūyamānaḥ tridivam prati bhārata
translated: was praised by gods and demons and went to heaven, O descendant of Bharata.

original: eṣa te kathito rājann indradyumna mahādhvaraḥ /
analyzed: eṣa te kathitaḥ rājan indradyumna mahā adhvaraḥ
translated: Thus, O king, the great sacrifice of Indradhyumna has been told to you.

analyzed: tena asau parvataḥ puṇyaḥ sarva lokeṣu viśrutaḥ
translated: By that, this mountain is sacred and famous in all the worlds.

original: siddheśvaraṃ ca brahmāṇaṃ viddhi nārāyaṇaṃ harim /
analyzed: siddheśvaram ca brahmāṇam viddhi nārāyaṇam harim
translated: Know that the lord of the Siddhas is Brahma and Narayana is Hari.

analyzed: śravaṇāt kīrtanāt asya viṣṇu loke mahīyate
translated: By hearing and chanting about him, one is honored in Vishnu's world.

original: tatas tuṣṭāva tīrthāni rājā satyavrate sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tuṣṭāva tīrthāni rājā satyavrate sthitaḥ
translated: Then the king, firm in his vow of truth, praised the holy places.

original: pitṛṇāṃ tāraṇārthāya tīrthebhyaś ca namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: pitṛṇām tāraṇa arthāya tīrthebhyaḥ ca namaḥ namaḥ
translated: For the sake of liberating the ancestors, salutations again and again to the holy places.

analyzed: tīrthāni ūcuḥ
translated: The holy places said:

original: varaṃ vṛṇu mahābhāga yatte manasi vartate /
analyzed: varam vṛṇu mahābhāga yat te manasi vartate
translated: Choose a boon, O greatly fortunate one, whatever is in your mind.

original: tīrthānāṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā indradyumna uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: tīrthānām vacanam śrutvā indradyumnaḥ uvāca ha
translated: Having heard the words of the holy places, Indradyumna said:

analyzed: oṃkāra sannidhau tīrthe sthātavyam mad anugrahāt
translated: By my grace, you should remain in the holy place near Om.

original: evam astv iti rājānam uktvā cakruḥ saritstutim // / //🔽kalpagāṃ tvāṃ namaskurmo harasya paramāṃ kalām /
analyzed: evam astu iti rājānam uktvā cakruḥ sarit stutim  kalpa gām tvām namaskurmaḥ harasya paramām kalām
translated: Saying So be it to the king, they praised the rivers.🔽We bow to you, the river Kalakuta, the supreme energy of Shiva,

analyzed: atīva sarva lokānām bhuvi khyātām sarit varām
translated: The most famous river on earth, far superior to all the worlds.

original: nāsmat prabhāvataḥ pūtā kiṃtu pūtā svabhāvataḥ /
analyzed: na asmat prabhāvataḥ pūtā kiṃtu pūtā svabhāvataḥ
translated: You are not purified by our power, but are pure by nature,

original: yadvatsūryaprabhā puṇyā vahṇeś cāpi prabhā yathā // / //
analyzed: yadvat sūrya prabhā puṇyā vahṇeḥ ca api prabhā yathā
translated: Just as the light of the sun is meritorious, and just as the light of fire,

analyzed: himāṃśoḥ ca eva rāja indra tathā evā iyam mahā nadī
translated: And just as the light of the moon, O lord of kings, so is this great river.

original: ityuktvā taṃ ca rājānaṃ tīrthāny antardadhustadā // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā tam ca rājānam tīrthāni antardadhuḥ tadā
translated: Having said this to the king, the holy places then disappeared.

original: tatastuṣṭāva gaṅgāṃ vā arghaṃ dattvā nṛpottamaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tuṣṭāva gaṅgām vā argham dattvā nṛpa uttamaḥ
translated: Then the best of kings, having offered a respectful offering, praised the Ganges:

original: gaṅgā bhāgīrathī devī tathā bhogavatī śubhā // / //
analyzed: gaṅgā bhāgīrathī devī tathā bhogavatī śubhā
translated: Ganga, Bhagirathi, the auspicious goddess Bhogavati,
Jahnvi, the bestower of liberation, the auspicious one, the savior, the destroyer of sins,

analyzed: svarge mandākinī ca eva devadeva namaskṛtā
translated: Mandakini in heaven, worshipped by the gods of gods,

original: gāyatrī vedamātā tvam umā kātyāyanī tathā /
analyzed: gāyatrī veda mātā tvam umā kātyāyanī tathā
translated: You are Gayatri, the mother of the Vedas, Uma, and Katyayani.

original: kim anyad api te devi hareṇa śirasā dhṛtā // / //
analyzed: kim anyat api te devi hareṇa śirasā dhṛtā
translated: What else is there, O goddess, that is held on Hari's head?

analyzed: kasya asti śaktiḥ stotum tvām ṛte candra ardha śekharāt
translated: Who has the power to praise you except the one with the crescent moon on his head?

analyzed: gaṅgā uvāca
translated: Ganga said:

analyzed: tuṣṭā smi te mahā rāja varam yācasva suvrata
translated: I am pleased with you, great king. Ask for a boon, O one of good vows.

original: gaṅgāyā vacanaṃ śrutvā rājā tāṃ pratyuvāca ha /
analyzed: gaṅgāyāḥ vacanam śrutvā rājā tām pratyuvāca ha
translated: Having heard the words of Ganga, the king replied to her:

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: yadi tuṣṭā 'si deveśi varaṃ dātum ihecchasi // / //
analyzed: yadi tuṣṭā si deveśi varam dātum iha icchasi
translated: If you are pleased, O goddess of gods, and wish to grant a boon here,

analyzed: iha eva kriyatām vāsaḥ varaḥ eṣa pradīyatām
translated: may you stay here itself. May this boon be granted.

analyzed: gaṅgā uvāca
translated: Ganga said:

original: evaṃ bhavatu rājendra bhāgenaiva vahāmy aham // / //
analyzed: evam bhavatu rāja indra bhāgena eva vahāmi aham
translated: So be it, O Indra among kings. I will flow with my own part.

original: tatas tuṣṭāva gaṅgā tu kalpagāṃ saritāṃ varām /
analyzed: tatas tuṣṭāva gaṅgā tu kalpa gām saritām varām
translated: Then Ganga praised Kalpaga, the best of rivers:

analyzed: śreṣṭhā tvam kalpa ge devi namaskārye cira āyuṣi
translated: You are the best, O Kalpaga goddess, to be worshipped for a long life.

original: tvat toyasya prabhāveṇa pāvitryam abhavac ca me /
analyzed: tvat toyasya prabhāveṇa pāvitryam abhavat ca me
translated: By the power of your water, I have become pure.

original: kalpānte tu kṣayaṃ yānti saritaḥ sāgarādayaḥ // / //
analyzed: kalpa ante tu kṣayam yānti saritaḥ sāgara ādayaḥ
translated: At the end of the kalpa, the rivers, oceans, and all the holy places

analyzed: tīrthāni ca eva sarvāṇi tvam eva atra eva tiṣṭhasi
translated: will perish, but you alone will remain here.

analyzed: pūjyā tridaśa vandyā ca subhage cira gaminī
translated: You are to be worshipped, revered by the gods, and of auspicious fortune, going for a long time...

analyzed: gaurī samā jaṭā agre vai hara mūrtiḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will have the form of Shiva on the top of your matted locks, equal to Gauri.

original: evam uktvā tato gaṅgā namaskṛtya ca mekalām // / //
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas gaṅgā namaskṛtya ca mekalām
translated: Having said this, Ganga then bowed to Mekala...

analyzed: divya yāna samārūḍhā stūyamānā apsaraḥ gaṇaiḥ
translated: mounted on a divine chariot, being praised by groups of celestial nymphs.

analyzed: sarasvatī uvāca
translated: Sarasvati said:

analyzed: duhitā ham tava hi eṣā dharmataḥ paripālitā
translated: This is your daughter, protected by you according to dharma...

analyzed: sapta kalpa vahe dhanye tvad śuśrūṣā parāyaṇā
translated: O blessed one, carrying for seven kalpas, devoted to serving you.

analyzed: āgatā aham mahābhāge tvat pāda abja didṛkṣayā
translated: I have come, O illustrious one, with a desire to see your lotus feet...

analyzed: snānam kartum tathā devi caturviṃśati vatsaraiḥ
translated: and to bathe, O goddess, for twenty-four years.

original: kiṃ na vetsi mahābhāge māṃ dhareśvari vāhini // / //
analyzed: kim na vetsi mahābhāge mām dharā īśvari vāhini
translated: Do you not know me, O illustrious one, O goddess of the earth, O bearer of the world...

analyzed: kariṇī rūpam āsthāya koṭitīrthe samāgatā
translated: having assumed the form of a female elephant, I have come to the Koti Tirtha.

analyzed: sapāda koṭi tīrthāni candra sūrye same grahe
translated: With one and a half crore tirthas, when the sun and moon are in conjunction...

original: snānārthaṃ kalpage devi ādiṣṭā viṣṇunā svayam /
analyzed: snāna artham kalpa ge devi ādiṣṭā viṣṇunā svayam
translated: O Goddess! For the sake of bathing, you were instructed by Vishnu himself at Kalpaga.

analyzed: dvāparasya caturtha aṃśe kuru pāṇḍava senayoḥ
translated: In the fourth part of Dvapara, for the sake of the battle between the armies of Kuru and Pandava,

analyzed: yuddha artham samitau puñjam sarva tīrtha maye śubhe
translated: in the auspicious confluence of all the holy places,

original: tatra yad dīyate dānaṃ tapyate 'tha tapas tathā // / //
analyzed: tatra yat dīyate dānam tapyate tha tapaḥ tathā
translated: whatever gifts are given there, whatever austerities are performed,

original: sarvaṃ śataguṇaṃ taddhi tvat toye kalpage punaḥ /
analyzed: sarvam śataguṇam tat hi tvat toye kalpa ge punar
translated: all that becomes hundred times more effective in your waters at Kalpaga.

analyzed: tat eva koṭi guṇitam rāhu graste divākare
translated: That becomes crore times more effective when the sun is eclipsed by Rahu.

original: evam uktvā mahārāja kalpagāṃ ca sarasvatī /🔽indradyumnaṃ ca rājānaṃ svasthānaṃ cābhyagāt punaḥ // / //
analyzed: evam uktvā mahā rāja kalpa gām ca sarasvatī  indradyumnam ca rājānam sva sthānam ca abhyagāt punar
translated: Having said this, O great king, Saraswati and Kalpga,🔽and King Indradyumna, returned to their own abodes.

original: indradyumnas tato rājā svayaṃ tuṣṭāva bhārata /
analyzed: indradyumnaḥ tatas rājā svayam tuṣṭāva bhārata
translated: Then King Indradyumna himself praised, O descendant of Bharata.

original: tvat toyasya prabhāveṇa pitṛdevāś ca tārpitāḥ // / //
analyzed: tvat toyasya prabhāveṇa pitṛ devāḥ ca tā arpitāḥ
translated: By the power of your water, the ancestors and gods have been satisfied.

original: pavitraṃ ca tvayā devi trailokyaṃ sacarācaram /
analyzed: pavitram ca tvayā devi trailokyam sa carācaram
translated: O Goddess! You have purified the three worlds with their moving and unmoving beings.

analyzed: tvam mātā sarva bhūtānām nṛṇām saṃsāra tāriṇī
translated: You are the mother of all beings, the savior of men from the cycle of birth and death.

analyzed: mekalā asi mahādevi kalpagā narmadā tathā
translated: You are Mekala, the great Goddess, and also Kalpga Narmada.

analyzed: jalapūrṇā iti vikhyātā vindhya parvata bhūṣaṇam
translated: You are known as Jalapūrṇā, the ornament of the Vindhya mountain.

original: api varṣasahasreṇa kaḥ stotuṃ ca kṣamaḥ śubhe /
analyzed: api varṣa sahasreṇa kaḥ stotum ca kṣamaḥ śubhe
translated: O auspicious one, who is capable of praising (you) even in a thousand years?

original: śrutvā stotram idaṃ devī nṛpasyāsya tadā 'bravīt // / //
analyzed: śrutvā stotram idam devī nṛpasya asya tadā bravīt
translated: Having heard this praise, the Goddess then spoke to the king:

original: kṣatriyāṇāṃ sahasrais tu kṛto yajño 'tra pārthiva /
analyzed: kṣatriyāṇām sahasraiḥ tu kṛtaḥ yajñaḥ pārthiva
translated: O king, a sacrifice has been performed here by thousands of Kshatriyas.

original: sadṛśas te mahārāja na bhūto na bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: sadṛśaḥ te mahā rāja na bhūtaḥ na bhaviṣyati
translated: O great king, there has never been, nor will there be, one like you.

original: varaṃ dadāmi te rājan yena siddhim avāpsyasi /
analyzed: varam dadāmi te rājan yena siddhim avāpsyasi
translated: O king, I grant you a boon by which you will attain perfection.

original: tasyās tad vacanaṃ śrutvā kalpagāyā yudhiṣṭhira // / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā kalpa gāyāḥ yudhiṣṭhira
translated: O Yudhishthira, having heard those words of Kalpaga,

original: prahasann abravīd rājā brāhmaṇaiḥ sahitas tadā /
analyzed: prahasan abravīt rājā brāhmaṇaiḥ sahitaḥ tadā
translated: the king, accompanied by the Brahmins, then spoke with a smile:

analyzed: śiva bhakti paraḥ nityam sapta kalpa vahe śubhe
translated: O auspicious one, who carries (water) for seven Kalpas, I am always devoted to Shiva.

original: yadi tuṣṭā 'si me devi varaṃ dātuṃ tvamicchasi /
analyzed: yadi tuṣṭā si me devi varam dātum tvam icchasi
translated: If you are pleased with me, O Goddess, and wish to grant a boon,

analyzed: pravāhān kuru sapta tvam dakṣiṇa uttara kūlayoḥ
translated: create seven streams on the southern and northern banks,

original: sarvataḥ sarvage devi yadi māṃ bahu manyase /
analyzed: sarvatas sarvage devi yadi mām bahu manyase
translated: O Goddess who pervades everywhere, if you esteem me highly,

original: sārddhaṃ dvādaśa lakṣaṃ tu dattaṃ tatra pravartate /
analyzed: sārddham dvādaśa lakṣam tu dattam tatra pravartate
translated: There, one-and-a-half lakhs are given, it proceeds there.

original: tat tulyaṃ tu bhavet sarvaṃ koṭitīrthe na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: tat tulyam tu bhavet sarvam koṭitīrthe na saṃśayaḥ
translated: All that is equal to Kotitirtha, there is no doubt.

analyzed: nyāya upārjita vittasya rāhu graste divākare
translated: The wealth earned through justice, when the sun is eclipsed by Rahu,

original: nānāvidhaṃ tu puṇyaṃ ca mataṃ vai parikīrtitam // / //
analyzed: nānāvidham tu puṇyam ca matam vai parikīrtitam
translated: Various kinds of merit are considered and declared.

analyzed: brahma viṣṇu śiva uktam ca pramāṇa sarva sammatam
translated: The statement of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva is accepted as evidence by all.

analyzed: alpa sattvāḥ narāḥ rājan kāle māyā vimohitāḥ
translated: O King! Men of little strength, deluded by Maya in time,

original: oṃkāraṃ ye na paśyanti tathā vai saptakalpagām /
analyzed: oṃkāram ye na paśyanti tathā vai sapta kalpa gām
translated: Those who do not see Om and the river of seven kalpas,

analyzed: go chāgayoḥ mahā rāja hema rūpye yat antaram
translated: The difference between a cow and a goat, gold and silver,

analyzed: śūdra brāhmaṇayoḥ yadvat yathā vat dadhi takrayoḥ
translated: As between a Shudra and a Brahmin, as between curd and buttermilk,

analyzed: amareśvaratīrtham hi jñeyam tīrtha antaraiḥ saha
translated: The Amarasvara Tīrtha should be known along with other holy places.

analyzed: dīyate koṭitīrthe yat guñjā mātram hiraṇyakam
translated: The gold given at Koṭitīrtha, even if it is just a gunjā measure,

original: tasya saṃkhyā na vidyate yāvad āhūta saṃplavam // / //
analyzed: tasya saṃkhyā na vidyate yāvat āhūta saṃplavam
translated: its number is not known until the end of the world.

analyzed: catur hasta pramāṇam tu koṭitīrtham na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Koṭitīrtha is undoubtedly four cubits in size.

original: hastamātraṃ tathā cānye vitastiṃ ca tathā 'pare // / //
analyzed: hasta mātram tathā ca anye vitastim ca tathā pare
translated: Others say it is one cubit, and still others say it is a vitasti (i.e. a span).

analyzed: catur aṅgula mayam ke kecid aṅgula mānataḥ
translated: Some say it is four aṅgulas, some say it is a finger's width,

analyzed: arddha aṅgulam yava mātram brahmasūtra pramāṇataḥ
translated: half an aṅgula, or a barley grain in size, according to the size of the brahma-sūtra (i.e. the thread used by Brahmins in certain rituals).

analyzed: caturviṃśe dvādaśa abde kurukṣetrāt sarasvatī
translated: In the twenty-fourth year, in the month of Mārgaśīrṣa, Sarasvatī came from Kurukṣetra

analyzed: koṭitīrthe tathā snātum rāhu graste divākare
translated: to bathe at Koṭitīrtha when the sun was eclipsed by Rāhu.

analyzed: kariṇī rūpam āsthāya āyāt sva puṇyaka kṣayāt
translated: She assumed the form of a female elephant and came from her own meritorious region.

original: snānaṃ kṛtvā punaryāti kurukṣetraṃ na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: snānam kṛtvā punar yāti kurukṣetram na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Having bathed, she again goes to Kurukṣetra, there is no doubt.

analyzed: kāverīsaṅgamam yāvat ārabhyaḥ dadhisaṅgamam
translated: From the confluence of Kāverī up to the confluence of Dadhi,

analyzed: atrā antare mahā rāja tīrtha koṭyaḥ daśa smṛtāḥ
translated: in between these, O great king, ten million holy places are remembered.

analyzed: koṭitīrtham samārabhya nīlagaṅgā avasānataḥ
translated: From Koṭitīrtha up to the end of Nīlagaṅgā,

analyzed: aṣṭa lakṣāṇi tīrthānām brahmasūtra pramāṇataḥ
translated: There are eight hundred thousand holy places, according to the measure of Brahma's thread.

analyzed: kāveryāḥ pūrva bhāge ca yāvat paryaṅka parvataḥ
translated: On the eastern side of the Kaveri, up to the Paryanka mountain,

original: daśa lakṣāṇi tīrthānāṃ saṃkhyā ca kathitā tava // / //
analyzed: daśa lakṣāṇi tīrthānām saṃkhyā ca kathitā tava
translated: The number of holy places is said to be ten hundred thousand.

analyzed: narmadāyām samāsādya jamadagneḥ mahā āśramam
translated: Having reached the great hermitage of Jamadagni on the Narmada,

analyzed: śrīkaṇṭham nīlakaṇṭham ca liṅgam pāpa praṇāśanam
translated: The Shiva lingas Shrikantha and Neelakantha, which destroy sins,

analyzed: kanyātīrtham mahā puṇyam kapileśvaram uttamam
translated: The extremely sacred Kanya tirtha, the excellent Kapileshwara,

analyzed: kapilāvarta saṃjñam tu tīrtham pāpa haram param
translated: And the supreme sin-destroying tirtha called Kapilavarta,

original: tatra pūṣā ca sūryas tu śivadhyānaparāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatra pūṣā ca sūryaḥ tu śiva dhyāna parāyaṇaḥ
translated: There, Pushya, the Sun, was devoted to meditation on Shiva.

original: divyaṃ varṣasahasraṃ tu tapas tepe suduṣkaram // / //
analyzed: divyam varṣa sahasram tu tapaḥ tepe su duṣkaram
translated: He performed austerities for a thousand divine years, which is extremely difficult.

original: tatas tuṣṭaḥ sureśānas tam uvāca tadā nṛpa /
analyzed: tatas tuṣṭaḥ sureśānaḥ tam uvāca tadā nṛpa
translated: Then the Lord of the gods was pleased and said to him, O king,

original: varaṃ vṛṇīṣva bhadraṃ te yat te manasi vartate // / //
analyzed: varam vṛṇīṣva bhadram te yat te manasi vartate
translated: Choose a boon, may you be fortunate, whatever is in your mind.

analyzed: pūṣā uvāca
translated: Pushya said:

original: yadi tuṣṭo 'si deveśa varaṃ dātuṃ tvam icchasi /
analyzed: yadi tuṣṭaḥ si deveśa varam dātum tvam icchasi
translated: If you are pleased, O Lord of gods, and wish to grant a boon,

analyzed: sūryapiṅgala saṃjñam tu liṅgam parama siddhi dam
translated: The Shiva linga called Suryapingala, which grants supreme accomplishments,

analyzed: ākāśe pratapat raśmi sahasra aṃśu sama prabham
translated: Shining like a thousand rays of the sun in the sky,

analyzed: māse māse nyamitraḥ tu saṃkramaḥ ca anya rāśiṣu
translated: and the Sun moves to another sign every month.

original: imaṃ varam ahaṃ manye jagad dyotanakārakam /
analyzed: imam varam aham manye jagat dyotana kārakam
translated: I consider this boon to be the cause of illuminating the world.

analyzed: īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

analyzed: sarva sampad samṛddhiḥ te mad prasādāt bhaviṣyati
translated: By my grace, you will have all prosperity and wealth.

original: kṛte yuge mahārāja mayaitad dṛṣṭam eva ca /
analyzed: kṛte yuge mahā rāja mayā etat dṛṣṭam eva ca
translated: In the Kṛta age, O great king, this has been seen by me.

analyzed: caturdaśyām tathā ṣṭamyām piṅgaleśvara pūjanāt
translated: By worshipping Piṅgaleśvara on the fourteenth and eighth lunar days,

analyzed: koṭi yajña phalam prāpya śiva loke mahīyate
translated: one attains the fruit of a crore sacrifices and is honored in Śiva's world.

analyzed: revā tīreṣu ye devāḥ krośa mātram svayaṃbhuvaḥ
translated: Those gods on the banks of Revā, a kṛośa away from the self-existent one,

original: sarve te siddhidā jñeyāḥ kāmabhogaphalapradāḥ /🔽kecit kūṣmāṇḍamātrā vai kecidvai puṣpamātrakāḥ // / //
analyzed: sarve te siddhi dāḥ jñeyāḥ kāma bhoga phala pradāḥ  kecid kūṣmāṇḍa mātrāḥ vai kecid vai puṣpa mātrakāḥ
translated: all of them should be known as givers of accomplishments, bestowers of the fruits of sensual enjoyments.🔽Some are the size of a pumpkin, some are the size of a flower,

analyzed: eraṇḍa phala mātrāḥ ca vajra mauktika mānataḥ
translated: some are the size of an eranda fruit, some are the size of a diamond or pearl.

original: kṛte maṇimayāḥ proktās tretāyāṃ tu hiraṇmayāḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛte maṇi mayāḥ proktāḥ tretāyām tu hiraṇmayāḥ
translated: In the Kṛta age, they are said to be made of jewels, in the Tretā age they are made of gold,

original: dvāpare raupyatāmrāś ca kalau cāśmamayāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: dvāpare raupya tāmrāḥ ca kalau ca aśma mayāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: in the Dvāpara age they are made of silver and copper, and in the Kali age they are remembered as being made of stone.

original: brāhmaṃ kṛtayugaṃ prāhus tretāṃ vai kṣatriyaṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: brāhmam kṛta yugam prāhuḥ tretām vai kṣatriyam tathā
translated: The Kṛta age is said to be of Brahmā, the Tretā age is of the Kṣatriyas,

original: dvāparaṃ vaiśyam ity evaṃ kaliṃ śūdraṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: dvāparam vaiśyam iti evam kalim śūdram tathā eva ca
translated: Dvāpara is said to be the Vaishya, and Kali is the Shudra.

analyzed: na a puṇya liṅgam āsādya mriyate marakaṇṭake
translated: One does not die without attaining the auspicious embrace of Amarakantaka.

analyzed: kaḥ na mucyeta kaunteya sapta janma ja kilbiṣāt
translated: O son of Kunti, who would not be freed from the sins of seven births?

analyzed: yādṛśaḥ yam giriḥ puṇyaḥ sarvatas marakaṇṭakaḥ
translated: Such is this meritorious mountain Amarakantaka on all sides.

analyzed: tādṛśam na anupaśyāmi triṣu lokeṣu bhārata
translated: I do not see such a place in the three worlds, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: parvatasya samantāt tu tīrtha koṭiḥ vyavasthitā
translated: All around the mountain, there are ten million holy places.

analyzed: svarga sopānam āsādya prātyakṣam śiva darśanam
translated: Having reached the stairway to heaven, one sees Shiva directly.

analyzed: su puṇyam koṭitīrtham vai tathā ca amarakaṇṭakam
translated: The extremely meritorious Koti Tīrtha and Amarakaṇṭaka
are known to grant heaven and liberation, and bestow all accomplishments.

original: vaidūryaparvate siddho māndhātā ca kṛte yuge // / //
analyzed: vaidūrya parvate siddhaḥ māndhātā ca kṛte yuge
translated: In the Kṛta age, Māndhātṛ became accomplished on the Vaidūrya mountain.

analyzed: kathitaḥ nṛpa śārdūla tathā anyat kathayāmi te
translated: O tiger among kings, it has been told. I shall now tell you something else.

analyzed: kāverīsaṅgamaḥ puṇyaḥ sarva lokeṣu viśrutaḥ
translated: The confluence of Kāverī is auspicious and famous in all the worlds.

original: tatra snātvā divaṃ yānti ye mṛtā na punarbhavāḥ /
analyzed: tatra snātvā divam yānti ye mṛtāḥ na punarbhavāḥ
translated: Having bathed there, those who die go to heaven and are not reborn.

analyzed: kāveryām bhūtajābhaume vyatīpātaḥ yadā bhavet
translated: When there is a Vyatīpāta on the Kāverī river on the Bhūta Jā Bhūmi,🔽O king, one should perform a Śrāddha there. The ancestors are satisfied for a long time.

original: sahasraguṇitaṃ puṇyaṃ bhavet tasyās tu saṅgame /
analyzed: sahasra guṇitam puṇyam bhavet tasyāḥ tu saṅgame
translated: The merit of her confluence would be a thousand times more.

analyzed: śastreṇa nihatāḥ ye vai tila miśra ambu dānataḥ
translated: Those who are killed by weapons, by offering water mixed with sesamum seeds,

analyzed: te ca ekoddiṣṭa śrāddhena svarga lokam avāpnuyuḥ
translated: they would attain the heavenly world by a single-offering śrāddha.

original: cāṇḍālād guhakāt sarpād vidyuto brāhmaṇād api // / //
analyzed: cāṇḍālāt guhakāt sarpāt vidyutaḥ brāhmaṇāt api
translated: From a cāṇḍāla, a guhyaka, a snake, lightning, even from a brāhmaṇa,

original: daṃṣṭribhyaś ca paśubhyaś ca maraṇaṃ pāpakarmiṇām /
analyzed: daṃṣṭribhyaḥ ca paśubhyaḥ ca maraṇam pāpa karmiṇām
translated: from fanged animals, and from other animals, the death of those of sinful deeds,

analyzed: sarve te nṛpa śārdūla kāverī saṅgame śubhe
translated: all of them, O tiger among kings, at the auspicious confluence of Kāverī,

original: śrāddhasya karaṇāt satyaṃ tṛptā yānti parāṃ gatim /
analyzed: śrāddhasya karaṇāt satyam tṛptāḥ yānti parām gatim
translated: by performing a śrāddha, truly being satisfied, attain the highest state.

analyzed: kubereṇa tapaḥ taptam divyam varṣa sahasrakam
translated: austerities were performed by Kubera for a thousand divine years,

analyzed: ārādhitaḥ pūjitaḥ ca loka nāthaḥ umāpatiḥ
translated: and the lord of the world, the consort of Umā, was propitiated and worshipped.

analyzed: śiva prasāda sampannaḥ lokapāla tvam āptavān
translated: Endowed with the grace of Śiva, he attained the status of a guardian of the world.

original: tatra yas tyajati prāṇāṃs tasya puṇyaphalaṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: tatra yaḥ tyajati prāṇān tasya puṇya phalam śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the meritorious fruit of him who gives up his life there.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭi varṣa sahasrāṇi deva rājyam avāpnuyāt
translated: He would obtain the kingdom of the gods for sixty thousand years.

original: avaśaḥ svavaśo vā 'pi prāṇatyāgaṃ karoti yaḥ /
analyzed: avaśaḥ svavaśaḥ vā pi prāṇatyāgam karoti yaḥ
translated: Whether helpless or in control of himself, he who gives up his life,

analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi rājā vaidyādhare pure
translated: for ten thousand years he would be a king in the city of Vidyādhara.

analyzed: revā kāverikaiḥ toyaiḥ tilaiḥ āraṇyakaiḥ tathā
translated: With the waters of the Revā and Kāverī, and with wild sesame seeds,

original: pitaras tarpitās tatra tṛptā yānti parāṃ gatim // / //
analyzed: pitaraḥ tarpitāḥ tatra tṛptāḥ yānti parām gatim
translated: The ancestors are satisfied there with the waters of Revā and Kāverī, and with the wild sesame seeds, and go to the highest state.

analyzed: nānā mukha sahasraiḥ tu kāverī prathitā bhuvi
translated: Kāverī is famous on earth with thousands of mouths.

analyzed: carācaram yathā vyāptam vāyunā sūrya raśmibhiḥ
translated: Just as the moving and unmoving is pervaded by air and the sun's rays,

original: tathā toyena kāveryā vyāptaṃ ca vasudhātalam /
analyzed: tathā toyena kāveryāḥ vyāptam ca vasudhā talam
translated: so the surface of the earth is pervaded by Kāverī's water.

analyzed: narmadā dakṣiṇe kūle vārāhe vindhya parvate
translated: On the southern bank of Narmadā, in the Varāhā region of the Vindhya mountain,

analyzed: pratyakṣā sarva devānām payoṣṇī nirgatā yatas
translated: where Payoṣṇī has emerged, directly visible to all the gods,

analyzed: somasya duhitā ca āsīt himagarbha indu śītalā
translated: she was the daughter of Soma, cool like snow and the moon.

analyzed: hareṇa ārādhitā pūrvam umā mūrtiḥ payasvinī
translated: In the past, the watery form of Umā was worshipped by Hari,

analyzed: lokānām tāraṇa arthāya somagaṅgā iti gīyate
translated: and for the sake of delivering the worlds, she is sung as Somāgaṅgā.

analyzed: viniṣkrāntā śarīrāt ca vārāhasya yaśasvinaḥ
translated: She emerged from the body of the illustrious Varāha.

original: tatra snātvā naro rājan bhave vai na punar bhavet // / //
analyzed: tatra snātvā naraḥ rājan bhave vai na punar bhavet
translated: O king, a man who bathes there becomes free from rebirth.

analyzed: tila udaka pradānena pitaraḥ tasya bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, by offering water with sesame seeds,

analyzed: daśa ayuta sahasrāṇi loke krīḍanti śāṅkare
translated: his ancestors play for ten thousand years in Śaṅkara's world.

analyzed: kārttikyām yat phalam tasya vārāhe vindhya parvate
translated: The fruits of bathing at Varaha on the Vindhya mountain in Kartika

original: saṃkhyā na śakyate snānād atra varṣaśatair api // / //
analyzed: saṃkhyā na śakyate snānāt atra varṣa śataiḥ api
translated: cannot be counted even in hundreds of years by bathing here.

analyzed: śivena kathitam pūrvam purāṇe skanda kīrtite
translated: This was said by Shiva in the Purana narrated by Skanda in the past.

original: tatra yad dīyate dānaṃ tasya saṃkhyā na vidyate // / //
analyzed: tatra yat dīyate dānam tasya saṃkhyā na vidyate
translated: The number of gifts given there cannot be known.

original: ye cārcayanti vārāhaṃ na te prākṛtamānuṣāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca arcayanti vārāham na te prākṛta mānuṣāḥ
translated: Those who worship Varaha are not ordinary humans.

analyzed: prāṇatyāge kṛte tatra śiva lokam avāpnuyuḥ
translated: Having given up their lives there, they attain Shiva's world.

analyzed: rāhu soma samāyoge vārāhe vindhya parvate
translated: On the conjunction of Rahu and Soma on Varaha mountain in Vindhya,

analyzed: kurukṣetra samam puṇyam purā vai śaṅkaraḥ bravīt
translated: in the past, Shankara said that it is as sacred as Kurukshetra.

analyzed: gireḥ ārabhya vārāhāt payoṣṇyāḥ saṅgama avadhi
translated: Beginning from Varaha mountain up to the confluence of Payoshni,

analyzed: atrā antare nṛpa śreṣṭha tīrtha koṭiḥ udāhṛtā
translated: in this interval, O best of kings, a crore of tirthas are mentioned.

analyzed: payoṣṇī saṅgame tatra somāvartaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: At the confluence of Payoshni, it is called Somavartta.

original: sa deśaḥ sarvataḥ puṇyaḥ satyam etat tavoditam // / //
analyzed: sa deśaḥ sarvatas puṇyaḥ satyam etat tava uditam
translated: That region is sacred everywhere, this is the truth that has been told to you.

analyzed: payoṣṇī saṅgame pāpa hare liṅgasya darśanāt
translated: By seeing the Liṅga at the confluence of Payoshni, the remover of sins,

original: tatra snānasya dānasya saṃkhyā kartuṃ na śakyate // / //
analyzed: tatra snānasya dānasya saṃkhyā kartum na śakyate
translated: the number of baths and gifts there cannot be counted.

analyzed: tāpī payoṣṇī saṃbhedaḥ candra sūrya grahe nṛpa
translated: The confluence of Tapti and Payoshni, O king, at the time of solar or lunar eclipse,

analyzed: kurukṣetrāt śataguṇaḥ śivena parikīrtitaḥ
translated: is declared by Shiva to be a hundred times more meritorious than Kuruksetra.

analyzed: caturbhujaḥ hariḥ yatra śrīpatiḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: Where Hari, the four-armed Lord of Shri, the Supreme Being,

original: viṣṇukṣetraṃ tu vijñeyaṃ krośamātraṃ tu tannṛpa // / //
analyzed: viṣṇukṣetram tu vijñeyam krośa mātram tu tat nṛpa
translated: is known as Vishnu's holy place, extending a krosha all around, O king.

analyzed: āśvinasya tu māsasya kṛṣṇa pakṣe caturdaśī
translated: The fourteenth day of the dark fortnight of the month of Asvina,

analyzed: amāvāsyā sinīvālī parvāṇi etāni anukramāt
translated: the new moon day, and Sinivali - these are the holy days in order.

analyzed: caturdaśyām catur yoge pīyūṣam vahate nṛpa
translated: On the fourteenth day, when there are four yogas, nectar flows, O king.

original: pitaras tṛptim āyānti dine tasmin na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: pitaraḥ tṛptim āyānti dine tasmin na saṃśayaḥ
translated: The ancestors become satisfied on that day, there is no doubt.

analyzed: surya grahe kurukṣetre yat phalam parikīrtitam
translated: The fruit declared at the solar eclipse in Kuruksetra,

analyzed: tāpī payoṣṇī samparke tad phalam parikīrtitam
translated: that fruit is declared at the confluence of Tapti and Payoshni.

original: dīpotsarge tu kaumudyāṃ phalaṃ saṃkhyā na vidyate /
analyzed: dīpotsarge tu kaumudyām phalam saṃkhyā na vidyate
translated: In the festival of lamps on the full moon day of Kartika, the fruit is innumerable.

original: puruṣaś cakravartī syād dīpaṃ tatra cakāra yaḥ // / //
analyzed: puruṣaḥ cakravartī syāt dīpam tatra cakāra yaḥ
translated: He who lights a lamp there becomes a universal emperor.

original: kārttikyām āśvine māsi pakṣayor ubhayor api /
analyzed: kārttikyām āśvine māsi pakṣayoḥ ubhayoḥ api
translated: In the month of Asvina, on both fortnights, on the full moon day of Kartika,

original: māsam ekaṃ na bhuñjīta tasya puṇyaphalaṃ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: māsam ekam na bhuñjīta tasya puṇya phalam śṛṇu
translated: one should not eat for one month. Listen to the meritorious fruit of that.

original: yāvac candraś ca sūryaś ca himavāṃś ca mahodadhiḥ /
analyzed: yāvat candraḥ ca sūryaḥ ca himavān ca mahā udadhiḥ
translated: As long as the moon, the sun, the Himalayas and the great ocean exist,

original: tāvat kālaṃ vaset svarge viṣṇuloke ca bhārata // / //
analyzed: tāvat kālam vaset svarge viṣṇu loke ca bhārata
translated: for that long one dwells in heaven and in Vishnu's world, O descendant of Bharata.

analyzed: narmadā dakṣiṇe bhittvā pātālāt tu samutthitam
translated: Having pierced the southern side of Narmada, it has arisen from the nether world.

analyzed: śrutvā tasya caritram ca pāpasya bho narādhipa

translated: completely freed from all sins by the power of this holy place,

analyzed: kīṭa pakṣi pataṅga ādi tiryak yoni gatāḥ narāḥ
