original: yathā śivas tathā revā pūjanīyā prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: yathā śivaḥ tathā revā pūjanīyā prayatnataḥ
translated: Just as Shiva is to be worshipped, so is Revakanaka to be worshipped with effort.

original: eṣu ye tu kukarmāṇaḥ pāpā dānavivārjitāḥ // / //
analyzed: eṣu ye tu ku karmāṇaḥ pāpāḥ dāna vivārjitāḥ
translated: Those who are of evil deeds, sinful, and devoid of charity,

original: pathā ghoreṇa te yānti dakṣiṇena yamālayam /
analyzed: pathā ghoreṇa te yānti dakṣiṇena yama ālayam
translated: They go by the terrible path to the south, to Yama's abode.

analyzed: ṣaṣ aśīti sahasrāṇi yojanānām samantataḥ
translated: The city should be known to be 86,400 yojanas all around,

analyzed: puram jñeyam mahā raudram nānā rūpaiḥ adhiṣṭhitam
translated: Inhabited by various forms, greatly terrible.

analyzed: samīpa stham iva ābhāti narāṇām krūra karmaṇām
translated: It appears to be near to men of cruel deeds.

original: pāpinām api dūrasthaṃ pathā raudreṇa yānti te /🔽tīvrakaṇṭakayuktena śarkarābhūṣitena ca // / //
analyzed: pāpinām api dūra stham pathā raudreṇa yānti te  tīvra kaṇṭaka yuktena śarkarā bhūṣitena ca
translated: Even those who are far away from sinners go along the terrible path of the wicked.🔽With sharp thorns, and adorned with gravel,

analyzed: kṣura dhārā vṛtaiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ pāṣāṇaiḥ nirmitena ca
translated: Covered with razor edges, and made of sharp stones.

original: kecit tv anena mahatā dārudāraiś ca ghātakaiḥ // / //🔽lohasūcībhir ugrābhir grastena ca kvacit kvacit /
analyzed: kecid tu anena mahatā dāru dāraiḥ ca ghātakaiḥ  loha sūcībhiḥ ugrābhiḥ grastena ca kvacid kvacid
translated: Some are struck by this great wood, and by the killers,🔽And in some places are devoured by fierce iron needles.

analyzed: latā pratāna viṣamaiḥ parvataiḥ vṛkṣa saṃkulaiḥ
translated: With creepers and vines, uneven with mountains, and crowded with trees,

analyzed: su tapta aṅgāra yuktena yānti mārgeṇa duḥkhitāḥ
translated: They go along a path full of burning coals, suffering.

analyzed: kvacid viṣam agartābhiḥ tapta loṣṭa iṣṭakaiḥ api
translated: In some places with pits of poison, and with heated clods and bricks,

original: sutaptabālukābhiś ca tathā tīkṣṇaiś ca śaṅkubhiḥ /
analyzed: sutapta bālukābhiḥ ca tathā tīkṣṇaiḥ ca śaṅkubhiḥ
translated: With very hot sand, and also with sharp stakes,

analyzed: aneka bhagna śākhābhiḥ āvṛtena kvacid kvacid
translated: In some places covered with many broken branches,

original: kaṣṭena tamasā kecid gacchanti hi yamālayam /
analyzed: kaṣṭena tamasā kecid gacchanti hi yama ālayam
translated: Some go with difficulty to Yama's abode, covered with darkness.

original: mārgasthāṅgārakais taptair grastā dāvāgnibhis tathā // / //🔽kvacit taptaśilābhiś ca paṅkena kaṭimānataḥ /
analyzed: mārga stha aṅgārakaiḥ taptaiḥ grastāḥ dāva agnibhiḥ tathā  kvacid tapta śilābhiḥ ca paṅkena kaṭi mānataḥ
translated: Seized by the burning coals on the path, and by forest fires,🔽In some places by heated rocks, and by mud up to the waist,

analyzed: kvacid duṣṭa ambunā vyāptam duṣkarīṣa agninā kvacid
translated: In some places pervaded by bad water, and by the fire of bad chaff,🔽In some places by the wind of the hair of the dead, and by the wind of the hair of the dead,🔽In some places by the wind of the hair of the dead, and by the wind of the hair of the dead,

original: kvacid gṛdhrair bakair vyāghrair duṣṭaiḥ kīṭaiḥ sudāruṇaiḥ /🔽kvacin mahākulīrādyaiḥ kvacit tvajagaraiḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: kvacid gṛdhraiḥ bakaiḥ vyāghraiḥ duṣṭaiḥ kīṭaiḥ su dāruṇaiḥ  kvacid mahākulīra ādyaiḥ kvacid tu ajagaraiḥ punar
translated: In some places, by vultures, herons, tigers, wicked and extremely terrible insects,🔽In some places by large mosquitoes and so on, in some places again by pythons,

original: makṣikābhiś ca raudrābhiḥ kvacit sarpair viṣolvaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: makṣikābhiḥ ca raudrābhiḥ kvacid sarpaiḥ viṣa ulvaṇaiḥ
translated: By terrible flies, in some places by snakes with virulent poison,

analyzed: matta mātaṅga yūthaiḥ ca samantāt ca pramāthibhiḥ
translated: By intoxicated herds of elephants, and by terrifying beings all around,

original: panthānamullikhadbhiś ca tīkṣṇaśṛṅgair mahābalaiḥ /🔽siṃhair viṣāṇamahiṣair raudrair mattaiś ca śvāpadaiḥ // / //
analyzed: panthānam ullikhadbhiḥ ca tīkṣṇa śṛṅgaiḥ mahā balaiḥ  siṃhaiḥ viṣāṇa mahiṣaiḥ raudraiḥ mattaiḥ ca śvāpadaiḥ
translated: By those with sharp horns and great strength, who are tearing up the path,🔽By lions, horned buffaloes, and fierce mad beasts,

original: ḍākinībhiś ca raudrābhir vikarālaiś ca rākṣasaiḥ /
analyzed: ḍākinībhiḥ ca raudrābhiḥ vikarālaiḥ ca rākṣasaiḥ
translated: By terrible female spirits and by terrible and hideous demons,

original: vyādhibhiś ca mahāghoraiḥ pāvakaiś ca durāsadaiḥ // / //🔽mahānalavimiśreṇa mahācaṇḍena vāyunā /
analyzed: vyādhibhiḥ ca mahā ghoraiḥ pāvakaiḥ ca durāsadaiḥ  mahā anala vimiśreṇa mahā caṇḍena vāyunā
translated: By extremely terrible diseases and by unapproachable fires,🔽By a great and extremely fierce wind mixed with a great fire,

analyzed: mahā pāṣāṇa varṣeṇa bhidyamānāḥ nirāśrayāḥ
translated: Being shattered by a great shower of stones, without support,

original: kvacit kvacit prataptena dīpyamānā vrajanti hi /🔽mahatā va bāṇavarṣeṇa bhidyamānāḥ samantataḥ // / //
analyzed: kvacid kvacid prataptena dīpyamānāḥ vrajanti hi  mahatā vaḥ bāṇa varṣeṇa bhidyamānāḥ samantataḥ
translated: In some places, burning as they go, heated by the sun,🔽Being shattered on all sides by a great shower of arrows,

analyzed: patadbhiḥ vajra saṅghātaiḥ ulkā pātaiḥ ca dāruṇaiḥ
translated: By falling masses of lightning and terrible meteors,

analyzed: pradīpta aṅgāra varṣeṇa hanyamānāḥ vrajanti hi
translated: And are struck by a rain of burning coals as they proceed.

analyzed: mahā ghora ravaiḥ ghoraiḥ vitrasyantaḥ muhur muhur
translated: Terrified again and again by the terrible and extremely terrible sounds,

original: niśitāyudhavarṣeṇa pūryamāṇāś ca sarvaśaḥ // / //🔽mahākṣarāmbudhārābhiḥ sicyamānā muhurmuhuḥ /
analyzed: niśita āyudha varṣeṇa pūryamāṇāḥ ca sarvaśas  mahā akṣara ambu dhārābhiḥ sicyamānāḥ muhur muhur
translated: And filled in every way by a rain of sharp weapons,🔽Constantly sprinkled by streams of cold water,

analyzed: mahā śītena raudreṇa kṣura dhārā ādibhiḥ tathā
translated: By the terrible and extremely cold, and by razor blades and so on,

analyzed: anyaiḥ bahuvidha ākāraiḥ sahasraśas
translated: And by many other kinds, in hundreds and thousands.

original: itthaṃ ca taptaraudreṇa mārgeṇa viṣameṇa ca // / //
analyzed: ittham ca tapta raudreṇa mārgeṇa viṣameṇa ca
translated: And in this way, by a path that is extremely hot, terrible, and uneven,

analyzed: aviśrāntena mahatā hi avidūreṇa bhārata
translated: Without rest, and very long, O descendant of Bharata,

analyzed: avidūreṇa kaṣṭena sarva duḥkha āśrayeṇa ca
translated: By a path that is not far, but difficult, and the abode of all suffering,

analyzed: nīyante dehinaḥ sarve mūḍhāḥ pāpa parāyaṇāḥ
translated: All embodied beings are led, the deluded ones who are devoted to sin,

analyzed: yama dūtaiḥ mahā ghoraiḥ yama ājñā kāribhiḥ balāt
translated: By Yama's messengers, who are extremely terrible, who obey Yama's orders, and who use force.

analyzed: ekākinaḥ para adhīnāḥ mitra bandhu vivarjitāḥ
translated: Alone, dependent on others, devoid of friends and relatives,

original: śocantaḥ svāni karmāṇi dahyante ca muhurmuhuḥ // / //
analyzed: śocantaḥ svāni karmāṇi dahyante ca muhur muhur
translated: Lamenting their own actions, they are burned again and again.

analyzed: preta bhūta vimiśrāḥ ca śuṣka kaṇṭha uṣṭha tālukāḥ
translated: Mixed with ghosts and spirits, with dry throats, lips, and palates,

analyzed: kṛśa aṅgāḥ bhīta bhītāḥ ca dahyamānāḥ huta agninā
translated: emaciated, frightened, and burning in the sacrificial fire.

original: baddhāḥ śṛṅkhalayā kecit majjantaḥ pāpino bhṛśam /
analyzed: baddhāḥ śṛṅkhalayā kecid majjantaḥ pāpinaḥ bhṛśam
translated: Some are bound with chains, and the sinful ones are sinking deeply.

analyzed: kṛṣyante dahyamānāḥ tu yama dūtaiḥ bala utkaṭaiḥ
translated: They are dragged and burned by Yama's messengers, who are powerful and strong.

original: urasyadhomukhasthāne tathaiva khalu duḥkhitāḥ /🔽keśapāśe vibaddhāś ca kṛṣyante pāpinas tathā // / //
analyzed: urasi adhomukha sthāne tathā eva khalu duḥkhitāḥ  keśa pāśe vibaddhāḥ ca kṛṣyante pāpinaḥ tathā
translated: In the region below the chest, facing downwards, they are indeed miserable.🔽The sinful ones are also dragged, bound by the noose of their hair.

original: lalāṭe cāśugair biddhvā kṛṣyante dehinaḥ kvacit /
analyzed: lalāṭe ca āśugaiḥ biddhvā kṛṣyante dehinaḥ kvacid
translated: In some places, the embodied beings are pierced in the forehead with sharp arrows and dragged.

analyzed: uttānāḥ duṣṭa panthānam nīyante pāpa karmaṇā
translated: With their faces upwards, the sinful ones are led along the evil path.

analyzed: pārśva bāhu vibaddhāḥ ca jaṭhare paripīḍitāḥ
translated: Some are bound by the sides and arms, and are oppressed in the belly.

original: grīvāpāśavikṛṣyāś ca ke 'pi yānti suduḥkhitāḥ // / //🔽jihvāśaṅkupradānena samānīyakṛkāṭikāḥ /
analyzed: grīvā pāśa vikṛṣyāḥ ca ke yānti su duḥkhitāḥ  jihvāśaṅku pradānena samānīya kṛkāṭikāḥ
translated: Some go along in great misery, dragged by the noose around their necks.

original: arddhacandreṇa gṛhyante kṣipyamāṇā itas tataḥ // / //🔽śiśne ca vṛṣaṇe caiva rajjvā baddhās tathā paro /🔽vicchinnahastapādāś ca chinnakarṇoṣṭhanāsikāḥ // / //
analyzed: arddhacandreṇa gṛhyante kṣipyamāṇāḥ itas tatas  śiśne ca vṛṣaṇe ca eva rajjvā baddhāḥ tathā  vicchinna hasta pādāḥ ca chinna karṇa uṣṭha nāsikāḥ
translated: Having brought them to the stake of the tongue, they are seized by the semicircular blade and thrown here and there.🔽Others are bound with ropes around the penis and testicles.🔽Some have their hands, feet, ears, lips, and noses cut off.

analyzed: vicchinna śiśna vṛṣaṇāḥ chinna śīrṣa aṅga saṃcayāḥ
translated: Some have their penises and testicles cut off, and their heads and limbs are severed.

analyzed: aṅkuśaiḥ bhidyamānāḥ tu khādyamānāḥ sarīsṛpaiḥ
translated: Being pierced with hooks and eaten by reptiles,

original: itaś cetaś ca dhāvanti krandamānā nirāśrayāḥ /
analyzed: itas ca itas ca dhāvanti krandamānāḥ nirāśrayāḥ
translated: They run here and there, crying out, without any support.

original: mudgārair lohadaṇḍaiś ca hanyamānā muhur muhuḥ // / //
analyzed: mudgāraiḥ loha daṇḍaiḥ ca hanyamānāḥ muhur muhur
translated: Being struck repeatedly with iron rods and clubs,

original: kaśābhir vividhābhiś ca ghorābhiś ca samantataḥ /🔽bhindipālaiś ca tudyante vamantaḥ śoṇitaṃ muhuḥ // / //
analyzed: kaśābhiḥ vividhābhiḥ ca ghorābhiḥ ca samantataḥ  bhindipālaiḥ ca tudyante vamantaḥ śoṇitam muhur
translated: With various kinds of whips and terrible ones all around,🔽Being struck with bludgeons, vomiting blood again and again,

original: pātyamānāś ca salile chāyāṃ vai prārthayanti ca /
analyzed: pātyamānāḥ ca salile chāyām vai prārthayanti ca
translated: Being thrown into the water, they seek shade.

analyzed: dāna hīnāḥ prayānti evam prāyaścitta kṛtaḥ narāḥ
translated: Men who have performed expiatory rites go thus, devoid of charity.

original: gṛhītvā caiva pātheyaṃ sukhaṃ yāti yamālayam /
analyzed: gṛhītvā ca eva pātheyam sukham yāti yama ālayam
translated: And taking provisions, one goes happily to Yama's abode.

original: evaṃ pathā nikṛṣṭena prāptā yamapuraṃ narāḥ // / //
analyzed: evam pathā nikṛṣṭena prāptāḥ yama puram narāḥ
translated: Thus, men who have reached Yama's city by the lowest path,

analyzed: prājñāpitaiḥ tathā dūtaiḥ praveśyante yama agratas
translated: Are made to enter before Yama by messengers who have been sent.

original: tatra ye śubhakarmāṇas tān vai saṃsmārayed yamaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatra ye śubha karmāṇaḥ tān vai saṃsmārayet yamaḥ
translated: There, Yama reminds those who have done good deeds,

analyzed: svāgata āsana dānena pādya argheṇa priyeṇa ca
translated: With a welcome, offering of a seat, water for washing the feet, and respectful worship.

analyzed: dhanyāḥ yūyam mahātmā anātmanaḥ hita kāriṇaḥ
translated: Blessed are you, great souls, who have done what is beneficial for yourselves.

original: yais tu divyasukhārthaṃ hi bhavadbhiḥ sukṛtaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yaiḥ tu divya sukha artham hi bhavadbhiḥ sukṛtam kṛtam
translated: By you who have done good deeds for the sake of divine happiness,

analyzed: narmadā taṭam āśritya parvate marakaṇṭake
translated: on the banks of Narmada, on Mount Amarakantaka.

original: dānaṃ dattaṃ tapastaptaṃ hutaṃ ceṣṭaṃ vidhānataḥ /
analyzed: dānam dattam tapaḥ taptam hutam ca iṣṭam vidhānataḥ
translated: Gifts given, austerities performed, oblations offered, and rituals done according to rules,

analyzed: vārāṇasyām kurukṣetre prayāge puṣkare tathā
translated: in Varanasi, Kurukshetra, Prayaga, Pushkara, and elsewhere,

analyzed: gayāyām naimiṣa araṇye gaṅgāsāgara saṅgame
translated: in Gaya, Naimisha forest, the confluence of Ganga and the ocean,

original: kedāre bharaive cāpi prabhāse śaśibhūṣaṇe // / //🔽mahākālavane ramye śrīśaile tripurāntake /
analyzed: kedāre bharaive ca api prabhāse śaśibhūṣaṇe  mahākāla vane ramye śrīśaile tripurāntake
translated: in Kedara, Bharata, and Prabhasa, the moon-adorned,🔽in the beautiful Mahashakti forest, Shrishaila, Tripura's destroyer,

analyzed: traiyambake dhautapāpe nīlakaṇṭhe tathā eva ca
translated: in Trayambaka, Dhautapapa, and Nilakantha as well,

analyzed: gaṅgādvāre himadvāre tathā kālañjare girau
translated: in Gangadvara, Himatvara, and on the Kalajara mountain,

analyzed: eteṣu anyeṣu tīrtheṣu kṣetreṣu ca yathākramam
translated: in these and other holy places and pilgrimage sites in due order,

original: labdhaṃ janmaphalaṃ caiva bhavadbhir nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: labdham janma phalam ca eva bhavadbhiḥ na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: you have certainly obtained the fruits of birth.

analyzed: idam vimānam āruhya divya strī bhoga bhūṣitam
translated: Having ascended this celestial chariot adorned with the enjoyments of divine women,

analyzed: saṃgacchadhvam śivam svargam sarva kāma samanvitam
translated: you should go to the auspicious heaven endowed with all desires.

analyzed: tatra bhuktvā mahā bhogān anantān puṇya saṃkhyayā
translated: Having enjoyed great pleasures there for infinite eons according to your merits,

original: yatkiṃcid anyad aśubhaṃ svalpaṃ tadapi bhokṣyatha /
analyzed: yat kiṃcid anyat aśubham su alpam tat api bhokṣyatha
translated: you will also experience whatever little inauspicious acts you have done.

analyzed: ākhyātam tu mayā tāvat kalpagā tīra vāsinaḥ
translated: I have now told you about the residents of the banks of the Kalpaga river.

analyzed: ārohanti vimānāni sarveṣām upari sthitāḥ
translated: They ascend aerial vehicles that are situated above all others.

analyzed: sarva tīrtheṣu saṃkhyā asti hi uktam brahma ādibhiḥ purā
translated: The number of all the holy places has been stated by Brahma and others in the past.

original: tatra yad dīyate dānaṃ tena svarge mahīyate /
analyzed: tatra yat dīyate dānam tena svarge mahīyate
translated: Whatever gifts are given there, by that one is honored in heaven.

original: mriyate tatra yaḥ kaścid vratenānaśanena ca // / //
analyzed: mriyate tatra yaḥ kaścid vratena anaśanena ca
translated: One who dies there by fasting with a vow...

analyzed: divya yānam samāśritya sa prayāti śiva ālayam
translated: ...he goes to Shiva's abode by resorting to a divine vehicle.

original: etat te kathitaṃ rājan kalpagāpuṇyamuttamam // / //🔽paśyanti puṇyakarmāṇo yamaṃ mitram ivātmanaḥ /
analyzed: etat te kathitam rājan kalpagā puṇyam uttamam  paśyanti puṇya karmāṇaḥ yamam mitram iva ātmanaḥ
translated: This, O king, has been told to you, the excellent merit of the Kalpaga river.🔽Those of meritorious deeds see Yama as if he were their own friend.

original: ye punaḥ krūrakarmāṇaste paśyanti bhayānakam // / //🔽daṃṣṭrā karālavadanaṃ bhrukuṭīkuṭilekṣaṇam /
analyzed: ye punar krūra karmāṇaḥ te paśyanti bhayānakam  daṃṣṭrā karāla vadanam bhrukuṭī kuṭila īkṣaṇam
translated: But those of cruel deeds see him as terrifying...🔽...with a face terrible with fangs, eyes crooked with knitted brows,

analyzed: ūrddhva keśam mahā śmaśrum sphurat oṣṭha adhara uttaram
translated: hair standing erect, large beard, lips and lower lip quivering...

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa bhujam krūram nīlāñjana caya upamam
translated: ...with eighteen arms, cruel, resembling a mass of dark collyrium,

analyzed: sarva āyudha ūhyata karam garjantam daṇḍa pāṇinam
translated: with hands holding all weapons, roaring, with a staff in hand...

analyzed: mahā mahiṣam ārūḍham tapta agni sama locanam
translated: ...mounted on a great buffalo, with eyes like heated fire,

original: raktamālyāmbaradharaṃ mahāmerum ivotthitam // / //🔽pralayāmbudanirghoṣaṃ pibantam iva vāridhīn /
analyzed: rakta mālya ambara dharam mahā merum iva utthitam  pralaya ambuda nirghoṣam pibantam iva vāridhīn
translated: Wearing red garlands and garments, standing like the great Meru mountain.🔽With a voice like the thunder of the clouds at the end of time, as if drinking up the oceans,

analyzed: grasantam iva trailokyam udgiratam iva analam
translated: As if swallowing the three worlds, and vomiting out fire.

analyzed: mṛtyuḥ tasya samīpa sthaḥ kāla anala sama prabhaḥ
translated: Death stands near him, with a radiance like the fire of time.

analyzed: kālaḥ ca añjana saṃkāśaḥ kṛtāntaḥ ca bhayānakaḥ
translated: Time is like collyrium, and the terrifying end of time.

analyzed: vividhāḥ vyādhayaḥ tīkṣṇāḥ nānā rūpāḥ bhayānakāḥ  śakti śūla aṅkuśa dharāḥ pāśa cakra asi pāṇayaḥ
translated: Various sharp diseases, of different forms and terrifying.🔽Wielding spears, lances, hooks, nooses, discuses, and swords in their hands.

analyzed: vajra daṃṣṭra dharāḥ raudrāḥ krūrāḥ ca añjana sannibhāḥ
translated: With terrible fangs and fierce, cruel faces like collyrium,

analyzed: sarva āyudha udyata karāḥ yama dūtāḥ ca ghātakāḥ
translated: With hands raised holding all weapons, and Yama's messengers striking.

original: evaṃ vidhaṃ yamaṃ tatra paśyanti pāpacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: evaṃvidham yamam tatra paśyanti pāpa cāriṇaḥ
translated: Sinners there see Yama like this.

original: nirbhayo yāti cātyarthaṃ yamo vā pāpakāriṇam // / //
analyzed: nirbhayaḥ yāti ca atyartham yamaḥ vā pāpa kāriṇam
translated: And he goes fearlessly, or Yama goes to the sinner.

original: citraguptaś ca bhagavān dharmaṃ teṣāṃ prabodhayan /🔽bho bho duṣkṛtakarmāṇaḥ paradravyāpahārakāḥ // / //
analyzed: citraguptaḥ ca bhagavān dharmam teṣām prabodhayan  bho bho duṣkṛta karmāṇaḥ para dravya apahārakāḥ
translated: And the blessed Citragupta, awakening them to the Dharma,🔽Says, Oh, you of evil deeds, you who steal others' possessions,

analyzed: rūpa vīryeṇa para dāra upamardakāḥ
translated: You who roar with beauty and valor, you who oppress others' wives,

original: tanna kartṛ svayaṃ draṣṭṛ buddhimatkaraṇaṃ vinā // / //
analyzed: tat na kartṛ svayam draṣṭṛ buddhimat karaṇam vinā
translated: That cannot be done without a conscious agent and instruments.

original: na yathā ghaṭam ānena mṛtpiṇḍaḥ svayam ṛcchati /
analyzed: na yathā ghaṭam ānena mṛd piṇḍaḥ svayam ṛcchati
translated: Just as a lump of clay does not by itself become a pot without a potter,

original: tathājñābuddhibhāvena na tiṣṭhet prakṛtiḥ svayam // / //🔽dharmādharmopadeśo na dharmādharmavicāraṇam /
analyzed: tathā ājñā buddhi bhāvena na tiṣṭhet prakṛtiḥ svayam  dharma adharma upadeśaḥ na dharma adharma vicāraṇam
translated: so Prakriti does not remain by itself in the form of ignorance and intellect without a conscious being.🔽Without an omniscient being, the teaching of dharma and adharma and the examination of dharma and adharma

analyzed: sarvajñena vinā jātu na ādisarge prasiddhi ati
translated: could never be established at the beginning of creation.

analyzed: yathānādi pravṛttaḥ yam ghoraḥ saṃsāra sāgaraḥ
translated: Just as this terrible ocean of worldly existence has been going on since beginningless time,

original: śivo 'pi hi tathānādiḥ saṃsārān mocakaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: śivaḥ hi tathā anādiḥ saṃsārāt mocakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: so Shiva is also remembered as the beginningless liberator from worldly existence.

analyzed: vyādhīnām bhaiṣajam yadvat pratipakṣam svabhāvataḥ
translated: Just as a medicine is naturally the antidote to diseases,

analyzed: tadvat saṃsāra ghorāṇām pratipakṣaḥ śivaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: so Shiva is remembered as the antidote to the terrible worldly existence.

original: vaidyaṃ vinā nirākrandāḥ kliśyante rogiṇo yathā /
analyzed: vaidyam vinā nirākrandāḥ kliśyante rogiṇaḥ yathā
translated: Just as patients suffer helplessly without a doctor,

original: śivena tu vinā sarvaṃ nirākrandaṃ jagat tathā // / //
analyzed: śivena tu vinā sarvam nirākrandam jagat tathā
translated: so the entire world is helpless without Shiva.

original: tasmād anādiḥ sarvajñaḥ paripūrṇaḥ paraḥ śivaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt anādiḥ sarvajñaḥ paripūrṇaḥ paraḥ śivaḥ
translated: Therefore, Shiva is beginningless, omniscient, perfect, supreme,

analyzed: asti na atas paritrātā pumān saṃsāra sāgare
translated: and there is no other protector in the ocean of worldly existence.

analyzed: ye bhyasanti śiva jñānam hṛdaye śiva bhāvitāḥ
translated: Those who contemplate on Shiva in their hearts and practice the knowledge of Shiva,

original: yadi vedāḥ pramāṇaṃ tu teṣāṃ jñānaṃ prajāyate // / //
analyzed: yadi vedāḥ pramāṇam tu teṣām jñānam prajāyate
translated: If the Vedas are a means of valid knowledge, then their knowledge arises.

original: iyaṃ ca sarvabhūtānāṃ śaraṇaṃ bhuvi narmadā /
analyzed: iyam ca sarva bhūtānām śaraṇam bhuvi narmadā
translated: And this Narmada is the refuge of all beings on earth,

analyzed: apām rūpa tayā devī loka anugraha kāriṇī
translated: The goddess in the form of waters, bestowing grace upon the world.

analyzed: sthāvaram jaṅgamam ca eva bhūta grāmam caturvidham
translated: The four types of living beings, the moving and unmoving,

original: bhagavaty uddharaty eṣāṃ patantaṃ narake dhruvam // / //
analyzed: bhagavati uddharati eṣām patantam narake dhruvam
translated: The Blessed One delivers them from falling into hell.

analyzed: evam jñātvā nara śreṣṭha śivam anvīkṣya kalpa gām
translated: Knowing this, O best of men, having seen the auspicious Kalpa river,

analyzed: uccais gṛhāṇi divyāni dhana dhānya anvitāni ca
translated: One should offer high and divine houses endowed with wealth and grain

analyzed: sarva upaskara divyāni brāhmaṇebhyaḥ nivedayet
translated: To the Brahmins, along with all divine household articles.

analyzed: anāthāya ati vṛddhāya vikalāya kuṭumbine
translated: To the helpless, the very old, the disabled, and the householder,

analyzed: kāṣṭha mṛd maya geham ca yaḥ dvijāya prayacchati
translated: One who gives a house made of wood or clay to a Brahmin,

analyzed: evaṃvidhān gṛhān ramyān sarvatas marakaṇṭake
translated: Having made such delightful houses everywhere in Amarakantaka,

original: kārayed yaḥ pumān divyāṃs tasya puṇyaphalaṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: kārayet yaḥ pumān divyān tasya puṇya phalam śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the meritorious fruit of that man who makes divine ones.

original: kiṃ tasya bahubhir dattair dānair bhavati bhārata // / //
analyzed: kim tasya bahubhiḥ dattaiḥ dānaiḥ bhavati bhārata
translated: What is the use of giving him many gifts, O descendant of Bharata?

analyzed: etat eva param dānam sarva kāma artha sādhakam
translated: This alone is the supreme gift, which fulfills all desires and purposes.

original: yaḥ śṛṇoti naro bhaktyā sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate // / //
analyzed: yaḥ śṛṇoti naraḥ bhaktyā sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: A man who listens to this with devotion is freed from all sins.🔽Thus ends the fifty-seventh chapter in the Narmada-mahatmya in the Skanda-purana.

original: iti śrīskandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe narmadāmāhātmye saptapañcāśattamo 'dhyāyaḥ //🔽RKS adhyāya
analyzed: iti śrī skandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe narmadāmāhātmye saptapañcāśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ  rks adhyāya
translated: Chapter 80

analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca
translated: Yudhisthira said:

original: śrutvaitat paramaṃ guhyaṃ gavāṃ devasam udbhavam /
analyzed: śrutvā etat paramam guhyam gavām deva sam udbhavam
translated: Having heard this supreme secret about the origin of cows from the gods,

analyzed: brahmakūrcasya māhātmyam śrotum icchāmi tattvataḥ
translated: I wish to hear the truth about the greatness of Brahma-kurcha.

original: ākhyāhi bhagavan sarvaṃ golokaḥ kīdṛśaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ākhyāhi bhagavan sarvam golokaḥ kīdṛśaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: O Lord, please tell me everything - what is Goloka said to be like?

original: prāpyate karmaṇā kena ke tasminn aniśaṃ sthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: prāpyate karmaṇā kena ke tasmin aniśam sthitāḥ
translated: By what deeds is it attained? Who are those who always dwell there?

analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

analyzed: śrūyatām abhidhāsyāmi namaskṛtya maheśvaram
translated: Listen, I will tell you after bowing to Mahesvara.

analyzed: gomātṛ lokam paramam sarva kām a samanvitam
translated: The supreme world of the cow-mother, endowed with all desires,

analyzed: yathāvat sarva lokānām upari upari saṃsthitam
translated: is situated above all the worlds in the proper way.

original: pātālāni tataḥ sapta pātālaṃ ca tatas tathā // / //
analyzed: pātālāni tatas sapta pātālam ca tatas tathā
translated: Below that are the seven nether worlds, and below that is the nether world.

analyzed: yāvat pramāṇam paritas paricchinnam mahī talam
translated: The extent of the earth's surface is limited all around.

original: tāvat pramāṇaṃ tasyāḥ samudrās tāni caiva tu // / //
analyzed: tāvat pramāṇam tasyāḥ samudrāḥ tāni ca eva tu
translated: The oceans and those (nether worlds) are of the same extent.

original: teṣāṃ pratyekam utsedhapramāṇaṃ parikīrtitam /🔽yojanānāṃ sahasrāṇi daśārdhāni tatas tataḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām pratyekam utsedha pramāṇam parikīrtitam  yojanānām sahasrāṇi daśārdhāni tatas tatas
translated: The height of each of them has been declared.🔽They are ten and a half thousand yojanas in height, one above the other.

analyzed: sahasra yojana utsedhaḥ tasya abhyantaratas tathā
translated: Inside it, the height is one thousand yojanas.

analyzed: vivarāṇām samastānām sahasrāṇi nava smṛtam
translated: The total number of cavities is remembered as nine thousand.

analyzed: teṣām rucira māhātmyam nāmataḥ tu mahī tale
translated: Their charming greatness is known on earth by name.
Endowed with divine things, having the splendor of pure gold,

analyzed: nāga rājaḥ sadā eva āste tasmin kṛta niketanaḥ
translated: the king of serpents always resides there, having made it his abode.

analyzed: anantaḥ nantadhāmā ca mukundaḥ nṛpaśaivalaḥ
translated: Ananta, Ananta-dhama, Mukunda, Nṛpa-śaivala,

analyzed: tatas rasātalam nāma śiva santoṣa bhūmikam
translated: Then there is the nether world named Rasātala, the ground for the satisfaction of Śiva.

original: vāsuker nāgarājasya tatra cāru mahāpuram // / //🔽pura ca suralomnas tu dānavādhipater mahat /
analyzed: vāsukeḥ nāga rājasya tatra cāru mahā puram  pura ca suralomnaḥ tu dānava adhipateḥ mahat
translated: There is a beautiful great city of Vāsuki, the king of serpents.🔽And the great city of the lord of the gods, the lord of the demons,

analyzed: suparṇasya ca daityānām aśeṣāṇām mahātmanām
translated: and of Suparṇa, and of all the great souls among the demons,

analyzed: tatas sutala nāmā asti śarkarā āñcita bhūmikam
translated: Then there is Sutala, whose ground is strewn with gravel.

analyzed: nāga ādīnām svastikānām tatra eva vasatiḥ sadā
translated: There the serpents and others, the Svastikas, always reside.

analyzed: dānava adhipatīnām ca tatra eva nilayaḥ paraḥ
translated: And there is another great abode of the lords of the demons.

analyzed: vairocana hiraṇya ākhya prabhṛtīnām mahātmanām
translated: Of the great souls beginning with Vairocana and Hiranya.

original: tataścātalam ityuktaṃ pātālānāṃ tasya tu vai /
analyzed: tatas ca atalam iti uktam pātālānām tasya tu vai
translated: And then the nether world is said to be of that, of the nether worlds.

original: teṣām ūrdhvavastusarveṣāṃ mṛnmayaṃ ca talaṃ kṣiteḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām ūrdhva vastu sarveṣām mṛd mayam ca talam kṣiteḥ
translated: And of all those above, the nether world is of earth.

analyzed: asura adhipateḥ tāvat kālanemeḥ mahā puram
translated: First, the great city of the lord of demons, Kālanemi.

analyzed: cāru cāmīkara ābhāsam vainateyasya ca aparam
translated: Shining like beautiful gold, and another of Garuḍa.

original: tataś ca vitalaṃ nāma pātālaṃ raktabhūtalam /
analyzed: tatas ca vitalam nāma pātālam rakta bhū talam
translated: Then, the nether world named Vitala, with a red surface.

original: tasmin mahāntako nāma dānavendrakṛtālayaḥ // / //🔽tālako 'gnimukhas tasmin nalahrādaś ca dānavāḥ /
analyzed: tasmin mahāntakaḥ nāma dānava indra kṛta ālayaḥ  tālakaḥ gni mukhaḥ tasmin nala hrādaḥ ca dānavāḥ
translated: In it, the abode made by the lord of demons named Mahāntaka.🔽In it, the demons Tālaka, Agni-mukha, and Nala-hrāda.

analyzed: nivasanti kṛta āgārāḥ tathā prahlāda varcasaḥ
translated: Dwell with their abodes made, and with the splendor of Prahlāda.

original: pātālaṃ vitalaṃ nāma śuklaṃ kṣititalaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: pātālam vitalam nāma śuklam kṣiti talam tatas
translated: The nether world named Vitala, then the white surface of the earth.

analyzed: kambala aśvatarau nāgau sahitau tatra tiṣṭhataḥ
translated: There the serpents Kaṃbala and Aśvatara dwell together.

analyzed: mahājambha hayagrīva prabhṛtīnām mahātmanām
translated: Of the great souls beginning with Mahājambha, Hayagrīva, and others.

analyzed: vārāṇasī asura indrāṇām nivāsaḥ tatra kalpitaḥ
translated: The abode of the kings of Vārāṇasī and the lords of demons is arranged there.

analyzed: kṛṣṇam kṣititalam tasmāt pātālatala saṃjñakam
translated: From that, the black surface of the earth, named the nether world.

analyzed: śaṅkukarṇa mahānāda namucīnām niketanam
translated: The abode of the Shankukarnas, the Maha-nadas, and the Namuchis.

original: pātālāt saptamād ūrdhvaṃ saptadvīpā mahī sthitā /
analyzed: pātālāt saptamāt ūrdhvam sapta dvīpā mahī sthitā
translated: Above the seventh nether world, the earth with its seven continents is situated.

analyzed: samudraiḥ saptabhiḥ yuktā parvataiḥ samalaṃkṛtā
translated: It is surrounded by seven oceans and adorned with mountains.

original: jambūdvīpaś ca tan madhye plakṣadvīpas tataḥ paraḥ // / //
analyzed: jambūdvīpaḥ ca tat madhye plakṣadvīpaḥ tatas paraḥ
translated: In the middle is Jambudvipa, beyond that is Plakṣa-dvīpa,

original: krauñcadvīpaś ca parataḥ śākadvīpaś ca tadbahiḥ /
analyzed: krauñcadvīpaḥ ca paratas śākadvīpaḥ ca tad bahis
translated: Beyond that is Krauñca-dvīpa, and outside that is Śāka-dvīpa.

analyzed: paratas puṣkaradvīpaḥ saptamaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Beyond that is Puṣkara-dvīpa, declared to be the seventh.

analyzed: kṣārodakaḥ ca ikṣurasaḥ surodaḥ ca ghṛta udadhiḥ
translated: The salt ocean, the sugarcane juice ocean, the wine ocean, the ghee ocean,
The curd ocean, the milk ocean, and the sweet ocean are remembered as the seventh.

analyzed: sapta dvīpa samudrāṇām dviguṇa dviguṇa antaraḥ
translated: The extent of the seven continents and oceans should be known to be twice the previous,

analyzed: pramāṇa vistaraḥ jñeyaḥ niyutaḥ prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The first is remembered as a million.

original: himavān hemakūṭaś ca niṣadhaś ceti dakṣiṇe /
analyzed: himavān hemakūṭaḥ ca niṣadhaḥ ca iti dakṣiṇe
translated: Himavān, Hemakūṭa, and Niṣadha are on the south,

original: nīlaś ca śvetaḥ śṛṅgaś ca meroruttarataḥ smṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: nīlaḥ ca śvetaḥ śṛṅgaḥ ca meroḥ uttaratas smṛtāḥ
translated: Nīla, Śveta, and Śṛṅga are remembered on the north of Meru.

original: merur asti sthito madhye jambūdvīpasya bhārata /
analyzed: meruḥ asti sthitaḥ madhye jambūdvīpasya bhārata
translated: O Bhārata, Meru is situated in the middle of Jambū-dvīpa.

analyzed: mālyavān pūrvatas jñeyaḥ paścime gandhamādanaḥ
translated: Mālyavān should be known to be on the east, Gandhamādana on the west,

analyzed: ete parvata rājānaḥ jambūdvīpe nava smṛtāḥ
translated: These nine great mountains are known in Jambudvipa.

analyzed: plakṣadvīpa ādiṣu jñeyāḥ sapta saptā eva parvatāḥ
translated: In the continents beginning with Plakṣa, the mountains should be known as seven each.

analyzed: puṣkaradvīpa madhye tu parvataḥ valaya ākṛtiḥ
translated: In the middle of Puṣkara Dvīpa, there is a mountain shaped like a ring.

original: ekaḥ smṛtaḥ samantāc ca nāmato mānasaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekaḥ smṛtaḥ samantāt ca nāmataḥ mānasaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: It is known as one all around, and is known by the name of Mānasa.

analyzed: vindhyaḥ nāma mahābhāgaḥ jambūdvīpe vyavasthitaḥ
translated: The greatly fortunate Vindhya is situated in Jambū Dvīpa.

analyzed: yatra eṣā narmadā devī plavantī loka tāriṇī
translated: Where this river Narmadā, the savior of the world, flows.

original: vindhyasya cānujo bhrātā sahyo dakṣiṇataḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vindhyasya ca anujaḥ bhrātā sahyaḥ dakṣiṇatas smṛtaḥ
translated: Vindhya's younger brother is known as Sahya to the south.

analyzed: urvī kūrma tala ākārā kāñcanī parimaṇḍalā
translated: The earth is shaped like a tortoise's back, golden, and circular.

original: aṇureva tathā sā tu nirdiṣṭātividaḥ kṣitiḥ /
analyzed: aṇuḥ eva tathā sā tu nirdiṣṭā atividaḥ kṣitiḥ
translated: It is indeed said to be very small, the earth known to the learned.

analyzed: tasyāḥ pramāṇam nirdiṣṭam daśa yojana koṭayaḥ
translated: Its size is said to be ten million yojanas.

original: lokāloka iti khyātas tasyāḥ prānte samantataḥ /
analyzed: lokālokaḥ iti khyātaḥ tasyāḥ prānte samantataḥ
translated: On its edge all around, it is known as Lokāloka.

analyzed: sphītaḥ hema mayaḥ śrīmān saralaḥ parimaṇḍalaḥ
translated: It is prosperous, golden, beautiful, straight, and circular.

analyzed: yojanānām sahasrāṇi ca ardham asya vyavasthitam
translated: Half of it is situated at a distance of one thousand yojanas.

analyzed: tāvat eva ca vistīrṇam tad ardhe bhānuḥ āhitaḥ
translated: It is as vast as that, and the sun is placed at half of it.

original: prakāśayati sa jyotiḥ parabhāge nihanyate /🔽lokāloka iti proktas tato 'sāvacalo mahān // / //
analyzed: prakāśayati sa jyotiḥ parabhāge nihanyate  lokālokaḥ iti proktaḥ saḥ acalaḥ mahān
translated: That light shines, and is destroyed in the higher region.🔽It is called Lokāloka, and that great immovable mountain is beyond it.

analyzed: lokāloka avasānaḥ yam bhūrlokaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: This Bhūrloka is said to extend up to Lokāloka.

analyzed: gandharva yakṣa rakṣobhiḥ piśācaiḥ ca niṣevitaḥ
translated: It is inhabited by Gandharvas, Yakshas, Rakshasas, and Pishachas.

analyzed: mānuṣaiḥ paśubhiḥ ca eva mṛga pakṣi sarīsṛpaiḥ
translated: By human beings, animals, deer, birds, reptiles,

analyzed: sthāvaraiḥ vividha ākāraiḥ bhūtaiḥ etaiḥ ca ṣaḍvidhaiḥ
translated: And by various kinds of immobile beings, thus by these six kinds.

analyzed: bhūrlokaḥ ca bhuvarlokaḥ yāvat āditya maṇḍalam
translated: The Bhūrloka and the Bhuvarloka extend up to the sphere of the sun.

analyzed: vasanti satatam rudrāḥ satatam vaktra bhāskarāḥ
translated: The Rudras always reside there, always facing the sun.

analyzed: āditya maṇḍalāt ūrdhvam smṛtā svar loka saṃsthitiḥ
translated: The existence of Svarloka is said to be above the sphere of the sun.

analyzed: vimāna koṭayaḥ tasmin aṣṭāviṃśatiḥ āśayaḥ
translated: There are twenty-eight mansions, with millions of aerial cars.

analyzed: meḍhī bhūtaḥ vimānānām sarveṣām upari dhruvaḥ
translated: Dhruva is above all the aerial cars, serving as their pivot.

analyzed: niyutāḥ anila skandhāḥ sapta asmin antare sthitāḥ
translated: Seventeen millions of winds are situated in this intermediate space.

analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ prathamaḥ skandhaḥ sthitaḥ ca a megha maṇḍalam
translated: The first layer of the earth is the sphere of clouds.

original: āhavo nāma vai vāto vyūhānāṃ vyūhakṛt tathā // / //
analyzed: āhavaḥ nāma vai vātaḥ vyūhānām vyūha kṛt tathā
translated: The wind named Āhava is the arranger of the arrays.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ pravahaḥ nāma nibaddhaḥ sūrya maṇḍale
translated: The second is named Pravaha, bound to the solar disc.

analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ saṃvahaḥ māma su skandhaḥ sau pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: The third is named Samvaha, that good-trunked one is established.

analyzed: caturthaḥ sa udvahaḥ skandhaḥ sthitaḥ nakṣatra maṇḍale
translated: The fourth trunk is named Sodvaha, situated in the stellar sphere.

analyzed: tatas dvayoḥ vinirdiṣṭā vimāna udvahana kriyā
translated: Then the action of carrying the celestial vehicles is indicated for the two.

analyzed: yojanānām dhruvaḥ koṭiḥ mahar lokaḥ samucchritaḥ
translated: The Meru mountain is a crore yojanas high, and the world of Mahar is elevated.

original: skandhaḥ parivaho nāma nibaddhaḥ saptamo dhruve // / //
analyzed: skandhaḥ parivahaḥ nāma nibaddhaḥ saptamaḥ dhruve
translated: The trunk named Parivaha is bound to the pole, the seventh.

original: annādīni karoty eṣa parvaṇām upari sthitaḥ /
analyzed: anna ādīni karoti eṣa parvaṇām upari sthitaḥ
translated: Situated above the Parvas, it performs the functions of food etc.

analyzed: vinirvṛttam vikārāṇām adhivāsaḥ mahātmanām
translated: It is the abode of the transformations of the great souls.

analyzed: tatra adhikāri devānām aṣṭāviṃśati koṭayaḥ
translated: There are twenty-eight crores of the presiding gods.

analyzed: janāt svar lokam āgatya niyogāt padmajanmanaḥ
translated: Having come to the world of heaven from the world of men, by the order of the lotus-born one,

analyzed: sthitāḥ manvantaram tatra sva vyāpāra avasāyinaḥ
translated: they remain there for a Manu-period, engaged in their own duties.

original: āruhya ca maharlokam āgacchanti tataḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: āruhya ca mahar lokam āgacchanti tatas punar
translated: And having ascended, they again come to the world of Mahar.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ divasa ekena devāḥ svarge caturdaśa
translated: In one day of Brahma, the fourteen gods in heaven,

original: krameṇa kṛtvā karmāṇi maharloke vasanti te // / //
analyzed: krameṇa kṛtvā karmāṇi mahar loke vasanti te
translated: having performed their duties in order, dwell in the world of Mahar.

analyzed: koṭi dvayam mahar lokāt janalokaḥ samucchritaḥ

analyzed: etat te kathitam brahman mokṣaḥ smākam vidhīyatām

The prosperous Narada, the son of Brahma, a treasure of austerities, who knows the truth of the past and future,

original: uvāca vacanaṃ śrīmān nāradas tāṃs tapodhanān /
analyzed: uvāca vacanam śrīmān nāradaḥ tān tapodhanān
translated: spoke these words to those ascetics:

translated: On what auspicious occasion, on the divine full moon day of Kartika,

original: śivena kīrtitaṃ pūrvaṃ pārvatyāḥ ṣaṇmukhasya ca /

analyzed: adhvare brahmadattasya mokṣaṇam tu bhaviṣyati

original: iti śrīskandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe vāgīśvarākhyāna nāma saptaṣaṣṭitamo 'dhyāyaḥ //🔽RKS adhyāya
analyzed: iti śrī skandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe vāgīśvarākhyāna nāma saptaṣaṣṭitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ  rks adhyāya

analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ kartā ca vāsudevaḥ astu me gatiḥ
translated: The creator of heaven and earth, Vasudeva may be my refuge.

analyzed: sahasra śīrṣā bhagavān sahasra akṣaḥ sahasra pād
translated: The thousand-headed, thousand-eyed, thousand-footed lord,

analyzed: sahasra koṭi dhārī vā vāsudevaḥ stu me gatiḥ
translated: The wielder of a thousand crores, Vasudeva may be my refuge.

analyzed: janma prabhṛti yat kiṃcid mayā sukṛtam arjitam
translated: Whatever little good deed I have earned since birth,

analyzed: tat samagram phalam ca astu śāśvatam puruṣottama

original: idam abhyasyato nityaṃ pūjitaḥ syāt sakeśavaḥ /

analyzed: vināśayati pāpāni prakāśayati tat phalam

translated: The Brahmins are of the nature of Vasudeva, they are devoted to Vasudeva.

analyzed: sahasra śirasam devam mahā ṛṣim bhūtabhāvanam

analyzed: guṇavān nirguṇaḥ ca eva cetano cetano svagaḥ

analyzed: arbude ca eva yat puṇyam puṇyam ca amaraparvate

analyzed: śāstra uktaiḥ aṣṭabhiḥ mantraiḥ mānasaiḥ śṛṇu tān tathā

analyzed: vānaspatyam bhavet puṣpam prājāpatyam tu saptamam

The earthly is bulbous roots etc., the floral is of the nature of fruits,

analyzed: tṛtīyam ca dayā puṣpam ebhiḥ tuṣyanti devatāḥ

analyzed: tapasā ca arcayet bhaktyā atra tīrthe narādhipa

analyzed: rudram puruṣasūktam ca loke yaḥ sva sva sūtrakam

analyzed: gṛhe tasya ca yaḥ śnīyāt jihvā lampaṭakaḥ nṛpa
translated: O king, if someone eats in his house, licking his tongue,

analyzed: asat pratigraham gṛhṇan na āpadam ca vinā dvijaḥ

analyzed: lakṣa dākṣiṇya lābhāya pradānam ca aparādhakam

analyzed: eka mārgam gataḥ rājā citrasenaḥ mahīpatiḥ
translated: King Chitrasena, the lord of the earth, went alone on the same path.

original: ekākī sa gatas tatra yatra yatra ca te mṛgāḥ // / //🔽praviṣṭas tu tato durge kānane pakṣivarjite /
analyzed: ekākī sa gataḥ tatra yatra yatra ca te mṛgāḥ  praviṣṭaḥ tu tatas durge kānane pakṣi varjite
translated: Alone he went there, wherever those deer were.🔽He entered that impassable forest devoid of birds,

analyzed: valmī gulma latā ākīrṇe praviṣṭaḥ na eva dṛśyate
translated: covered with anthills, bushes, and creepers, and once inside, was not seen.

analyzed: ekākī apaśyat ātmānam na ca aśvam na padātikān
translated: Alone he saw himself, neither the horse nor the foot soldiers.

original: na ko 'pi cātra jānāti nāhaṃ vedmi diśo daśa // / //
analyzed: na kaḥ pi ca atra jānāti na aham vedmi diśaḥ daśa
translated: No one knew him here, and he did not know the ten directions.

original: evaṃ kaṣṭaṃ gato rājā citraseno narādhipaḥ /
analyzed: evam kaṣṭam gataḥ rājā citrasenaḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: Thus King Chitrasena, the lord of men, went into distress.

original: chāyāṃ samāśritas tatra viśramya ca punaḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: chāyām samāśritaḥ tatra viśramya ca punar punar
translated: Taking shelter in the shade there, and resting again and again,

analyzed: kṣudh tṛṣā ārtaḥ bhraman durge kānane giri gahvare
translated: afflicted by hunger and thirst, wandering in that impassable forest, in the mountain cave,

analyzed: paśyat saraḥ divyam padminī ṣaṇḍa maṇḍitam
translated: Then he saw a divine lake adorned with clusters of lotuses,

analyzed: haṃsa kāraṇḍava ākīrṇam cakravāka upakūjitam
translated: Filled with swans and karandavas, resounding with the cries of chakravakas.

analyzed: saraḥ dṛṣṭvā tu rāja indraḥ saṃprahṛṣṭa tanūruhaḥ
translated: Seeing the lake, the lord of kings, with his body hair thrilled with joy,

original: kumudāni gṛhītvā tu tatra snānaṃ samācarat /
analyzed: kumudāni gṛhītvā tu tatra snānam samācarat
translated: Took out the lilies and performed his ablutions there.

original: tarpayitvā pitṝn devān manuṣyāṃś ca yathā vidhi // / //
analyzed: tarpayitvā pitṝn devān manuṣyān ca yathā vidhi
translated: Having offered libations to the ancestors, gods and humans according to the prescribed rites,

analyzed: papau pānīyam amalam yathāvat samabhīpsitam
translated: He drank the pure water as desired.

original: uttīrya sa jalāt tīre dṛṣṭvā vṛkṣaṃ samīpataḥ // / //
analyzed: uttīrya sa jalāt tīre dṛṣṭvā vṛkṣam samīpatas
translated: Having emerged from the water onto the bank, seeing a tree nearby,

original: cintayā 'nupaviṣṭo 'sau kiṃ tu karma karomy aham /
analyzed: cintayā sau kim tu karma karomi aham
translated: He sat down thinking, What task should I do?

original: tataś chāyāśritān paśyan vanoddeśe mṛgān bahūn // / //
analyzed: tatas chāyā āśritān paśyan vana uddeśe mṛgān bahūn
translated: Then, seeing many deer resting in the shade in the forest region,

original: kecit pūrvamukhās tatra apare dakṣiṇāmukhā /🔽vāruṇyabhimukhāḥ kecit kecit kauberam āśritāḥ // / //
analyzed: kecid pūrva mukhāḥ tatra apare dakṣiṇā mukhā  vāruṇī abhimukhāḥ kecid kecid kauberam āśritāḥ
translated: Some were facing east, some facing south,🔽Some facing west, some facing north,

original: kecin nidrāṃ prakurvanti ūrdhvakarṇāḥ sthitāḥ pare /
analyzed: kecid nidrām prakurvanti ūrdhva karṇāḥ sthitāḥ pare
translated: Some were sleeping, others stood with their ears erect.

analyzed: mṛga madhye sthitaḥ yogī ṛṣyaśṛṅgaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: In the midst of the deer was the yogi Rishyashringa, of great austerities.

original: mṛgān dṛṣṭvā tato rājā prahārārtham acintayat /
analyzed: mṛgān dṛṣṭvā tatas rājā prahāra artham acintayat
translated: Seeing the deer, the king thought of striking them.

original: vadhitvā ca mṛgaṃ caikaṃ bhakṣayāmi yadṛcchayā // / //
analyzed: vadhitvā ca mṛgam ca ekam bhakṣayāmi yadṛcchayā
translated: And having killed a deer, I will eat it as I please.

analyzed: svastha avasthaḥ bhaviṣyāmi mṛga māṃsasya bhakṣaṇāt
translated: By eating the deer meat, I will be in a healthy state.

original: kāśīṃ prati gamiṣyāmi mārgam anveṣayaṃs tataḥ // / //
analyzed: kāśīm prati gamiṣyāmi mārgam anveṣayan tatas
translated: Then I will go to Kashi, searching for the path.

analyzed: vicintya evam tatas rājā vṛkṣa mūlam samāśritaḥ
translated: Having thought thus, the king resorted to the foot of a tree.

original: cāpaṃ dhṛtvā karāgreṇa prākṣipat tac charaṃ vibhuḥ // / //
analyzed: cāpam dhṛtvā kara agreṇa prākṣipat tat śaram vibhuḥ
translated: Holding the bow in the tip of his hand, the lord shot that arrow.

original: kṣiptamātre śare tasmin sarve naṣṭā mṛgās tataḥ /
analyzed: kṣipta mātre śare tasmin sarve naṣṭāḥ mṛgāḥ tatas
translated: As soon as that arrow was shot, all the deer disappeared.

original: teṣāṃ madhye sa caiveka ṛṣyaśṛṅgo mahātapāḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām madhye sa ca eva ekaḥ ṛṣyaśṛṅgaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: Among them, there was only one, Rishyashringa of great austerities.

original: śareṇa viddhaḥ patitaḥ kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇeti cābravīt /
analyzed: śareṇa viddhaḥ patitaḥ kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa iti ca abravīt
translated: He was struck by the arrow and fell down, saying Krishna, Krishna.

original: hāhā śabdaṃ kṛtaṃ tena kenāhaṃ pātito 'dhunā // / //
analyzed: hāhā śabdam kṛtam tena kena aham pātitaḥ dhunā
translated: By whom have I been struck down now, that he has made this sound of lamentation?

analyzed: kasya eṣā durmatiḥ jātā yayā buddhiḥ mama upari
translated: Whose evil mind has arisen towards me, by which this thought has come upon me?

analyzed: mṛga madhye sthitaḥ ca aham na kiṃcad aparāddhavān
translated: I was standing in the midst of deer and have not committed any offense.

original: vācāṃ tāṃ mānuṣīṃ śrutvā sa rājā vismayānvitaḥ /
analyzed: vācām tām mānuṣīm śrutvā sa rājā vismaya anvitaḥ
translated: Having heard those human words, the king was filled with wonder.

analyzed: śīghram gatvā paśyat brāhmaṇam brahmavarcasam
translated: Having quickly gone there, he saw a brahmin of spiritual radiance.

original: hā hā kaṣṭaṃ kṛtaṃ me 'dya yenāsau ghātito mayā /
analyzed: hā hā kaṣṭam kṛtam me dya yena asau ghātitaḥ mayā
translated: Alas! Alas! A great misfortune has befallen me today, since he has been killed by me.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brahmin said:

original: na te siddhir bhavet kiṃcin mayi pañcatvam āgate // / //
analyzed: na te siddhiḥ bhavet kiṃcid mayi pañcatvam āgate
translated: You will not attain any accomplishment if I die.

original: tavaiva vihitā hatyā mayi pañcatvam āgate /
analyzed: tava eva vihitā hatyā mayi pañcatvam āgate
translated: If I die, the killing will be on you alone.

original: jananī me pitā vṛddhau bhrātaro hi tapasvinaḥ // / //
analyzed: jananī me pitā vṛddhau bhrātaraḥ hi tapasvinaḥ
translated: My mother, my aged father, my ascetic brothers -

analyzed: bhrātṛ jāyāḥ mariṣyanti mayi pañcatvam āgate
translated: my brother's wife will die if I die.

original: etā hatyā bhaviṣyanti tava śuddhiḥ kathaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: etāḥ hatyāḥ bhaviṣyanti tava śuddhiḥ katham bhavet
translated: These killings will happen. How can you be purified?

original: upāyaṃ kathayiṣyāmi kartuṃ tvaṃ yadi manyase // / //
analyzed: upāyam kathayiṣyāmi kartum tvam yadi manyase
translated: I will tell you a means if you think of doing it.

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: upāyaḥ kathyatāṃ me 'dya yas te manasi vartate /
analyzed: upāyaḥ kathyatām me dya yaḥ te manasi vartate
translated: Tell me the means that is in your mind today.

analyzed: kariṣye tat aham sarvam prayatnena mahā mune
translated: I will do all that with effort, great sage.

analyzed: śṛṅgī uvāca
translated: Shringi said:

original: pṛcchāmi tvāṃ kutaḥ ko vā kathaṃ tvam iha cāgataḥ /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tvām kutas kaḥ vā katham tvam iha ca āgataḥ
translated: I ask you, from where and who are you, and how have you come here?

analyzed: brahma kṣatra viśām madhye punar
translated: Among Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, or even Shudras, you are the lowest.

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: nāhaṃ vipro na vaiśyo 'haṃ na śūdraḥ kṣatriyo hy aham /
analyzed: na aham vipraḥ na vaiśyaḥ ham na śūdraḥ kṣatriyaḥ hi aham
translated: I am not a Brahmin, nor a Vaishya, nor a Shudra, but a Kshatriya.

analyzed: śṛṅgī uvāca
translated: Shringi said:

original: māṃ gṛhītvāśramaṃ puṇyaṃ yatra tau pitarau mama // / //
analyzed: mām gṛhītvā āśramam puṇyam yatra tau pitarau mama
translated: Taking me to the sacred hermitage where my parents are,

analyzed: āvedayasva dayasva ca ātmānam putra pāpinam āgatam
translated: Inform them and show mercy to me, the sinful son who has come.

original: tau dṛṣṭvā māṃ kariṣyete kāruṇyaṃ ca tavopari // / //
analyzed: tau dṛṣṭvā mām kariṣyete kāruṇyam ca tava upari
translated: Seeing me, they will have compassion on you and on me.

original: upāyaṃ vā kariṣyete yena śāntir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: upāyam vā kariṣyete yena śāntiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Or they will devise a means by which peace will be attained.

original: tasya tad vacanaṃ śrutvā citraseno nṛpottamaḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā citrasenaḥ nṛpa uttamaḥ
translated: Hearing those words of his, King Chitrasena, the best of men,

original: skandhe kṛtvā ca taṃ vipraṃ jagāmāśramakaṃ prati /
analyzed: skandhe kṛtvā ca tam vipram jagāma āśramakam prati
translated: Placing the brahmin on his shoulder, went towards the hermitage.

original: na śaknoti ca taṃ voḍhuṃ viśramya ca punaḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: na śaknoti ca tam voḍhum viśramya ca punar punar
translated: And he was unable to carry him, resting again and again.

original: tāvat paśyati taṃ vipraṃ mūrchitaṃ vikalendriyam /
analyzed: tāvat paśyati tam vipram mūrchitam vikala indriyam
translated: Then he saw that brahmin, unconscious and with impaired senses.

original: mumoca citrasenas tu chāyāṃ nyagrodhakasya ca // / //
analyzed: mumoca citrasenaḥ tu chāyām nyagrodhakasya ca
translated: But Chitrasena released him in the shade of a banyan tree.

original: viśrāmaṃ ca tataḥ kṛtvā vācaṃ kurvan muhur muhuḥ /
analyzed: viśrāmam ca tatas kṛtvā vācam kurvan muhur muhur
translated: And having rested there, he repeatedly spoke these words:

analyzed: paśyataḥ tasya rāja indra ṛṣyaśṛṅgaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: O lord of kings, while he was watching, Rishyashringa, the great ascetic,

analyzed: pañcatvam agamat śīghram dhyāna yogena yoga vid
translated: The knower of yoga, quickly attained the state of the elements through the yoga of meditation.

analyzed: dāhayāmāsa tam vipram vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā
translated: He cremated the brahmin with the rites prescribed by the scriptures.

original: snānaṃ kṛtvā tu śokārto ruroda ca mumoha ca /
analyzed: snānam kṛtvā tu śoka ārtaḥ ruroda ca mumoha ca
translated: And having bathed, he lamented in grief and fainted.

original: tataś cānantaraṃ rājā udvegaṃ paramaṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas ca anantaram rājā udvegam paramam gataḥ
translated: Then, immediately after that, the king became extremely anxious.

original: kathaṃ yāsye gṛhān adya vārāṇasyāṃ hato hy aham /
analyzed: katham yāsye gṛhān adya vārāṇasyām hataḥ hi aham
translated: How shall I go home today, having been killed in Varanasi?

analyzed: brahmahatyā samāviṣṭaḥ juhomi agnau kalevaram
translated: Possessed by the sin of killing a brahmin, I shall offer my body into the fire.

analyzed: athavā ṛṣi vākyena gacchāmi eva āśramam prati
translated: Or rather, by the words of the sage, I shall go to the hermitage itself.

original: kathayāmi yathāvṛttaṃ gatvā tasya mahā ṛṣeḥ // / //🔽evaṃ vicintya rājāsau jagāmāśramasannidhau /
analyzed: kathayāmi yathāvṛttam gatvā tasya mahā ṛṣeḥ  evam vicintya rājā asau jagāma āśrama sannidhau
translated: Having gone there, I shall tell the great sage exactly what happened.🔽 Having thought thus, the king went near the hermitage.

analyzed: ṛṣyaśṛṅgasya ca asthīni gṛhītvā sa nṛpa uttamaḥ
translated: And that best of kings, taking the bones of Rishyashringa,

analyzed: dṛṣṭi mārge sthitaḥ tasya brahmarṣeḥ bhāvitātmanaḥ
translated: stood in the path of sight of that brahminical sage of purified soul.

analyzed: dīrghatapāḥ uvāca
translated: Dirghatapa said:

analyzed: āgaccha svāgatam te dyauḥ āsane upaviśyatām
translated: Come, welcome to you today, sit on this seat.

analyzed: dīrghatapāḥ asmi aham te dya madhuparkaḥ sa viṣṭaraḥ
translated: I am Dirghatapa today, your Madhuparka with a seat.

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: arghasyaiva na yogyo 'haṃ maharṣer bhāvitātmanaḥ // / //🔽mṛgamadhye sthito vipra tava putro mayā hataḥ /
analyzed: arghasya eva na yogyaḥ ham mahā ṛṣeḥ bhāvitātmanaḥ  mṛga madhye sthitaḥ vipra tava putraḥ mayā hataḥ
translated: I am not worthy of even the Arghya of that great sage of purified soul.🔽 O brahmin, your son was killed by me while standing in the midst of deer.

original: putraghnaṃ śādhi māṃ vipra tīvradaṇḍena daṇḍaya // / //
analyzed: putra ghnam śādhi mām vipra tīvra daṇḍena daṇḍaya
translated: O brahmin, punish me, the slayer of your son, with severe punishment.

analyzed: mṛga bhrāntyā hataḥ vipraḥ ṛṣyaśṛṅgaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: The great ascetic Rishyashringa was killed by me under the delusion that he was a deer.

original: iti jñātvā ca māṃ vipra kuruṣva ca yathocitam // / //
analyzed: iti jñātvā ca mām vipra kuruṣva ca yathocitam
translated: Knowing this, O Brahmana, do what is proper for me.

original: mātā tasya vacaḥ śrutvā gṛhān nirgatya vihvalā /
analyzed: mātā tasya vacaḥ śrutvā gṛhāt nirgatya vihvalā
translated: Hearing his words, the mother, agitated, went out of the house.

original: hā hatāsmīty uvācātha patitā ca mahītale // / //🔽vilalāpa suduḥkhārtā putraśokena pīḍitā /
analyzed: hā hatā asmi iti uvāca atha patitā ca mahī tale  vilalāpa su duḥkha ārtā putra śokena pīḍitā
translated: And she said, Alas! I am doomed! and fell down on the ground.🔽 She lamented, greatly afflicted, tormented by grief for her son.

original: hā putra putreti vadan karuṇaṃ kurarī yathā // / //
analyzed: hā putra putra iti vadan karuṇam kurarī yathā
translated: Crying out Alas, my son! piteously, like a female osprey.

analyzed: śruti adhyayana sampūrṇaḥ japa homa parāyaṇaḥ
translated: You were full of Vedic studies, devoted to meditation and oblations.

original: āgataṃ tvāṃ gṛhadvāre kadā pṛcchāmi putraka // / //
analyzed: āgatam tvām gṛha dvāre kadā pṛcchāmi putraka
translated: When will I ask you, my son, who has come to the door of the house?

original: trilokyām api śrūyate candanaṃ kila śītalam /
analyzed: trilokyām api śrūyate candanam kila śītalam
translated: It is heard in the three worlds that sandalwood is indeed cooling.

analyzed: putra gāta pariṣvaṅgaḥ candanāt api śītalaḥ
translated: But the embrace of a son is cooler than sandalwood.

analyzed: pariṣvajitum icchāmi tvām aham putra su priyam
translated: I desire to embrace you, my dearly beloved son.

original: pañcatvaṃ ca gamiṣyāmi tvad vihīnā suduḥkhitā // / //
analyzed: pañcatvam ca gamiṣyāmi tvat vihīnā su duḥkhitā
translated: Deprived of you, I will die, greatly afflicted.

analyzed: evam vilapatī dīnā putra śokena pīḍitā
translated: Lamenting thus, the wretched one, afflicted by grief for her son,

analyzed: mūrchitā vihvalā dīnā nipapāta mahī tale
translated: fell down on the ground, unconscious, agitated, and wretched.

original: bhāryāṃ ca patitāṃ dṛṣṭvā putraśokena pīḍitaḥ /
analyzed: bhāryām ca patitām dṛṣṭvā putra śokena pīḍitaḥ
translated: Seeing his wife fallen down, afflicted by grief for her son,

analyzed: cukopa muni śreṣṭhaḥ citrasenam nṛpam tadā
translated: The best of sages became angry with King Chitrasena.

analyzed: dīrghatapāḥ uvāca
translated: Dīrghatapas said:

original: yāhi yāhi mahāpāpa mā mukhaṃ darśayasva me /
analyzed: yāhi yāhi mahā pāpa mā mukham darśayasva me
translated: Go away, go away, O great sinner, do not show me your face.

original: kiṃ tvayā ghātito vipra hy akāmāc ca suto mama // / //
analyzed: kim tvayā ghātitaḥ vipra hi akāmāt ca sutaḥ mama
translated: Why did you kill my son, a brahmin, without any desire?

analyzed: brahmahatyāḥ bhaviṣyanti bahavaḥ te narādhipa
translated: O king, you will have many brahmin-slaughters.

original: sakuṭumbasya me tvaṃ hi mṛtyur evam upāgataḥ // / //
analyzed: sa kuṭumbasya me tvam hi mṛtyuḥ evam upāgataḥ
translated: You have come as death to me and my family.

original: evam uktvā tato vipro vicintya ca punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas vipraḥ vicintya ca punar punar
translated: Having said this, the brahmin thought again and again.

original: krodhaṃ parityajya tato munimārgaṃ jagāma ha // / //
analyzed: krodham parityajya tatas muni mārgam jagāma ha
translated: Then, abandoning anger, he went on the path of the sages.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ uvāca
translated: The sage said:

original: udvegaṃ tyaja bho rājan duruktaṃ gaditaṃ mayā /
analyzed: udvegam tyaja bho rājan duruktam gaditam mayā
translated: O king, abandon your distress. The harsh words I spoke

analyzed: putra śoka abhibhūtena duḥkham āptena mānada
translated: were uttered by me, O bestower of honor, overwhelmed by grief for my son and afflicted by sorrow.

original: kiṃ karoti naraḥ prājñaḥ preryamāṇaḥ svakarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: kim karoti naraḥ prājñaḥ preryamāṇaḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: What can a wise man do, being impelled by his own actions?

analyzed: prāyeṇa hi manuṣyāṇām buddhiḥ karma anusāriṇī
translated: For the most part, the understanding of men follows their actions.

original: anenaiva prakāreṇa yat tvayā likhitaṃ mama /
analyzed: anena eva prakāreṇa yat tvayā likhitam mama
translated: In this very way, what you have written to me,

original: paraṃ tava bhaviṣyanti viprahatyā na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: param tava bhaviṣyanti viprahatyāḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: will certainly be brahmin-slaughters for you. There is no doubt.

analyzed: brahma kṣatra viśām madhye śūdraḥ vā ca antyaja ādiṣu
translated: Among Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, Shudras, or the lowest castes,

original: kastvaṃ kathaya satyaṃ me kasmāc ca nihataḥ sutaḥ // / //
analyzed: kaḥ tvam kathaya satyam me kasmāt ca nihataḥ sutaḥ
translated: Who are you? Tell me the truth. And why was my son killed?

analyzed: citrasenaḥ uvāca
translated: Chitrasena said:

original: vijñāpayāmi viprarṣe kṣantavyaṃ ca mamopari /🔽nāhaṃ vipro 'smi bho tāta na śūdro naiva vaiśyajaḥ // / //
analyzed: vijñāpayāmi viprarṣe kṣantavyam ca mama upari  na aham vipraḥ smi bho tāta na śūdraḥ na eva vaiśya jaḥ
translated: I inform you, O Brahmin sage, you should forgive me.🔽I am not a Brahmin, O father, nor a Shudra, nor born of a Vaishya.

analyzed: na ca api ca antya jātīyaḥ kṣatriyaḥ ham dvijottama
translated: I am not of the lowest caste, O best of Brahmins, I am a Kshatriya.

original: kāśirājo mṛgān hantum āgato vanam uttamam // / //
analyzed: kāśi rājaḥ mṛgān hantum āgataḥ vanam uttamam
translated: I am the king of Kashi, come to the excellent forest to hunt deer.

analyzed: bhramatā pātitaḥ tatra mṛga rūpa dharaḥ muniḥ
translated: While wandering there, a sage in the form of a deer was accidentally killed by me.

original: kiṃ kartavyaṃ mayā vipra upāyaṃ kathayasva me // / //
analyzed: kim kartavyam mayā vipraḥ upāyam kathayasva me
translated: What should I do, O Brahmin? Tell me the means.

analyzed: dīrghatapāḥ uvāca
translated: Dirghatapa said:

original: brahmahatyā na śakyeta ekena tarituṃ vibho /
analyzed: brahmahatyā na śakyeta ekena taritum vibho
translated: O lord, the sin of killing a Brahmin cannot be borne alone.

analyzed: deśe kāle yathāśaktyā tat śṛṇuṣva narādhipa
translated: Listen, O king, to the means, according to place and time, to the best of my ability.

original: catvāro me sutā rājan sabhāryā mātṛpūrvakāḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ me sutāḥ rājan sa bhāryāḥ mātṛ pūrvakāḥ
translated: O king, my four sons, along with their wives and mothers,

original: mayā saha na jīvanti ṛṣyaśṛṅgasya kāraṇe // / //
analyzed: mayā saha na jīvanti ṛṣyaśṛṅgasya kāraṇe
translated: will not live with me, because of Rishyashringa.

original: upāyaṃ śobhanaṃ tāta kathayāmi śṛṇuṣva bhoḥ /
analyzed: upāyam śobhanam tāta kathayāmi śṛṇuṣva bhoḥ
translated: O father, I tell you an excellent means, listen.

original: śakyate yadi cet kartuṃ sukhopāyaṃ nareśvara // / //
analyzed: śakyate yadi ced kartum sukha upāyam nareśvara
translated: O Lord of men, if it can be done by an easy means,

analyzed: sa kuṭumba samastān naḥ dāhayasva anale nṛpa
translated: then cremate all of us along with our families in the fire, O king.

analyzed: asthīni narmadā toye śūlabhede vinikṣipeḥ
translated: Cast our bones into the waters of Narmada at Shulabhadra.

analyzed: narmadā dakṣiṇe kūle śūlabheda iti viśrutam
translated: On the southern bank of Narmada, there is a place known as Shulabhadra.

analyzed: sarva pāpa haram tīrtham sarva tīrtha uttamottamam
translated: That holy place removes all sins, it is the best of all holy places.

original: śucir bhūtvā mamāsthīni kṣipa tvaṃ śūlabhedake /
analyzed: śuciḥ bhūtvā mama asthīni kṣipa tvam śūlabhedake
translated: Having become pure, cast my bones into Shulabhadra.

original: mucyate sarvapāpebhyo mama vākyāt na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: mucyate sarva pāpebhyaḥ mama vākyāt na saṃśayaḥ
translated: By my words, he will be freed from all sins, there is no doubt.

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: ādeśo dīyatāṃ tāta kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: ādeśaḥ dīyatām tāta kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Give me instructions, O father, I will do it, there is no doubt.

original: sarvasvam api yat kiṃcid rājyaṃ kośaḥ striyaḥ sutāḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva svam api yat kiṃcid rājyam kośaḥ striyaḥ sutāḥ
translated: Even my entire kingdom, treasury, wives, and sons,

original: tava dānaṃ prayacchāmi vipra māṃ tvaṃ prasīda ca /
analyzed: tava dānam prayacchāmi vipra mām tvam prasīda ca
translated: I will give you as a gift, O Brahmin, be pleased with me.

analyzed: parasparam vivadatoḥ muni rājñoḥ tadā nṛpa
translated: Then, O king, the sage and the king were arguing with each other.

original: sphuṭitvā hṛdayaṃ śīghraṃ muner bhāryā mṛtā tadā /
analyzed: sphuṭitvā hṛdayam śīghram muneḥ bhāryā mṛtā tadā
translated: The sage's wife's heart burst open and she died instantly.

analyzed: putra śoka samākrāntā nirjīvā patitā kṣitau
translated: Overcome with grief for her son, she fell lifeless on the ground.

original: putrāś ca mātṛśokena sarve pañcatvam āgatāḥ /
analyzed: putrāḥ ca mātṛ śokena sarve pañcatvam āgatāḥ
translated: And all the sons also died due to grief for their mother.

original: snuṣāś caiva tu tāḥ sarvā mṛtāś ca saha bhartṛbhiḥ // / //
analyzed: snuṣāḥ ca eva tu tāḥ sarvāḥ mṛtāḥ ca saha bhartṛbhiḥ
translated: and all their daughters-in-law died along with their husbands.

original: pañcatvaṃ tu gatān sarvān munimukhyān nirīkṣya tān /
analyzed: pañcatvam tu gatān sarvān muni mukhyān nirīkṣya tān
translated: Seeing all those chief sages dead,

original: viprāś cāhvānitās tena te tatrāśramavāsinaḥ // / //🔽tebhyo nivedayāmāsa yathā vṛttaṃ narottamaḥ /
analyzed: viprāḥ ca āhvānitāḥ tena te tatra āśrama vāsinaḥ  tebhyaḥ nivedayāmāsa yathā vṛttam nara uttamaḥ
translated: the Brahmins residing in the hermitage were summoned by him.🔽To them, the best of men reported what had happened.

original: saṃhatais tair anujñātaḥ kathaṃcid dahya yatnataḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃhataiḥ taiḥ anujñātaḥ kathaṃcid dahya yatnataḥ
translated: With difficulty, he was allowed by them, who were united, to cremate the bodies with effort.

original: dehaṃ svaṃ pāvanaṃ kṛtvāsthīni pragṛhya yatnataḥ /
analyzed: deham svam pāvanam kṛtvā asthīni pragṛhya yatnataḥ
translated: Having purified his own body and carefully collecting the bones,

original: yāmyāṃ hi prasthito rājā pādacārī mahīpatiḥ // / //
analyzed: yāmyām hi prasthitaḥ rājā pāda cārī mahīpatiḥ
translated: the king, the lord of the earth, set out towards the south on foot.

original: na śaknoti yadā gantuṃ chāyāmāśritya tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: na śaknoti yadā gantum chāyām āśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: When he was unable to proceed, he would stand taking shelter in the shade.

original: viśramya ca punar gacchan viśramya ca punaḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: viśramya ca punar gacchan viśramya ca punar punar
translated: And having rested, he would go again and again,

original: sacailaṃ kurute snānamasthīn voḍhā pade pade /🔽vinā jalaṃ nirāhāraḥ so 'gacchad dakṣiṇāmukhaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa cailam kurute snānam asthīn voḍhā pade pade  vinā jalam nirāhāraḥ saḥ gacchat dakṣiṇā mukhaḥ

analyzed: acireṇa eva kālena sa gataḥ narmadā taṭe
translated: In a short while, he reached the banks of the Narmada.

analyzed: āśrama sthān dvijān sarvān papraccha rāja sattamaḥ
translated: The best of kings asked all the Brahmins residing in the hermitage.

analyzed: kathyatām me dvijaśreṣṭhāḥ śūlabhedasya mārgakaḥ
translated: Tell me, O best of Brahmanas, the way to Shulabhadra.

analyzed: viprāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Brahmanas said:

analyzed: narmadā dakṣiṇe kūle gataḥ drakṣyasi na anyathā
translated: On the southern bank of the Narmada, you will see it, not otherwise.

original: ṛṣivākyena vai rājā gato 'tha hi nareśvaraḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣi vākyena vai rājā hi nareśvaraḥ
translated: At the words of the sages, the king, the lord of men, went there.

analyzed: sa dadarśa tatas tīrtham bahu dvija samākulam  bahu druma latā ākīrṇam bahu puṣpa upaśobhitam
translated: He saw the tirtha, crowded with many Brahmins.🔽Filled with many trees and creepers, adorned with many flowers,

analyzed: bahu mūla phala upetam bahu śvāpada śobhitam
translated: Endowed with many roots and fruits, beautified by many wild animals.

analyzed: ṛṣi saṅghaiḥ samākīrṇam nānā vrata dharaiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: Crowded with groups of sages, auspicious ones observing various vows,

analyzed: eka pāda sthitāḥ kecid apare sūrya varcasaḥ
translated: Some standing on one foot, others having the radiance of the sun,

original: ekadṛṣṭisthitāḥ kecid ūrdhvabāhusthitāḥ pare /🔽cāndrāyaṇaparā kecit kecit pakṣopavāsinaḥ // / //🔽māsopavāsinaḥ kecit kecid ṛtumupoṣitāḥ /
analyzed: eka dṛṣṭi sthitāḥ kecid ūrdhva bāhu sthitāḥ pare  cāndrāyaṇa parā kecid kecid pakṣa upavāsinaḥ  māsopavāsinaḥ kecid kecid ṛtum upoṣitāḥ
translated: Some with eyes fixed in one direction, others with arms raised upwards,🔽Some devoted to Chandrayana, some fasting for half a month,🔽Some fasting for a month, some fasting for a season,

analyzed: śīrṇa parṇa āśinaḥ kecid kecid māruta bhojanāḥ
translated: Some eating withered leaves, some subsisting on air,

analyzed: yoga abhyāsa ratāḥ kecid dhyāyantaḥ paramam padam
translated: Some engaged in the practice of yoga, meditating on the supreme state,

analyzed: gārhastham āsthitāḥ kecid kecid ca eva agnihotriṇaḥ
translated: Some following the householder life, some offering agnihotra sacrifices,

original: evaṃ vidhān dvijān dṛṣṭvā jānubhyām avanīṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: evaṃvidhān dvijān dṛṣṭvā jānubhyām avanīm gataḥ
translated: Seeing such Brahmins, he went down on his knees on the ground.

original: praṇamya śirasā rājan rājā vacanam abravīt // / //
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā rājan rājā vacanam abravīt
translated: Bowing his head, O king, the king spoke these words:

original: kasmin deśe tu tat tīrthaṃ kathayadhvaṃ dvijottamāḥ /
analyzed: kasmin deśe tu tat tīrtham kathayadhvam dvijottamāḥ
translated: In which country is that tirtha? Tell me, O best of Brahmins.

original: sarveṣāṃ vāñchitāṃ siddhiṃ dadyāc ca phalam īpsitam // / //
analyzed: sarveṣām vāñchitām siddhim dadyāt ca phalam īpsitam
translated: It should grant the desired perfection and the desired fruit to all.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ uvāca
translated: The sages said:

analyzed: dhanvantara śatam gaccha bhṛgutuṅgasya mūrdhani
translated: Go a hundred dhanushas to the top of Bhrigutunga.

analyzed: kuṇḍam drakṣyasi vistīrṇam toya pūrṇam su śobhanam
translated: You will see a large, beautiful pond full of water.

original: teṣāṃ tadvacanaṃ śrutvā gataḥ kuṇḍasya mūrdhani /
analyzed: teṣām tat vacanam śrutvā gataḥ kuṇḍasya mūrdhani
translated: Having heard their words, he went to the top of the pond.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā hi ca eva tat tīrtham bhrāntiḥ jātā nṛpasya hi
translated: Having seen that tirtha, confusion arose in the king's mind.

original: vīkṣya kuṇḍaṃ mahābhāgaṃ gaṅgāṃ caiva viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: vīkṣya kuṇḍam mahābhāgam gaṅgām ca eva viśeṣataḥ
translated: Having seen that great and fortunate pond, and especially the Ganga,

original: prācīṃ sarasvatīṃ dṛṣṭvā bhrāntirjātā nṛpasya hi // / //
analyzed: prācīm sarasvatīm dṛṣṭvā bhrāntiḥ jātā nṛpasya hi
translated: and having seen the eastern Sarasvati, confusion arose in the king's mind.

analyzed: tatas vismayam āpannaḥ cintayānaḥ muhur muhur  ākāśa saṃsthitam dṛṣṭvā sa āmiṣam kuraram tathā
translated: Then, filled with wonder, he thought again and again.🔽Seeing a flesh-eating curlew perched in the sky,

analyzed: bhramamāṇam gṛhītvā tam vadhyamānam nirāmiṣaiḥ
translated: he grabbed it as it wandered, being attacked by those without flesh.

analyzed: parasparam hi yudhyante sarve ca āmiṣa bhakṣakāḥ
translated: For all of them, who feed on flesh, fight with each other.

analyzed: hataḥ cañcu prahāraiḥ tu kuraraḥ patitaḥ mbhasi
translated: The curlew, struck by the blows of the beak, fell into the water.

original: śūlena śūlinā yatra bhūbhāgaṃ bheditaṃ purā // / //
analyzed: śūlena śūlinā yatra bhū bhāgam bheditam purā

original: tat tīrthasya prabhāveṇa sa sadyaḥ puruṣo 'bhavat /
analyzed: tat tīrthasya prabhāveṇa sa sadyas puruṣaḥ bhavat
translated: By the power of that tirtha, he instantly became a man.

original: vimānasthaṃ tu taṃ dṛṣṭvā krauṃca vai divyarūpiṇam // / //
analyzed: vimāna stham tu tam dṛṣṭvā krauṃca vai divya rūpiṇam
translated: Seeing that curlew, O king, in a divine form, seated in an aerial chariot...

original: apsarobhir gīyamānaṃ nṛpas tat tīrtham āgataḥ /🔽asthīni bhūmau nikṣipya snānaṃ kṛtvā yathā vidhi // / //
analyzed: apsarobhiḥ gīyamānam nṛpaḥ tat tīrtham āgataḥ  asthīni bhūmau nikṣipya snānam kṛtvā yathā vidhi
translated: Being praised by the celestial nymphs, the king came to that tirtha.🔽Having placed the bones on the ground and bathed according to the prescribed rules...

analyzed: tila miśreṇa toyena tarpayitvā iṣṭadevatāḥ
translated: Having offered libations to the desired deities with water mixed with sesame seeds,

analyzed: dhṛtvā asthīni tatas rājā nikṣipya antar jale tathā
translated: The king then took the bones and placed them in the water...

original: kṣaṇam ekaṃ tato vīkṣya rājā ūrdhvamukhaḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇam ekam tatas vīkṣya rājā ūrdhva mukhaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: The king stood with his face upwards for a moment and looked.

original: tāṃ dadarśa tataḥ sarvān devamūrtidharān śubhān // / //🔽divyavastraiś ca saṃvītān divyābharaṇabhūṣitān /
analyzed: tām dadarśa tatas sarvān deva mūrti dharān śubhān  divya vastraiḥ ca saṃvītān divya ābharaṇa bhūṣitān
translated: He saw all of them, auspicious and possessing divine forms...🔽Clad in divine garments and adorned with divine ornaments,

analyzed: vimānaiḥ kāñcanaiḥ divyaiḥ apsaraḥ gaṇa sevitaiḥ
translated: Served by groups of celestial nymphs in divine golden aerial chariots...🔽...

original: pṛthagbhūtāś ca tān sarvān vimāneṣu vyavasthitān /
analyzed: pṛthak bhūtāḥ ca tān sarvān vimāneṣu vyavasthitān
translated: And seeing all of them separately, seated in their aerial cars,

analyzed: utpatataḥ samālokya sa rājā harṣitaḥ bhavat
translated: The king became delighted, seeing them flying up.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ vimānam ārūḍhaḥ citrasenam atha abravīt
translated: The sage, having ascended the aerial car, then spoke to Chitrasena,

original: bho bhoḥ sādhu mahārāja citrasena mahāmate // / //
analyzed: bho bhoḥ sādhu mahā rāja citrasena mahāmate
translated: O great king Chitrasena of great intellect, well done!

analyzed: tvad prasādāt nṛpa śreṣṭha gatiḥ divyā mama adya vai
translated: O best of kings, by your grace, I have now attained a divine state.

original: idaṃ ca yattvayā kiṃcit kṛtaṃ paramaduṣkaram // / //
analyzed: idam ca yat tvayā kiṃcid kṛtam parama duṣkaram
translated: And this little that you have done is extremely difficult to do.

original: svasuto 'pi na śaknoti pitṝṇāṃ kartum īdṛśam /
analyzed: sva sutaḥ pi na śaknoti pitṝṇām kartum īdṛśam
translated: Even one's own son cannot do such a thing for his fathers.

analyzed: madīya vacanāt rājan niṣpāpaḥ tvam bhaviṣyasi
translated: By my words, O king, you will be free from sin.

original: yat tvaṃ drakṣyasi rājendra kāmikaṃ manasepsitam /
analyzed: yat tvam drakṣyasi rāja indra kāmikam manasā īpsitam
translated: Whatever you will see, O lord of kings, as desired by the mind,

analyzed: āśīrvādam tatas dattvā citrasenāya dhīmate
translated: Then having given blessings to the wise Chitrasena,

original: svargaṃ jagāma svasutais tato dīrghatapā muniḥ // / //🔽iti śrīskandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe dīrghatapākhyāno nāmaikonanavatitamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: svargam jagāma sva sutaiḥ tatas dīrghatapāḥ muniḥ  iti śrī skandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe dīrghatapākhyānaḥ nāma ekonanavatitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: The sage Dirghatapas went to heaven with his sons.

analyzed: rks adhyāya
translated: Thus ends the eighty-ninth chapter in the Skanda-purana, in the Revakhanda, named the story of Dirghatapas.🔽Chapter 90

analyzed: uttānapādaḥ uvāca
translated: Utantapada said:

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tad tīrtha māhātmyam citrasenaḥ nareśvaraḥ
translated: Having seen the greatness of that tirtha, King Chitrasena,

original: vipulaṃ tīkṣṇadhāraṃ ca kaṇṭhe cāsi nṛpottama // / //
analyzed: vipulam tīkṣṇa dhāram ca kaṇṭhe ca asi nṛpa uttama
translated: O best of kings, the sword was broad, sharp-edged, and at the neck.

analyzed: devān sarvān hṛdi dhyāyan brahma viṣṇu maheśvarān
translated: Meditating in the heart on all the gods, Brahma, Vishnu, and Maheshvara,

analyzed: vinikṣipan atha ātmānau pratyakṣau viṣṇu śaṅkarau
translated: And casting himself down, the two, Vishnu and Shankara, became manifest.

original: kare dhṛtvā tu rājānaṃ rudro vacanam abravīt /
analyzed: kare dhṛtvā tu rājānam rudraḥ vacanam abravīt
translated: Holding the king by the hand, Rudra spoke these words:

analyzed: haraḥ uvāca
translated: Hara said:

original: prāṇatyāgaṃ mahārāja akāle mā kuruṣva ha // / //
analyzed: prāṇatyāgam mahā rāja akāle mā kuruṣva ha
translated: O great king, do not give up your life untimely.

original: adyāpi tu yuvāsi tvaṃ na yuktaṃ maraṇaṃ tava /
analyzed: adyā api tu yuvā asi tvam na yuktam maraṇam tava
translated: You are still young, death is not proper for you.

original: svasthānaṃ gaccha vai śīghraṃ bhogān bhuṅkṣva yathepsitān // / //
analyzed: sva sthānam gaccha vai śīghram bhogān bhuṅkṣva yathā īpsitān
translated: Go quickly to your own place and enjoy pleasures as desired.

original: bhuṅkṣva niṣkaṇṭakaṃ rājyaṃ nākaṃ śakra ivāparaḥ /
analyzed: bhuṅkṣva niṣkaṇṭakam rājyam nākam śakraḥ iva aparaḥ
translated: Enjoy the kingdom free from thorns, like another Indra in heaven.

analyzed: citrasenaḥ uvāca
translated: Chitrasena said:

original: na rājyaṃ kāmaye deva na putrān na ca bāndhavān // / //
analyzed: na rājyam kāmaye deva na putrān na ca bāndhavān
translated: I do not desire the kingdom, O god, nor sons, nor relatives.

original: na bhāryāṃ na ca kośaṃ ca na gāśca na turaṅgamān /
analyzed: na bhāryām na ca kośam ca na gāḥ ca na turaṅgamān
translated: Not a wife, nor a treasury, nor cows, nor horses.

original: muñcasva māṃ mahādeva avighnaṃ kriyatāṃ mama // / //
analyzed: muñcasva mām mahādeva avighnam kriyatām mama
translated: Release me, O Mahesha, let there be no obstacle for me.

analyzed: svarga prāptiḥ mama adyā eva tvad prasādāt maheśvara
translated: Today itself I shall attain heaven, O Maheshvara, by your grace.

analyzed: devaḥ uvāca
translated: The god said:

original: yasyāgrato bhaved viṣṇurbrahmā rudras tathaiva ca // / //
analyzed: yasya agratas bhavet viṣṇuḥ brahmā rudraḥ tathā eva ca
translated: In front of whom would be Vishnu, Brahma, and Rudra as well.

original: svargeṇa tasya kiṃ kāryaṃ gato 'sau kiṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: svargeṇa tasya kim kāryam sau kim kariṣyati
translated: What need has he of heaven? What will he do having gone there?

original: tuṣṭāva tvāṃ trayo devā vṛṇīṣva varam uttamam // / //
analyzed: tuṣṭāva tvām trayaḥ devāḥ vṛṇīṣva varam uttamam
translated: The three gods have praised you. Choose an excellent boon.

analyzed: yathā īpsitam mahā rāja satyam etat na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O great king, it is as desired. There is no doubt about this.

analyzed: citrasenaḥ uvāca
translated: Chitrasena said:

analyzed: yadi tuṣṭāḥ trayaḥ devāḥ brahma viṣṇu maheśvarāḥ
translated: If the three gods Brahma, Vishnu, and Maheshvara are pleased,

original: adya prabhṛti yuṣmābhiḥ sthātavyam iha sarvadā /
analyzed: adya prabhṛti yuṣmābhiḥ sthātavyam iha sarvadā
translated: From today onwards, you all should always stay here.

original: gayāśiraṃ yathā puṇyaṃ kṛtaṃ yuṣmābhir eva ca // / //
analyzed: gayāśiram yathā puṇyam kṛtam yuṣmābhiḥ eva ca
translated: Just as Gaya Shira has been made sacred by you all,

original: tathaivedaṃ tu kartavyaṃ śūlabhedaṃ ca pāvanam /
analyzed: tathā evā idam tu kartavyam śūlabhedam ca pāvanam
translated: In the same way, this Shula Bheda should also be made sacred.
