original: na labhante śriyaṃ nāke martye pātālagocare // / //🔽kurukṣetraṃ yathā gaṅgā naimiṣaṃ puṣkaraṃ tathā /
analyzed: na labhante śriyam nāke martye pātāla gocare  kurukṣetram yathā gaṅgā naimiṣam puṣkaram tathā
translated: O descendant of Kuru, other holy places do not attain the glory of this holy place, in heaven, on earth, or in the nether world.

analyzed: vārāṇasī ca kedāram prayāgaḥ nṛpa nandana
translated: Just as Kurukshetra, Ganga, Naimisha, Pushkara, Varanasi, Kedara, and Prayaga, O son of a king,

analyzed: ravitīrthasya sarvāṇi kalām na arhanti ṣoḍaśīm
translated: do not deserve even a sixteenth part of Ravitīrtha.

original: ravitīrthe ca yad dattaṃ śṛṇuṣva kurunandana // / //
analyzed: ravitīrthe ca yat dattam śṛṇuṣva kuru nandana
translated: Listen, O descendant of Kuru, to what is given at Ravitīrtha.

analyzed: sneha arthe kathayiṣyāmi vārdhakye na asti paṇḍitaḥ
translated: For the sake of affection, I will tell, for there is no learned person in old age.

analyzed: śṛṇvantu ṛṣayaḥ sarve taponiṣṭhāḥ mahātmānaḥ
translated: May all the sages, the great souls devoted to austerities, listen.

analyzed: śrutam me rudra sānnidhye skanda rudra gaṇaiḥ saha
translated: I have heard in the presence of Rudra, along with Skanda, Rudra, and the attendants,

analyzed: pārvatyā prārthitaḥ śambhūḥ avitīrthasya yat phalam
translated: when Parvati requested Shambhu about the fruits of Ravitīrtha.

analyzed: śambhunā api tat ākhyātam girijāyāḥ puras tadā
translated: Shambhu also narrated it then in front of Girija.

analyzed: tat sarvam ekacittena rudra udgītam śrutam mayā
translated: I have heard all that sung by Rudra with a single-pointed mind.

analyzed: durbhikṣa upahatāḥ viprāḥ narmadā taṭam āśritāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, afflicted by famine, they resorted to the banks of Narmada.

original: uddālako vaśiṣṭhaś ca māṇḍavyo gautamas tathā // / //
analyzed: uddālakaḥ vaśiṣṭhaḥ ca māṇḍavyaḥ gautamaḥ tathā
translated: Uddalaka, Vasishtha, Mandavya, and Gautama,🔽O king, the great sage Vishvamitra, and the great sage Bharadvaja,🔽O king, the great sage Jamadagni, and the great sage Kashyapa,🔽these and many other great sages, O king, resorted to the banks of Narmada.

analyzed: yājñavalkyaḥ śāṇḍilyaḥ cyavanaḥ bhārgavaḥ tathā
translated: Yajnavalkya, Shandilya, Chyavana, Bhargava,

original: nāśake turvibhāṇḍaś ca bālakhilyādayas tathā // / //🔽śātātapo 'pi śaṅkhaś ca jaiminir gobhilas tathā /
analyzed: nāśake turvibhāṇḍaḥ ca bālakhilya ādayaḥ tathā  śātātapaḥ śaṅkhaḥ ca jaiminiḥ gobhilaḥ tathā
translated: Vibhandaka in Nasika, Balakhilya and others,🔽Satatapa, Shankha, Jaimini, Gobhila,

analyzed: jaigīṣavyaḥ śatānīkaḥ ṛṣi saṅghāḥ samāgatāḥ
translated: Jaigishavya, Shatanika - the groups of sages assembled,

original: tīrthayātrā kṛtā tais tu narmadāyā samantataḥ /
analyzed: tīrtha yātrā kṛtā taiḥ tu narmadāyā samantataḥ
translated: they undertook pilgrimages all around the Narmada river.

analyzed: āditya īśam samāyātāḥ prasaṅgāt ṛṣi sattamāḥ
translated: The best of sages came to Aditya by chance,

analyzed: vṛkṣaiḥ saṃchāditam sarvam dhavaiḥ tinduka pāṭalaiḥ
translated: the entire place was covered with trees - Dhava, Tinduka, Patala,

analyzed: jambīraiḥ arjunaiḥ kundaiḥ jaṭā kesara kiṃśukaiḥ
translated: Jamvira, Arjuna, Kunda, Jata, Kesara, and Kinsuka,

analyzed: punnāga nārikeraiḥ tu khadiraiḥ kalpapādapaiḥ  aneka śvāpada ākīrṇam mṛga mālā samākulam
translated: Punnaga, coconut, Khadira, Kalpa trees,🔽full of many beasts, and herds of deer,

analyzed: ṛkṣa hasti samāyuktam citrakaiḥ ca su śobhitam
translated: with bears and elephants, and beautifully adorned with colorful birds,

analyzed: praviśya ṛṣayaḥ sarve vane puṣpa phala ākule
translated: entering the forest full of flowers and fruits, all the sages,

original: vanānte ca nārī śubhrā dṛṣṭā raktāmbarānvitā /
analyzed: vana ante ca nārī śubhrā dṛṣṭā rakta ambara anvitā
translated: at the end of the forest, saw a white woman dressed in red garments,

analyzed: rakta mālyā su śobhā āḍhyā rasta candana carcitā
translated: wearing red garlands, full of beauty, anointed with red sandalwood paste,

original: raktābharaṇasaṃyuktā śaśihastā bhayāvahā /🔽tasyāḥ samīpago dṛṣṭaḥ kṛṣṇajīmūtasannibhaḥ // / //
analyzed: rakta ābharaṇa saṃyuktā śaśi hastā bhaya āvahā  tasyāḥ samīpa gaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ kṛṣṇa jīmūta sannibhaḥ
translated: She was adorned with red ornaments, had a moon in her hand, and was terrifying.

original: mahākāyo bhīmavaktraḥ pāśahasto bhayāvahaḥ /🔽anādhṛṣyo vayovṛddha āturaḥ piṅgalocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: mahā kāyaḥ bhīma vaktraḥ pāśa hastaḥ bhaya āvahaḥ  anādhṛṣyaḥ vayaḥ vṛddhaḥ āturaḥ piṅga locanaḥ
translated: Near her was seen one resembling a dark cloud, with a huge body, a terrible face, a noose in his hand, and frightening.

analyzed: dīrgha jihvaḥ karāla āsyaḥ tīkṣṇā daṃṣṭraḥ durāsadaḥ
translated: He was unassailable, old in age, sick, with tawny eyes, with a long tongue, a terrible face, sharp fangs, and difficult to approach.

original: vṛddhāṃ striyaṃ kuruśreṣṭha te paśyan viprapuṃgavāḥ // / //
analyzed: vṛddhām striyam kuruśreṣṭha te paśyan vipra puṃgavāḥ
translated: O best of the Kurus! Those best of Brahmins saw the old woman and him.

original: tataḥ samīpagā vṛddhā sa ca vṛddhaś ca bhārata /
analyzed: tatas samīpa gā vṛddhā sa ca vṛddhaḥ ca bhārata
translated: Then the old woman and the old man, O Bharata,

analyzed: svādhyāya nirataiḥ vipraiḥ tau pṛṣṭau pāpa karmiṇau
translated: were questioned by the Brahmins devoted to self-study, those two sinners.

analyzed: vṛddhau ūcatuḥ
translated: The old ones said:

analyzed: yuṣmākam yaminaḥ sarve tiṣṭhadhvam tīrtha madhyatas
translated: All of you are Yama's messengers. Stay in the middle of the holy place.

original: śīghraṃ praviśyatāṃ sarve narmadā caiva sevyatām // / //
analyzed: śīghram praviśyatām sarve narmadā ca eva sevyatām
translated: Enter quickly and serve the Narmada.

original: tayoḥ śrutvā tu vacanaṃ brāhmaṇāḥ śaṃsitavratāḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ śrutvā tu vacanam brāhmaṇāḥ śaṃsita vratāḥ
translated: Having heard their words, the Brahmins of praised vows,

original: jagmus te narmadākacchaṃ dṛṣṭvā revāṃ dvijottamāḥ // / //
analyzed: jagmuḥ te narmadā kaccham dṛṣṭvā revām dvijottamāḥ
translated: those best of Brahmins, having seen the Narmada, went to the banks of the Narmada.

original: natāḥ kecit stuvanty anye jayadevi namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: natāḥ kecid stuvanti anye jayadevi namaḥ stu te
translated: Some bowed down, others praised, Victory to Goddess Devi, salutations to you.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sages said:

original: namo 'stu te siddhagaṇair niṣevite namo 'stu te sarvapavitramaṅgale /
analyzed: namaḥ stu te siddha gaṇaiḥ niṣevite namaḥ stu te sarva pavitra maṅgale
translated: Salutations to you, who are served by the assembly of Siddhas, salutations to you, who are the most sacred and auspicious of all.

analyzed: namaḥ stu te vipra sahasra pūjite
translated: Salutations to you, who are worshipped by thousands of Brahmins.

analyzed: namaḥ stu te rudra samudbhave pare
translated: Salutations to you, who are the supreme origin of Rudra.

original: namo'stu te sarvapavitrapāvane namo 'stu te devi vare prasīda naḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ astu te sarva pavitra pāvane namaḥ stu te devi vare prasīda naḥ
translated: Salutations to you, who are the most sacred of all purifiers, salutations to you, O Goddess, O best one, be gracious to us.

original: namo 'stu te śītajale sukhaprade saridvare pāpahare dayānvite // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu te śīta jale sukha prade saridvare pāpa hare dayā anvite
translated: Salutations to you, who have cool waters, who bestow happiness, who are the best of rivers, who remove sins, who are full of compassion.

analyzed: aneka bhūta aṅga su śobhita aṅge gandharva yakṣa uraga pāvita aṅge
translated: Your body is adorned with the limbs of many beings, your body is purified by Gandharvas, Yakshas and serpents.

original: mahāgajaughā mahiṣā varāhāḥ krīḍanti toye sumahormimālaiḥ // / //
analyzed: mahā gaja oghāḥ mahiṣāḥ varāhāḥ krīḍanti toye su mahā ūrmi mālaiḥ
translated: Great herds of elephants, buffaloes and boars play in the water with its beautiful waves.

analyzed: namāmaḥ sarve vara de sukha prade smān paśu pāśa baddhān
translated: We all bow to you, O bestower of boons, O giver of happiness, we are bound by the fetters of animals.

analyzed: pāpaiḥ anekaiḥ paśu pāśa baddhāḥ bhramanti tāvat narakeṣu nityam
translated: Bound by the fetters of animals due to many sins, they wander in hells forever.

original: yāvat tavāmbho nahi saṃspṛśanti spṛṣṭaṃ karaiścandramaso raveś ca /
analyzed: yāvat tava ambhaḥ nahi saṃspṛśanti spṛṣṭam karaiḥ candramasaḥ raveḥ ca
translated: As long as they do not touch your water, touched by the rays of the moon and the sun.

analyzed: aneka saṃsāra bhaya arditānām pāpaiḥ anekaiḥ pariveṣṭitānām
translated: Of those afflicted by the fear of many worldly existences, who are enveloped by many sins.

original: gatis tvam ambhojasamānavaktre dvandvair anekair abhisaṃvṛtānām /
analyzed: gatiḥ tvam ambhoja samāna vaktre dvandvaiḥ anekaiḥ abhisaṃvṛtānām
translated: O lotus-faced one, you are the refuge of those who are enveloped by many pairs of opposites.

analyzed: nadyaḥ tu pūjyāḥ vimalāḥ bhavanti
translated: But the rivers, when they become pure, are worthy of worship.

analyzed: tvām devi ca āsādya na
translated: Having attained you, O Goddess, there is no doubt here.

original: dukhāturāṇām abhayaṃ dadāsi devair anekair abhipūjitāsi /
analyzed: dukha āturāṇām abhayam dadāsi devaiḥ anekaiḥ abhipūjitā asi
translated: You grant fearlessness to those who are afflicted with suffering, you are worshipped by many gods.

analyzed: viṣ mūtra deha arṇava magna dehāḥ bhavanti tāvat narakeṣu martyāḥ
translated: Mortals are immersed in the ocean of bodies of feces and urine in hells until they touch the water

original: mahāniloddhūtataraṅgabhaṅgaṃ jalaṃ na yāvat tava saṃspṛśanti /
analyzed: mahā anila uddhūta taraṅga bhaṅgam jalam na yāvat tava saṃspṛśanti
translated: Which is agitated by the waves of the great wind.

original: mlecchāḥ pulindās tvatha yātudhānāḥ pibanti cāmbhastava devi puṇyam // / //
analyzed: mlecchāḥ pulindāḥ tu atha yātudhānāḥ pibanti ca ambhaḥ tava devi puṇyam
translated: Even the Mlecchas, Pulindas, and Yatudhanas drink your sacred water, O Goddess.

original: te 'pi pramuñcanti bhayāt tu ghorāt kim atra viprā bhayapāpabhītāḥ /
analyzed: te pi pramuñcanti bhayāt tu ghorāt kim atra viprāḥ bhaya pāpa bhītāḥ
translated: They too release (you) from terrible fear. What fear of sin do the Brahmins have here?

original: ghore yuge 'smin kalināmnyapuṇye tvaṃ bhrājase kālajalaughapūrṇe // / //
analyzed: ghore yuge smin kali nāmni apuṇye tvam bhrājase kāla jala ogha pūrṇe
translated: In this terrible age named Kali, which is inauspicious and filled with the flood of the Kali Yuga, you shine.

original: devyatra nakṣatrapathe 'pi gaṅgā tava prasādād divi devyatiṣṭhat /
analyzed: devī atra nakṣatra pathe gaṅgā tava prasādāt divi devī atiṣṭhat
translated: O Goddess, here in the path of the stars, the Ganga, by your grace, remained in heaven, O Goddess.

original: kāle yatheṣṭaṃ paripālaya tvaṃ yāsyāma lokaṃ tava suprasādāt // / //
analyzed: kāle yatheṣṭam paripālaya tvam yāsyāma lokam tava su prasādāt
translated: In time, protect as you wish. We will go to your world through your great grace.

original: vayaṃ tathā tvaṃ kuru naḥ prasādaṃ tvām āśritās tvāṃ śaraṇaṃ gatā vai /
analyzed: vayam tathā tvam kuru naḥ prasādam tvām āśritāḥ tvām śaraṇam gatāḥ vai
translated: We are like that, please do us a favor, we have resorted to you, we have gone to you for refuge.

original: gatis tvam evātra piteva putraṃ tvam ādideva prabhave vicitre // / //
analyzed: gatiḥ tvam eva atra pitā iva putram tvam ādideva prabhave vicitre
translated: You are the only refuge here, like a father to a son, O primordial god, in the wonderful beginning of creation...

analyzed: kāle pi anāvṛṣṭi bhavam kṣayam ca rakṣasva
translated: ...protect from the destruction caused by drought even in time.

analyzed: sarvam jagataḥ svarūpam
translated: ...protect the entire form of the universe...

original: evaṃ stutā mahādevī narmadā saritāṃ varā /
analyzed: evam stutā mahā devī narmadā saritām varā
translated: Thus praised, the great goddess Narmada, the best of rivers,

analyzed: pratyakṣā sā parābhūtā brāhmaṇānām yudhiṣṭhira
translated: appeared before the Brahmins, O Yudhishthira...

analyzed: narmadā uvāca
translated: Narmada said:

original: tuṣṭāhaṃ varadā viprā dāsye vo vāñchitaṃ phalam /
analyzed: tuṣṭā aham vara dā viprāḥ dāsye vaḥ vāñchitam phalam
translated: I am pleased, O Brahmins, I will grant you the desired fruit.

original: tato 'varṣan mahāmeghā dhānyaṃ ca pracuraṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: tatas varṣan mahā meghāḥ dhānyam ca pracuram tathā
translated: Then the great clouds rained, and there was plenty of grain...

analyzed: kanda mūla phalam śākam sukham sarva saṃśritam
translated: ...potatoes, roots, fruits, vegetables, happiness, and everything necessary.

analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: paṭhanti ye stotram idaṃ narendra śṛṇvanti bhaktyā parayaā prapannāḥ // / //
analyzed: paṭhanti ye stotram idam narendra śṛṇvanti bhaktyā parayā prapannāḥ
translated: Those who recite this hymn, O king, and listen to it with great devotion and surrender...

original: tebhyo 'ntakāle sariduttameyaṃ gatiṃ viśaddhāṃ nitarāṃ dadāti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ nta kāle sarit uttamā iyam gatim viśaddhām nitarām dadāti
translated: ...to them, at the time of death, this best of rivers grants a very pure and excellent path.

original: prātaḥ samutthāya samāna evaṃ saṃkīrtayed rudramumāṃ ca devīm // / //
analyzed: prātar samutthāya samānaḥ evam saṃkīrtayet rudram umām ca devīm
translated: Having risen in the morning, one should recite this hymn to Rudra and Goddess Uma.

original: pāpāni sarvāṇi layaṃ grayānti samāśrayante ca mahānubhāvāḥ /
analyzed: pāpāni sarvāṇi layam samāśrayante ca mahā anubhāvāḥ
translated: All sins are destroyed and great beings take refuge in them.

original: pāpais tu muktā divi modayante śambhorgirā caiva tu nānyathā ca // / //
analyzed: pāpaiḥ tu muktāḥ divi modayante śambhoḥ girā ca eva tu nā anyathā ca
translated: Liberated from sins, they rejoice in heaven by the word of Shambhu and not otherwise.

analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: dṛṣṭās te puruṣā nānyā narmadātaṭam āśritāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ te puruṣāḥ na anyāḥ narmadā taṭam āśritāḥ
translated: Those five men were seen, no others, resorting to the banks of Narmada.

analyzed: snāna deva arccanaiḥ yuktāḥ pañca eva tu mahā balāḥ
translated: Endowed with bathing and worship of gods, they were indeed very powerful.

analyzed: te dṛṣṭāḥ brāhmaṇaiḥ sarvaiḥ veda vedāṅga pāragaiḥ
translated: They were seen by all the Brahmins who were masters of the Vedas and Vedangas.

analyzed: viprāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Brahmins said:

original: dinānte ca striyor yugmaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ raudraṃ bhayāvaham // / //
analyzed: dina ante ca striyoḥ yugmam dṛṣṭam raudram bhaya āvaham
translated: At the end of the day, a pair of terrible and fearful women was seen.

original: trayo vṛddhāś ca puruṣāḥ pāśahastā bhayāvahāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ vṛddhāḥ ca puruṣāḥ pāśa hastāḥ bhaya āvahāḥ
translated: Three old men, fearful with noose in hand,

analyzed: durddharāḥ durnisaṃkāśāḥ itas ca itas ca cañcalāḥ
translated: unbearable, ill-formed, restless here and there,

original: vyāharanti bhiyā vācā ākāṅkṣā darśanasya ca /
analyzed: vyāharanti bhiyā vācā ākāṅkṣā darśanasya ca
translated: spoke with fear and longed for a sight.

analyzed: aparaspariṇaḥ sarve nirīkṣante parasparam
translated: All of them, not belonging to each other, looked at each other.

original: teṣu saṅgheṣu yatproktaṃ tatsarvaṃ kathayāmi te /
analyzed: teṣu saṅgheṣu yat proktam tat sarvam kathayāmi te
translated: I shall tell you everything that was said among those groups.

analyzed: puruṣāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The men said:

original: tīrthāvagāhanaṃ sarvaiḥ pūrvapaścimadakṣiṇe // / //🔽uttare ca kṛtaṃ bhaktyā na pāpaṃ tad vyapohitam /
analyzed: tīrtha avagāhanam sarvaiḥ pūrva paścima dakṣiṇe  uttare ca kṛtam bhaktyā na pāpam tat vyapohitam
translated: By all, bathing in the holy places in the east, west and south,🔽And in the north, done with devotion, that sin is not removed.

analyzed: niṣpāpāḥ ca atra sañjātāḥ tīrthasya asya prabhāvataḥ
translated: And here, by the power of this holy place, they have become sinless.

analyzed: śṛṇvantu ṛṣayaḥ sarve agni jvālā upamāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: May all the sages, the twice-born ones resembling the flames of fire, listen.

original: pātakāni ca ghorāṇi yāny acintyāni dehinām // / //🔽pāpiṣṭhena tu cānena garordārā vidūṣitāḥ /
analyzed: pātakāni ca ghorāṇi yāni acintyāni dehinām  pāpiṣṭhena tu ca anena garoḥ dārāḥ vidūṣitāḥ
translated: The terrible sins that are inconceivable for embodied beings,🔽By this most sinful one, the wife of Garga was defiled.

original: hṛtaṃ cānyena mitrasya suvarṇaṃ ca tathā ca vai // / //
analyzed: hṛtam ca anyena mitrasya suvarṇam ca tathā ca vai
translated: And gold belonging to a friend was stolen by another,

original: brahmahatyā kṛtā raudrā kṛtaṃ cānyena pātakam /🔽surāpānaṃ tu cāpy asya saṃjātaṃ cānyakāmataḥ // / //
analyzed: brahmahatyā kṛtā raudrā kṛtam ca anyena pātakam  surā pānam tu ca api asya saṃjātam ca anya kāmataḥ
translated: And by another, the terrible sin of killing a Brahmin was committed.🔽And the sin of drinking liquor arose for him due to the desire of another,

original: govadhaṃ pāpam etena kṛtam ekena pāpinā /
analyzed: go vadham pāpam etena kṛtam ekena pāpinā
translated: And the sin of killing a cow was committed by this one sinner.

analyzed: akāmatas sarveṣām pātakāni narādhipa
translated: O king, even unintentionally, all of them have committed sins.

original: brāhmaṇās tāṃs tu te dṛṣṭvā pāpiṣṭhā gatakalmaṣāḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ tān tu te dṛṣṭvā pāpiṣṭhāḥ gata kalmaṣāḥ
translated: The Brahmins, seeing them, the most sinful ones, their sins gone,

analyzed: tīrthasya asya prabhāveṇa narmadāyāḥ prabhāvataḥ
translated: By the power of this holy place, by the power of Narmada,

original: na kvācit pātakānāṃ tu praveśaś cātra jāyate /
analyzed: na kvācid pātakānām tu praveśaḥ ca atra jāyate
translated: Nowhere is there any entry for sins here.

original: evaṃ saṃcintya te sarve pāpiṣṭhāś ca parasparam // / //
analyzed: evam saṃcintya te sarve pāpiṣṭhāḥ ca parasparam
translated: Thus thinking, all those most sinful ones towards each other,

original: kṣipram eva samuddhṛtya vicintya hṛdaye harim /
analyzed: kṣipram eva samuddhṛtya vicintya hṛdaye harim
translated: quickly lifting up, thinking in their hearts about Hari,

analyzed: snātvā revā jale puṇye tāḥ arpitvā pitṛ devatāḥ
translated: having bathed in the sacred waters of the Revā, having offered oblations to the ancestors and deities,

translated: The moon became afflicted with tuberculosis, due to the will of Prajapati.

analyzed: dakṣa śāpa prabhāveṇa nistejāḥ śarvarīpatiḥ
translated: Due to the effect of Daksha's curse, the lord of the night became devoid of lustre.

original: gataḥ pitāmahaṃ somo vepamānaḥ praṇamya ca /
analyzed: gataḥ pitāmaham somaḥ vepamānaḥ praṇamya ca
translated: Shaking with fear, Soma went to the grandfather and bowed down to him.

original: brahmayone namas tubhyaṃ vedagarbha namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: brahma yone namaḥ tubhyam veda garbha namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O Brahma-born, salutations to you, O womb of the Vedas.

analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: sarvatra durlabhā revā triṣu sthāneṣu bhārata /
analyzed: sarvatra durlabhā revā triṣu sthāneṣu bhārata
translated: Reva is difficult to find everywhere, but in three places, O descendant of Bharata.

original: oṃkāre ca bhṛgukṣetre narmadā hy urageśvare // / //
analyzed: oṃkāre ca bhṛgukṣetre narmadā hi urageśvare
translated: At Omkareshvara, in the field of Bhrigu, and in Narmada, O lord of serpents.

analyzed: kāṣṭha vat saṃsthitaḥ somaḥ dhyāyate parameśvaram
translated: Soma remained like a log of wood, meditating on the Supreme Lord.

original: yāvad varṣaśataṃ pūrṇaṃ tāvat tuṣṭo maheśvaraḥ // / //🔽pretyakṣaḥ somanāthasya vṛṣāsana umārdhagaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat varṣa śatam pūrṇam tāvat tuṣṭaḥ maheśvaraḥ  pretyakṣaḥ soma nāthasya vṛṣā āsanaḥ umā ardha gaḥ
translated: For a full hundred years, Maheshvara was pleased.

original: sāṣṭāṅgaṃ praṇato bhūtvā jaya deva namo 'stu te // / //🔽jaya śaṅkara pāpakṛtānta namo jaya īśvara nātha namo 'stu namaḥ /🔽jaya vāsukibhūṣaṇa bhūtapate jaya śūlakapāladharāya namaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa aṣṭāṅgam praṇataḥ bhūtvā jaya deva namaḥ stu te  jaya śaṅkara pāpa kṛtānta namaḥ jaya īśvara nātha namaḥ stu namaḥ  jaya vāsuki bhūṣaṇa bhūtapate jaya śūla kapāla dharāya namaḥ
translated: Having fallen down, the half-body of Uma, seated on a bull, said, Victory to you, O Lord, salutations to you.🔽Victory to Shankara, the destroyer of sins, victory to the Lord, salutations to you.🔽Victory to the ornament of Vasuki, the lord of spirits, victory to the wielder of trident and skull, salutations to you.

original: jaya andhakadehavināśa namo jaya dānavadehavadhāya namaḥ /
analyzed: jaya andhaka deha vināśa namaḥ jaya dānava deha vadhāya namaḥ
translated: Victory to the destroyer of the body of Andhaka, salutations to you, victory to the slayer of the body of the demon, salutations to you.

original: jaya niṣkalasakalakalāya namo jaya kālakalādamanāya namaḥ // / //🔽jaya nīlakaṇṭha umāpate jaya sūkṣmanirañjanaśabda namaḥ /
analyzed: jaya niṣkala sakala kalāya namaḥ jaya kāla kalā damanāya namaḥ  jaya nīlakaṇṭha umāpate jaya sūkṣma nirañjana śabda namaḥ
translated: Victory to the one beyond parts and with parts, victory to the one who controls the parts of time, salutations.🔽Victory to the blue-throated lord of Uma, victory to the subtle one beyond the word of impurity, salutations.

original: jaya ādya anādya ananta namo jaya pāṇipinākatriśūla namaḥ // / //
analyzed: jaya ādya anādya ananta namaḥ jaya pāṇi pināka triśūla namaḥ
translated: Victory to the primordial one, the beginningless one, the infinite one, salutations. Victory to the one with hands, Pinaka and trident, salutations.

analyzed: evam stutaḥ mahādevaḥ soma nāthena pāṇḍava
translated: Thus praised by Somanatha, the great god, O Pandava,

original: tuṣṭas tasya nṛpaśreṣṭha umayā saha śaṅkaraḥ // / //
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ tasya nṛpa śreṣṭhaḥ umayā saha śaṅkaraḥ
translated: was pleased, O best of kings, along with Uma, Shankara.

analyzed: īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Ishvara said:

original: varaṃ varaya bhadraṃ te yat te manasi vartate /
analyzed: varam varaya bhadram te yat te manasi vartate
translated: Choose a boon, may you be fortunate, whatever is in your mind.

analyzed: somaḥ uvāca
translated: Soma said:

analyzed: dakṣa śāpena dagdhaḥ ham kṣīṇa dehaḥ maheśvara
translated: I am burnt by Daksha's curse, my body is emaciated, Maheshvara.

original: pāpapraśamanaṃ deva kuru sarvaṃ mamaiva tu /
analyzed: pāpa praśamanam deva kuru sarvam mama eva tu
translated: O god, please do everything to pacify my sins.

analyzed: maheśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Maheshvara said:

analyzed: bhavat bhakti gṛhītaḥ ham tūṣṭaḥ ca eva umayā saha
translated: I am pleased with your devotion, and with Uma, I am satisfied.

analyzed: niṣpāpaḥ somanāthasya saṃjātaḥ tīrtha sevanāt
translated: Soma has become sinless by serving the holy place of Somanatha.

original: ity uktvāntardadhe devaḥ somo dhyātvā kṣaṇaṃ nṛpa // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā antardadhe devaḥ somaḥ dhyātvā kṣaṇam nṛpa
translated: Having said this, the god disappeared. Soma, the king, meditated for a moment.

original: sthāpayāmāsa liṅgaṃ tu siddhidaṃ prāṇināṃ bhuvi /
analyzed: sthāpayāmāsa liṅgam tu siddhi dam prāṇinām bhuvi
translated: He installed a linga that grants perfection to living beings on earth.

analyzed: sarva duḥkha haram devam brahmahatyā vināśanam
translated: The god who removes all sufferings and destroys the sin of killing a Brahmin.

analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

analyzed: somanātha prabhāvam ca saṃkṣepāt kathayāmi te
translated: I shall tell you in brief about the power of Somanatha.

original: śambaro nāma rājābhūt tasya putras trilocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: śambaraḥ nāma rājā abhūt tasya putraḥ trilocanaḥ
translated: There was a king named Shambara, his son was Trilocana.

analyzed: trilocana sutaḥ kaṇṭhaḥ pāpa niṣṭhaḥ mahā adhamaḥ
translated: Trilocana's son was Kantha, a great sinner devoted to evil.

original: vane vibhramatas tasya mṛgayūthaṃ tv adṛśyata // / //
analyzed: vane vibhramataḥ tasya mṛga yūtham tu adṛśyata
translated: While wandering in the forest, he saw a herd of deer.

analyzed: mṛga yūtham hatam sarvam trilocana sutena ca
translated: The entire herd of deer was killed by Trilocana's son.

original: mṛgarūpī dvijo madhye vicaran nirjane vane // / //
analyzed: mṛga rūpī dvijaḥ madhye vicaran nirjane vane
translated: A twice-born one in the form of a deer was wandering in the deserted forest.

original: tadā hatas tu śastreṇa kaṇṭhena ṛṣisattamaḥ /
analyzed: tadā hataḥ tu śastreṇa kaṇṭhena ṛṣi sattamaḥ
translated: Then Kantha killed the best of sages with a weapon.

analyzed: brahmahatyā yutaḥ kaṇṭhaḥ nistejāḥ vyacarat mahīm
translated: Kantha, with ten thousand sins of killing Brahmins, wandered the earth without energy.

analyzed: vicaran api saṃprāptaḥ narmadā nāga saṃgame  kadamba pāṭalā ākīrṇe bilva nāraṅga śobhite
translated: While wandering, he reached the confluence of Narmada and Nagesa.🔽Filled with kadamba and patala trees, adorned with bilva and naranaga trees.

analyzed: ciñcinī campaka upete agasti taru śobhite
translated: Adorned with chinchina and champaka trees, beautified with agasti trees.

analyzed: unmatta bhṛṅga saṃyukte tathā sarvatra śobhite
translated: Adorned everywhere with maddened bees.

analyzed: citrakaiḥ mṛga mārjāraiḥ siṃhaiḥ sarvatra śūkaraiḥ
translated: With colorful animals, leopards, lions and pigs everywhere.

analyzed: śaśakaiḥ gavayaiḥ yukte śikhaṇḍi rava nādite
translated: with rabbits and gavayas, resounding with the cries of peacocks.

analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ tad vane kaṇṭhaḥ tṛṣā ārtaḥ śrama karṣitaḥ
translated: Afflicted by thirst and fatigue, Kantha entered that forest.

analyzed: snātaḥ revā jale puṇye saṅgame pāpa nāśane
translated: He bathed in the sacred waters of the Revā river at the confluence that destroys sins.

original: patrāṇi ca vicitrāṇi bhakṣayan saha kiṅkaraiḥ /
analyzed: patrāṇi ca vicitrāṇi bhakṣayan saha kiṅkaraiḥ
translated: Eating various leaves with his servants,

analyzed: suptaḥ pādapa chāyāyām śrāntaḥ mṛga vadhena ca
translated: he slept under the shade of a tree, exhausted from killing deer.

analyzed: ānarca parayā bhaktyā soma nātham yudhiṣṭhira
translated: O Yudhiṣṭhira, he worshipped Somanātha with great devotion.

original: pītvā toyaṃ kaṇṭhamātraṃ sarvapāpakṣayaṃkaram // / //🔽tāvat tīrthavare vipraḥ snānārthaṃ saṃgamaṃ prati /
analyzed: pītvā toyam kaṇṭha mātram sarva pāpa kṣayaṃkaram  tāvat tīrtha vare vipraḥ snāna artham saṃgamam prati
translated: Having drunk water up to his neck, which destroys all sins,🔽at that excellent holy place, the brāhmaṇa went to the confluence for bathing.

original: mārgago brāhmaṇo bhūyas tatas tad gatamānasaḥ // / //
analyzed: mārga gaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhūyas tatas tat gata mānasaḥ
translated: On the way, the brāhmaṇa, his mind gone to that place,

original: mārge vṛkṣe samārūḍhā strī caikā ca bhayaṅkarī /
analyzed: mārge vṛkṣe samārūḍhā strī ca ekā ca bhayaṅkarī
translated: saw a fearful woman seated on a tree on the path.

original: uvāca brāhmaṇaṃ sā hi tiṣṭha tiṣṭha dvijottama // / //
analyzed: uvāca brāhmaṇam sā hi tiṣṭha tiṣṭha dvijottama
translated: She said to the brāhmaṇa, Wait, wait, O best of brāhmaṇas.

original: trasto nirīkṣate yāvad diśaḥ sarvā nareśvara /🔽tāvad vṛkṣa samārūḍhāṃ striyaṃ raktāmbarāvṛtām // / //
analyzed: trastaḥ nirīkṣate yāvat diśaḥ sarvāḥ nareśvara  tāvat vṛkṣa samārūḍhām striyam rakta ambara āvṛtām
translated: As he was frightened, he looked in all directions, O lord of men.🔽He saw a woman dressed in red garments seated on a tree.

analyzed: rakta puṣpa dharām vālām raktacandana carcitām
translated: She held red flowers, was young, and smeared with red sandalwood paste.

analyzed: rakta ābharaṇa śobhā āḍhyām pāśa hastām dadarśa ha
translated: and saw her with red ornaments, shining, and a noose in her hand.

analyzed: strī uvāca
translated: The woman said:

original: sandeśaṃ śṛṇu me vipra yadi gacchasi saṃgamam /
analyzed: sandeśam śṛṇu me vipra yadi gacchasi saṃgamam
translated: Listen to my message, O Brahmin, if you are going to the rendezvous.

original: madbhartā tiṣṭhate tatra śīghram eva visarjaya // / //
analyzed: mad bhartā tiṣṭhate tatra śīghram eva visarjaya
translated: My husband is waiting there, send me back quickly.

original: ekākinī ca te bhāryā tiṣṭhate vanamadhyagā /
analyzed: ekākinī ca te bhāryā tiṣṭhate vana madhya gā
translated: And your wife is alone, staying in the middle of the forest.

analyzed: iti ākarṇya gataḥ vipraḥ saṅgamam sura durlabham
translated: Having heard this, the Brahmin went to the rendezvous, difficult to reach even for the gods.

original: vṛkṣachāyāsthitaṃ kaṇṭhaṃ brāhmaṇo hi dadarśa ha /
analyzed: vṛkṣa chāyā sthitam kaṇṭham brāhmaṇaḥ hi dadarśa ha
translated: The Brahmin saw Kantha sitting in the shade of a tree.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brahmin said:

original: vanānte ca mayā dṛṣṭā bālā kamalalocanā // / //🔽raktāmbaradharā tanvī raktacandanarcarcitā /
analyzed: vana ante ca mayā dṛṣṭā bālā kamala locanā  rakta ambara dharā tanvī
translated: At the edge of the forest, I saw a young girl with eyes like lotus petals,🔽wearing red garments, slender, anointed with red sandalwood paste,

analyzed: rakta mālyā su śobhā āḍhyā pāśa hastā mṛga īkṣaṇā
translated: adorned with red garlands, shining, with a noose in her hand, and eyes like a deer.

analyzed: vṛkṣa ārūḍhā avadat vākyam bhartāram preṣayasva mām
translated: She said, 'Send me to my husband.'

analyzed: kaṇṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Kantha said:

original: kasmin sthāne tu viprendra tiṣṭhate mṛgalocanā // / //
analyzed: kasmin sthāne tu vipra indra tiṣṭhate mṛga locanā
translated: O best of Brahmins, where does the deer-eyed one stay?

original: kasya sā kena kāryeṇa etat sarvaṃ vada hi me /
analyzed: kasya sā kena kāryeṇa etat sarvam vada hi me
translated: Whose is she? For what purpose? Tell me all this.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brahmin said:

analyzed: saṃgamāt ardha krośe ca udyāna ante praśobhite
translated: Half a krośa from the rendezvous, in a beautiful garden,

original: tatra tiṣṭhati sā nārī sotkaṇṭhitamanā vibho /
analyzed: tatra tiṣṭhati sā nārī sa utkaṇṭhita manāḥ vibho
translated: O Lord, that woman remained there with a longing heart.

original: tato bhṛtyam uvācedaṃ kaṇṭho rājā yudhiṣṭhira // / //
analyzed: tatas bhṛtyam uvāca idam kaṇṭhaḥ rājā yudhiṣṭhira
translated: Then King Kantha Yudhishthira said this to his servant:

original: pṛccha tvaṃ gaccha kā cāsi āgatā kva gamiṣyasi /
analyzed: pṛccha tvam gaccha kā ca asi āgatā kva gamiṣyasi
translated: Go and ask her who she is and where she has come from and where she is going.

original: tataḥ kṣipraṃ gatas tatra yatra nārī sthitābhavat // / //
analyzed: tatas kṣipram gataḥ tatra yatra nārī sthitā abhavat
translated: Then he quickly went to the place where the woman was standing.

analyzed: vṛkṣa sthām dadṛśe bālām uvāca nṛpa sattama
translated: He saw the young woman standing on the tree and said to the best of kings:

original: tvāṃ rājā pṛcchate bāle kāsi tvaṃ kva gamiṣyasi // / //
analyzed: tvām rājā pṛcchate bāle kā asi tvam kva gamiṣyasi
translated: O young woman, the king asks you who you are and where you are going.

analyzed: strī uvāca
translated: The woman said:

original: gurur ātmavatāṃ śāstā rājā śāstā durātmanām /
analyzed: guruḥ ātmavatām śāstā rājā śāstā durātmanām
translated: The preceptor is the chastiser of those who are self-controlled, the king is the chastiser of the wicked.

analyzed: iha pracchanna pāpānām śāstā vaivasvataḥ yamaḥ
translated: Here, the chastiser of those who sin in secret is Yama, the son of Vivasvat.

analyzed: brahmahatyā asya saṃjātā mṛga rūpa dvija udvadhāt
translated: The sin of killing a Brahmin has arisen for me from killing a bird in the form of a deer.

analyzed: mayā yuktaḥ pi rājā asau muktaḥ tīrtha prabhāvataḥ
translated: Although the king was united with me, he was released by the power of the holy place.

analyzed: atrā ardha krośa mātram vai brahmahatyā na saṃviśet
translated: Brahmahatya (the sin of killing a Brahmin) will not enter within half a krośa of this place.

analyzed: somanātha prabhāvāt ca tīrtham vārāṇasī samam
translated: By the power of Somanatha, this holy place is like Varanasi.

original: gaccha tvaṃ preṣayeḥ kaṇṭhaṃ śīghram eva na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam preṣayeḥ kaṇṭham śīghram eva na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Go and send Kantha quickly, there is no doubt.

original: samastaṃ kathayāmāsa tad vṛttāntaṃ nṛpaṃ prati // / //
analyzed: samastam kathayāmāsa tat vṛttāntam nṛpam prati
translated: told the king the entire account.

analyzed: tasya vākyena rājā asau papāta dharaṇī tale
translated: By his words, the king fell down on the ground.

analyzed: bhṛtyaḥ uvāca
translated: The servant said:

original: kasmāt tvaṃ śocase nātha pūrvajātaṃ śūbhāśubham // / //
analyzed: kasmāt tvam śocase nātha pūrva jātam śūbha aśubham
translated: Why do you grieve, O lord, for the good and bad of past births?

original: ityākarṇya vacas tasya sa rājā tvidam abravīt /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya vacaḥ tasya sa rājā tu idam abravīt
translated: Having heard these words of his, the king said this:

analyzed: prāṇatyāgam karomi atra somanātha samīpatas
translated: I will give up my life here in the presence of Somanatha.

original: śīghram ānīyatāṃ vahṇir indhanāni bahūny api /
analyzed: śīghram ānīyatām vahṇiḥ indhanāni bahūni api
translated: Quickly bring fire and also many pieces of wood.

original: ānītaṃ tatkṣaṇāt sarvaṃ bhṛtyaiḥ svair vaśavartibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: ānītam tad kṣaṇāt sarvam bhṛtyaiḥ svaiḥ vaśa vartibhiḥ
translated: Everything was brought in an instant by his own servants who were under his control.

original: snānaṃ kṛtvā śubhe toye saṃgame pāpanāśane /
analyzed: snānam kṛtvā śubhe toye saṃgame pāpa nāśane
translated: Having bathed in the auspicious water at the confluence that destroys sins,

original: arcitvā parayā bhaktyā somanāthaṃ nareśvara // / //🔽triḥpradakṣiṇakaṃ kṛtvā jvalite jātavedasi /
analyzed: arcitvā parayā bhaktyā somanātham nareśvara  tris pradakṣiṇakam kṛtvā jvalite jātavedasi
translated: and having worshipped Somanatha with great devotion, O lord of men,

original: praviṣṭaḥ kaṇṭharājas tu hṛdi kṛtvā janārdanam // / //
analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ kaṇṭha rājaḥ tu hṛdi kṛtvā janārdanam
translated: having circumambulated three times when the fire was blazing, Kanharaja entered, keeping Janardana in his heart.

analyzed: pīta ambara dharam devam mahā mukuṭa dhāriṇam
translated: The god wearing yellow garments, wearing a great crown,

original: viṣṇor dhyānena cātraiva sugatir me bhavatv iti // / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ dhyānena ca atra eva su gatiḥ me bhavatu iti
translated: by meditating on Vishnu here, may I attain a good state.

original: papāta puṣpavṛṣṭiś ca sādhu sādhu nṛpātmaja /
analyzed: papāta puṣpa vṛṣṭiḥ ca sādhu sādhu nṛpa ātmaja
translated: And a rain of flowers fell, Well done, well done, prince!

analyzed: āścaryam atulam dṛṣṭvā nirīkṣa ca parasparam
translated: And looked at each other in wonder.

original: hutaṃ taiḥ pāvake bhṛtyair hṛdi dhyātvā gadādharam /
analyzed: hutam taiḥ pāvake bhṛtyaiḥ hṛdi dhyātvā gadādharam
translated: The servants offered oblations into the fire, meditating on the mace-bearer in their hearts.

analyzed: vimāna sthāḥ divam sarve saṅgatāḥ pāṇḍu nandana
translated: All of them, O son of Pandu, ascended celestial vehicles and went to heaven together.

analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

analyzed: somanātha prabhāvaḥ yam śṛṇuṣva ekamanāḥ nṛpa
translated: O king, listen with a concentrated mind to the power of Somanatha.

original: aṣṭamyāṃ ca caturdaśyāṃ sarvakāle śubhe dine // / //
analyzed: aṣṭamyām ca caturdaśyām sarva kāle śubhe dine
translated: On the eighth and fourteenth lunar days, and on any auspicious day,

analyzed: viśeṣāt śukla pakṣe ca sūryavāreṇa saptamī
translated: especially on the seventh lunar day in the bright fortnight, on a Sunday,

original: upoṣya yo naro bhaktyā rātrau kurvīta jāgaram // / //
analyzed: upoṣya yaḥ naraḥ bhaktyā rātrau kurvīta jāgaram
translated: a man who fasts and keeps awake at night with devotion,

analyzed: pañcāmṛtena gavyena snāpayet parameśvaram
translated: should bathe the Supreme Lord with the five sweet substances and cow's milk,

analyzed: śrīkhaṇḍa lepanam kuryāt puṣpa dhūpa ādikam tathā
translated: apply sandalwood paste as unguent, and offer flowers, incense, etc.,

original: ghṛtena bodhayed dīpaṃ gītaṃ nṛtyaṃ ca kārayet /
analyzed: ghṛtena bodhayet dīpam gītam nṛtyam ca kārayet
translated: light a lamp with ghee, and arrange for singing and dancing.

analyzed: somavāreṇa ca aṣṭamyām prabhāte pūjayet dvijam
translated: On the eighth lunar day coinciding with a Sunday, he should worship a Brahmin in the morning,

analyzed: ātmavantam jita krodham dvija nindā vivarjitam
translated: who is self-controlled, has conquered anger, is free from censuring Brahmins,

analyzed: sarva aṅga ruciram śāntam sva dāra paripālakam
translated: whose entire body is beautiful, who is peaceful, who protects his own wife,

analyzed: gāyatrīm paṭhamānam ca vikarma rahitam sadā
translated: who recites the Gayatri mantra, and who is always free from forbidden activities.

original: punar bhūrvṛṣalī śūdrī vartate yasya mandire // / //
analyzed: punar bhūḥ vṛṣalī śūdrī vartate yasya mandire

analyzed: tathā eva paśyatā rājan revā jalam anuttamam

analyzed: hāsyam kṛtam yamena atha utthitam liṅgam uttamam

analyzed: tatas tadā hi rāja indra vāc u vācā śarīriṇī
translated: Then, O lord of kings, an unembodied voice spoke:

analyzed: yamahāsam idam tīrtham khyātim yāsyati sarvadā

analyzed: snāpayitvā śivam tatra yamaḥ svargam jagāma ha

analyzed: yamahāse tu rāja indra jita krodhaḥ jita indriyaḥ

analyzed: viśeṣāt āśvine māsi kṛṣṇa pakṣe caturdaśīm
translated: especially on the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight in the month of Ashvina,

analyzed: upoṣya parayā bhaktyā sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate

analyzed: ca a drohya drohaṇe tathā

analyzed: snāna mātreṇa tat ca eva naśyet pāpam anekadhā

translated: One would not see the world of Yama, O son of Pandu, one would not abandon.

analyzed: kṛṣṇa ajina pradānena tiladhenu pradānataḥ

analyzed: kanyām vastram ajām gām vai mahiṣīm athavā aśvinīm

analyzed: aurṇa vastra dvayam kāryam loha varṇam ca veṣṭitam

analyzed: dāpayet dharmarājāya prīyatām me dvijottama

analyzed: raudrā vaitaraṇī ca iti kumbhīpākaḥ su dāruṇaḥ

translated: Thus ends the one hundred eighth chapter in the Skanda Purana, Revakhund, describing the greatness of Yamahasa.

analyzed: guhyāt guhyataram tīrtham na ākhyātam kasyacid mayā

analyzed: vihaṅgaḥ gacchate nā eva bhittvā śūlam su dāruṇam

analyzed: tasya utpattim samāsena kathayāmi nṛpa ātmaja

original: tena cograṃ tapas taptaṃ gaṅgāmbhasi tu bhārata /
analyzed: tena ca ugram tapaḥ taptam gaṅgā ambhasi tu bhārata
translated: And by him, O Bharata, severe austerities were performed in the waters of the Ganges.

analyzed: prāṇāyāmena ca atiṣṭhat praviṣṭaḥ jāhnavī jale
translated: And he stood in complete control of breath, having entered the waters of the Jahnavi.

original: pūrṇe ca dvādaśe varṣe niṣkrānto jalamadhyataḥ /
analyzed: pūrṇe ca dvādaśe varṣe niṣkrāntaḥ jala madhyataḥ

analyzed: bhikṣā arthe ca āgataḥ grāmam nāvi tatra eva tiṣṭhatī

analyzed: tatra dṛṣṭā para utsṛṣṭā bālā tena manoramā

analyzed: tām ca dṛṣṭvā sa kāma ārtaḥ uvāca madhura akṣaram

analyzed: mām ramasva adya tvam kā asi kāmukam mṛga locane

analyzed: nāvā ārūḍhe nadī tīre mama citta pramāthinī

original: evamuktā tu sā tena praṇamya ṛṣisattamam /
analyzed: evam uktā tu sā tena praṇamya ṛṣi sattamam

analyzed: aham jñāna balāt bhadre jānāmi tava sambhavam

analyzed: kaivarta putrikā na tvam rāja putrī hi sundarī
translated: You are not the daughter of a fisherman, but a beautiful princess.

analyzed: kanyā uvāca
translated: The maiden said:

analyzed: kaḥ pitā kathyatām brahman kasya aham udara udbhavā
translated: Who is my father? Tell me, O Brahmana, whose womb did I issue from?

analyzed: kasmin vaṃśe prajātā aham kaivarta tanayā katham
translated: In what family was I born? How did I become the daughter of a fisherman?

analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

analyzed: kathayāmi ca te tātam yam tvam mām paripṛcchasi

analyzed: vasu nāmā ca rājā abhūt soma vaṃśe pratāpavān
translated: There was a powerful king named Vasu in the lunar dynasty.

analyzed: jambūdvīpa adhipaḥ bhadre śatru saṃtrāsanaḥ tathā
translated: O blessed one, he was the lord of Jambudvipa and the terror of enemies.

original: śatāni sapta bhāryāṇāṃ putrāṇāṃ tu daśaiva hi // / //
analyzed: śatāni sapta bhāryāṇām putrāṇām tu daśa eva hi
translated: He had seven hundred wives and ten sons.

analyzed: dharmeṇa pālitāḥ lokāḥ śiva pūjā rataḥ sadā
translated: The people were righteously protected by him, and he was always devoted to the worship of Shiva.

analyzed: mlecchāḥ tasya virodhena śākadvīpa nivāsinaḥ
translated: The Mlechchhas, who lived in Shakadvipa, were hostile to him.

analyzed: teṣām ca sādhana arthāya gatā ullaṅghya mahā udadhim
translated: For their subjugation, he crossed the great ocean and went there.

original: saṃyuktaḥ putrabhṛtyaiś ca pauruṣe mahati sthitaḥ // / //🔽sagrāmas taiḥ samārabdhaścārvaṅgi vasunā saha /🔽jitā mlecchāḥ samastāś ca vasunā hyavanībhṛtā // / //
analyzed: saṃyuktaḥ putra bhṛtyaiḥ ca pauruṣe mahati sthitaḥ  sa grāmaḥ taiḥ samārabdhaḥ cārvaṅgi vasunā saha  jitāḥ mlecchāḥ samastāḥ ca vasunā hi avanībhṛtā
translated: He was accompanied by his sons and servants, and was full of manliness.🔽O beautiful-limbed one, with them he attacked the villages along with Vasu.🔽All the Mlechchhas were conquered by the king Vasu.

analyzed: kara dāḥ te kṛtāḥ tena sa bhṛtya bala vāhanāḥ
translated: He made them pay tribute along with their servants, armies and vehicles.

original: pradhānā tasya mahiṣī tava mātā mṛgekṣaṇā // / //
analyzed: pradhānā tasya mahiṣī tava mātā mṛga īkṣaṇā
translated: Your mother, the chief queen with eyes like a deer, is his mother.🔽O beautiful one, I am the son of that king, born of your mother.

original: pravāsasthe ca bhūpāle saṃjātā ca rajasvalā /🔽nārīṇāṃ tu sadā kāle manmatho hy adhiko bhavet // / //🔽viśeṣeṇa ṛtau kāle bhidyate kāmasāyakaiḥ /
analyzed: pravāsa sthe ca bhūpāle saṃjātā ca rajasvalā  nārīṇām tu sadā kāle manmathaḥ hi adhikaḥ bhavet  viśeṣeṇa ṛtau kāle bhidyate kāma sāyakaiḥ
translated: And when the king was away, she became menstruating.🔽For women, at all times, passion is always greater.🔽Especially during the menstrual period, she is pierced by the arrows of desire.

original: manmathena tu saṃtaptācintayat sā śubhekṣaṇā // / //🔽dūtaṃ sampreṣayāmyadya vasurājasamīpataḥ /

translated: Tormented by passion, the beautiful-eyed one thought...🔽I will send a messenger to King Vasu today.

original: vyāhṛtaḥ satvaro dūto gaccha tvaṃ nṛpasannidhau // / //
analyzed: vyāhṛtaḥ sa tvaraḥ dūtaḥ gaccha tvam nṛpa sannidhau
translated: The messenger was told, Go quickly to the king's presence...

analyzed: dūtaḥ uvāca
translated: The messenger said:

analyzed: para rājye vasuḥ devi gataḥ rājā dviṣ anta kṛt
translated: O queen, King Vasu has gone to another kingdom, the destroyer of enemies.

original: tatra gantuṃ na śakyeta jalayantrair vinā śubhe // / //
analyzed: tatra gantum na śakyeta jalayantraiḥ vinā śubhe
translated: It is not possible to go there without water machines, O auspicious one...

translated: By his words, the woman, afflicted by passion, became distressed...

original: rājñīṃ dṛṣṭvā sakhī brūte kasmāt tvaṃ parikhidyase /
analyzed: rājñīm dṛṣṭvā sakhī brūte kasmāt tvam parikhidyase

analyzed: lekhaḥ yam preṣyatām devi śuka haste yathā tathā
translated: O queen, let this letter be sent by a parrot as it may be...

analyzed: uttaram dīyatām tāta kṛṣṇadvaipāyanasya ca

analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu taiḥ sarvaiḥ bhagavān ca parāśaraḥ
translated: Thus addressed by all of them, the illustrious Parashara,

analyzed: uvāca sva ātmajam vyāsam ṛṣibhiḥ yat cikīrṣitam

analyzed: na icchanti dakṣiṇe kūle vrata bhaṅga bhayāt suta

analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca

analyzed: stotram jagāda sahasā tam nibodha janeśvara

analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca

analyzed: jaya bhairava deha vilīna kare jaya devi pitāmaha sannamite

analyzed: jaya jaya loka samasta kṛta ābharaṇe jaya duḥkha daridra vināśa kare

translated: Then, knowing that Vyasa was in a swoon, the gods,

translated: On the full moon day, O best of kings, one should bathe with devotion.

analyzed: mantra uktena vidhānena kṛtvā pāpa kṣayaṃkaram

translated: One should recite the Yajur Veda, Atharva Veda, and Gāyatrī and obtain everything.

analyzed: na ayam bhṛta catur vidyaḥ sarva āśī sarva vikrayī

analyzed: mandiram parayā bhaktyā athavā parameśvaram

analyzed: pāmarāḥ te pi asaṃkhyātāḥ nāke gacchanti pārthiva

analyzed: saure caṇḍeśvare loke pure vai cakrapāṇinaḥ
translated: In the world of the sun, in the city of the discus-holder,

analyzed: sa bhuṅkte sva icchayā lokam vyāsatīrtha prabhāvataḥ

analyzed: puruṣāḥ parayā bhaktyā veda śāstra artha cintakāḥ

analyzed: dvīpeśvaram mahādevam saṃsmaranti gṛhe sthitāḥ

analyzed: rks adhyāya

translated: Having obtained the fruit of a horse sacrifice, the truth spoken by the Lord,

original: śrutvā māhātmyam atulaṃ yo naro hi jitendriyaḥ // / //
analyzed: śrutvā māhātmyam atulam yaḥ naraḥ hi jita indriyaḥ
translated: Having heard the incomparable greatness, if a man has conquered his senses,

analyzed: dānam kuryāt tadā tasya sarva kāma artha siddhayaḥ
translated: Then he should make a gift, for the accomplishment of all desired objects.

analyzed: pustakam pūjayitvā tu dhūpa dīpaka candanaiḥ
translated: Having worshipped the book with incense, lamps and sandal paste,

original: dānaṃ tatra prakartavyaṃ brāhmaṇāṃś cāpi pūjayet /
analyzed: dānam tatra prakartavyam brāhmaṇān ca api pūjayet
translated: One should give gifts there and worship the Brahmins.

original: śravaṇena tu dānena suprītā narmadā bhavet // / //
analyzed: śravaṇena tu dānena su prītā narmadā bhavet
translated: By listening to the gift, Narmada would be very pleased.

original: tīrthe tīrthe ca kathitaṃ tatpūrvaṃ pāṇḍunandana /
analyzed: tīrthe tīrthe ca kathitam tat pūrvam pāṇḍu nandana
translated: O son of Pandu, it has been told at every holy place.

original: puṇyaṃ śrutvā tu māhātmyaṃ tad dānenaiva pāṇḍava // / //
analyzed: puṇyam śrutvā tu māhātmyam tat dānena eva pāṇḍava
translated: Having heard the meritorious greatness, by that very gift, O Pandava...

original: etasmāt kāraṇād dānaṃ śrutvā dānaṃ hi kāraṇam /
analyzed: etasmāt kāraṇāt dānam śrutvā dānam hi kāraṇam
translated: For this reason, having heard the gift, the gift is the cause.

analyzed: tat śrutvā rāja śārdūlaḥ mārkaṇḍeyasya bhāṣitam
translated: Having heard that, the best of kings, the speech of Markandeya...

original: arghaṃ dattvā yathānyāyaṃ pūjayitvā ṛṣīn sadā /
analyzed: argham dattvā yathānyāyam pūjayitvā ṛṣīn sadā
translated: Having offered the fee according to the rules and always worshipping the sages,

original: aśvairgajais tathā rathair bhrātṛbhiḥ saha dharmarāṭ // / //
analyzed: aśvaiḥ gajaiḥ tathā rathaiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ saha dharmarāj
translated: The king of Dharma, with his brothers, on horses, elephants and chariots...

analyzed: tīrtha yātrām cakāra āśu narmadāyām yudhiṣṭhira
translated: Yudhishthira quickly undertook a pilgrimage to Narmada.

analyzed: uttare dakṣiṇe tīre snāna pāna avagāhanam
translated: On the northern and southern banks, bathing, drinking and immersing...

original: iti śrīskandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe yudhiṣṭhiramārkaṇḍeyasaṃvāde narmadācaritravarṇano nāma ṣoḍaśādhikaśatatamo 'dhyāyaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī skandapurāṇe revākhaṇḍe yudhiṣṭhira mārkaṇḍeya saṃvāde narmadācaritravarṇanaḥ nāma ṣoḍaśa adhika śatatamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter in the Revakhanda of Skanda Purana, describing the story of Narmada in the dialogue between Yudhishthira and Markandeya.

analyzed: iti śrī skandapurāṇasya revākhaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Revakhanda of the Skanda Purana.
